loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en:
Zachariah was born in 1955. He is married and a father of five children. Since childhood, he has faced many obstacles in life because his parents were poor and could not send him to school after grade seven. Instead he began doing odd jobs in the neighborhood to take care of himself and his younger siblings.

He has decided that his children should not suffer from poverty like he has. With this goal, he joined GHAPE 2002. He has borrowed and repaid loans amounting to $500. He invested these loans in fattening pigs and rearing fowl for sale. The profits from these loans provided for the educational needs of his children. He also purchased a piece of land and built the foundation for a three-room house. He is very proud of what he has been able to accomplish with GHAPE’s help and is presently the treasurer of his GHAPE centre.

Given this loan, Zacariah plans to buy nails, slabs, pigs, and piglets. He will also expand the enclosure for his pigs. He wants to concentrate mostly on pig farming because will generate the most income. The demand for pigs and piglets is high in his community. He believes his business will be successful because the piglet he purchased with his first loan is still producing more piglets. He has had a lot of experience in this field, has the land to rear the animals, and has a farm which produces enough food for the animals to feed on. The GHAPE trainings are going to help his business succeed because he is going to the skills he learned into practice.

He plans to repay this loan in 24 months with the first repayment beginning four months after disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, nails, piglets as well as pay for labour

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamed, 19 years old, is single. He lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Despite his young age, Mohamed started his own business in order to help his parents improve the livelihood of the family. Mohamed opened a small kiosk where he sells fresh fruit juices. Now, he needs a loan of $1,000 so he can purchase more raw materials for his stand. He would also like purchase a small refrigerator. With the summer season, there is an increased demand for fresh juices.

This is the first time Mohamed has requested a loan from A. Majmoua. He heard about the institution and microlending through word of mouth.

loans.use: To purchase a small fridge and raw material for his fresh juice kiosk

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla lives in the Anexo el Riguero neighborhood. She is a 34-year-old married mother of four, high school age children. Her husband works as a taxi cab driver, and provides for the family. Ms. Karla O. owns a general store and sells cosmetics from home. She has been in business for 7 years. She got started with her own money. She had always dreamt of having her own business because she used to work at a restaurant from early in the morning to late in the evening, which was very exhausting. Now that she has achieved one of her goals, every day is a challenge for her to keep growing. With this loan that she is requesting, she will purchase staple grains, cosmetics, and fragrances.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Karla habita en el barrio Anexo el Riguero, tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, y tiene cuatros hijos que están estudiando en la secundaria, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi y lleva los alimentos para su familia, doña Karla tiene una pulpería y vende cosméticos en su hogar, tiene siete años de estar en las ventas, empezó con capital propios, ella siempre soñó con tener su propio negocio ya que antes trabajaba en un comedor, desde muy temprano hasta la noche y era muy cansado, ahora que logró uno de sus objetivos, cada día que pasa es un reto para seguir creciendo, con el dinero que esta solicitando es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos, cosméticos y perfumes.

loans.use: Purchase fragrances and cosmetics

loans.name: Vinicio Policarpio

texts.es: Vinicio en la actualidad es encargado de producción de una empresa de serigrafía, desde hace mas de 2 años él se dedica a la fabricacion de toda clase de playeras y trabajos de impresión en serigrafia.  Con la experiencia y conocimiento que él tiene, ahora él quiere poner su propio negocio de serigrafía y por eso necesita el préstamo.  El esta dispuesto a trabajar duro y seguir luchando por la vida.  Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad y llegar a convertirse en un profesional de éxito.  En la actualidad él esta soltero, pero es una persona muy formal y responsable.
texts.en:
Vinicio is currently in charge of production at a printing company, for the last 2 years he had worked creating t-shirts other printing materials. With his experience and knowledge he wants to set up his own printing business so he needs a loan. He is willing to work hard to progress. His dream is to go to College and turn into a successful professional. He is currently single but is a very formal and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a printing business

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 32 años de edad, estudió sólo hasta el quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de dos hijos, vive en la Av. Jesús Nº 194, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “La Ilaveñita”.

En un inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar más ropa  de la ciudad de Desaguadero y vender en Arequipa. Desde los 19 años de edad se inició con la compra y venta de ropa. A los 24 años tuvo su pareja y continuó con su negocio, pero no pudo continuar sus estudios superiores por que tuvo su primer hijo y tenía que trabajar más.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará mas mercadería como: una docena de pantalones, dos docenas de casacas, juegos de ropa deportiva, etc. 

Su gran deseo es mejorar, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32, went to 5th grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has two children and lives on No. 194 Jesus Ave., District of Ilave, province of El Collao, Puno and she is a founder member of the community bank “La Ilaveñita”. At the beginning, with a $100 loan she raised capital to purchase clothing from Desaguadero and sell it in Arequipa. Since she was 19 she started buying and selling clothes. At 24, she met her partner and continued with the business, she wasn’t able to continue with professional studies because she had her son and she had to work even harder. With the $175 loan, to be repaid in three months, she will buy merchandise: a dozen pants, 2 dozen jackets, sport sets, etc. Her great wish is to get better, see her business grow and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing merchandise

loans.name: Masorie Progressive Union Group

texts.en:
This is Humu S. K., Fatmata K., Fatmata M., Brima M. and Adama K.. They named their group Masorie Progressive Union. They are local entrepreneurs from the village of Masorie. They sometimes come to Makeni, about fifteen miles from Masori, to sell their goods. This is the second time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one in the group received a loan of 500,000 LE. That loan created meaningful impacts in lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a loan of 700,000 LE each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Humu (right) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-eight years of age. She was born in the village called Sanda Taindarim about thirty miles from Makeni and fifteen miles from Masori. Today, she is married and living in Masori village. Her and her husband have two children, both of whom are attending schools in Freetown. Her husband serves as Section Chief for the people of Masori. His duties include hearing and settling minor disputes between members of the community.

Humu sells palm oil, rice and other locally produced items in the Masori village. She has been in this business for over ten years now. With this new loan, she will expand her business. She will be able to buy about ten to fifteen barters of palm oil (five gallons make up a barter). A barter of palm oil costs 30,000 LE. She will then choose to either sell in Masori village or take them to Makeni depending on the where she can get better profit.

To date, she has not encountered any great challenges worth noting. Business is doing well and she loves and enjoys it. To Humu and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as saving some for emergencies.

loans.use: To increase her stock of palm oil

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D. believes that “discipline is the backbone of progress.” She adds that a man who is undisciplined is a man without ambitions. Marcelina aims to have a better life someday and so prays and works hard to achieve her goals.

Marcelina, 36 and married to Joel D., a farmer, have three children: Jomar – 14 years old, in junior high school; Jonalyn – 13 years old, a high school sophomore, and Joel - 2 years old. She considers herself fortunate to have intelligent children who can help their family.

To assist her husband in their farming business, Marcelina raises hogs. At present, she is raising two hogs and hopes to generate a 50% net return on her investment in order to increase the number she can raise in the coming months. At the moment, to improve her business Marcelina is requesting a loan to support her hogs’ feed supply and provide financial assistance to their modest rice farm.

She dreams that in the near future, she will be able to send all of her children to post-secondary school.

loans.use: To purchase hogs' feed and farm inputs (fertilizers, seeds, etc.).

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana María R. y su esposo el señor Manuel Paz tienen ya mas de nueve años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada, Juguetes y Electrónica.
Ellos desean invertir más en mercancía para tener variedad de artículos, ya este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
El negocio le trabajan entre los dos cada uno se pone en distintas puntos de la ciudad y así poder generar más ingreso.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María R. and her husband Mr. Manuel Paz have spent more than nine years selling used clothes, toys, and electronics. They want to invest in merchandise so that they will have a variety of products because this business is the source of income for their family. They each work in the business in different parts of the city, and, in this way, they earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas trabaja de transportista asalariado manejando un taxi en la ciudad de La Paz; es viudo y es una persona  de la tercera edad que vive solo con el apoyo de sus hijos que ya son independientes.  Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona Las Lagunas de la Ciudad de El Alto.

En este momento Tomas vive en alquiler y el préstamo que ahora solicita será utilizado para comprar un garaje pre-fabricado y ubicarlo en su terreno, donde hay una habitación construida que Tomás planea utilizar como dormitorio y  de esa forma podrá vivir con mayor tranquilidad pues podrá guardar el taxi en un lugar seguro por las noches y no tener que caminar para llegar a su hogar y al mismo tiempo ahorrar el costo de alquiler que paga.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro,; el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Tomas works as a wage-earning taxi driver in the city of La Paz; he is a widower and lives alone in his old age though he is supported by his children who are independent. His home is located in the Lagunas zone in the city of El Alto. Currently, Tomas rents his home and this loan will be used to buy a prefabricated garage which he can place on his land where he already has a small edifice built. Tomas will use this as his bedroom and therefore be able to live more calmly since he will be able to keep his taxi in a secure place at night and not have to walk to his home; he will also be able to save on rent. This is his second loan from Impro; his punctual payments on his previous loan make it easy to approve him for this one.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a prefabricated garage to keep the taxi he drives

loans.name: Ni Putu Eka Yulianti

texts.id: Hidup di Desa , membuat Putu Eka Yulianti membuka usaha warung di depan rumahnya. Jalan didepan rumahnya tembus ke Perumnas Polisi, membuat warungnya cukup ramai dikunjungi oleh ibu-ibu disekitar rumahnya. Eka sudah ikut bergabung dengan Yayasan Dinari di KWT Tiing Gading, sudah dua kali periode dan pembayaran dilakukan setiap bulan dengan jangka waktu 12 bulan.Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Eka membeli barang dagangan untuk memenuhi warungnya . Setiap subuh Eka pergi kepasar Negara untuk membeli barang dagangan seperti sayur mayur ,ikan dan daging mentah dan lain-lain. Eka membuaka warungnya dari pagi hari jam 6.00 sampai sore hari jam 18.00. Eka juga mempunyai tanah untuk ditanami padi, dan kalau sudah musim menanam, Eka menutup warungnya disiang hari untuk pergi kesawah dan ikut menanam dengan suaminya.Setelah pulang Eka kembali membuka warungnya sampai sore hari . Selain sayur mayur, Eka juga menjual berbagai kebutuhan sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.50.000,- perhari. Keuntungannya dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya ,dan juga cita-cita anaknya yang ingin mencari polisi karena itu Eka harus banyak menabung untuk bisa memenuhi keinginan anaknya agar bisa menjadi polisi.. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari , Eka akan menambah modal usahanya dan memperbanyak isi warungnya .

loans.use: to be capital to increase the merchadise

loans.name: Nueva Generación Group

texts.es: El grupo "Nueva Generación" esta representado por Margarita y compuesto por 14 miembros que ensu mayoría se dedican a la venta decomidas rapidas en todo tipo de acontecimiento, hay quienes tienen su pensión y otras venden carne de cerdo al por mayor. Dentro del amabito comercial existe gran competencia de ofertas y demandas pero la buena calidad de lacomida y su experiencia hacen que las socias tengan ingreso diarios para el sustento de sus familias. El credito esta destinado a la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejprar la calidad de su comida y la rapidez de la atencion de los clientes. Una Mayoria de los socios (as) van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando reponsabilidad y cumplimiento en su pagos.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Generación" group is represented by Margarita and made up of 14 members who for the most part sell fast foods at all types of events, some are retired and others sell pork wholesale. They have a lot of competition but the good quality of their food and their experience mean that the members have enough daily revenue to support their families. The loan will be used to buy ingredients and tools to improve the quality of their food and the speed with which they can serve their customers. Most of the members are in their third loan cycle and have proven responsibility in repaying their previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Saboat

texts.en:
J. Saboat, thanks to her previous loans from MicroInvest, is able to carry on her existing business of selling material. Saboat sells the expensive national dress material, which is a required attribute for each Tajik young woman. In keeping with the Tajik traditions. every young woman should bring as heritage the material for national dresses making. Saboat works with the direct suppliers so she sells at lower prices than those at the bazaar.

Saboat applies to Kiva for a business support loan of 2000 TJS to import new material so as to increase her business turnover. She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To import the national dress material for resale

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en: Vaelua I., 74, is married with seven children.  She has five years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public, two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 130 Tala (~$45 US).  SPBD loans are Vaelua’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knife, fertilizer, axe and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
T. Félicienne est née le 03 juin 1971 à  KARI MAMA dans le Département de l’Atacora au Nord du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée à KOLA Joachin chauffeur de profession. Félicienne est mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons, tous scolarisés et à la charge de leur père. Félicienne et sa famille vit au quartier LOM-NAVA à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Félicienne vend des tubercules d'igname et de l'oignon devant son domicile. Félicienne a eu déjà trois crédits de la part de ALIDé pour développer son activité. Félicienne rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour développer d'avantage son activité et la diversifier à la vente de haricot, Félicienne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Félicienne was born on June 3, 1971 in MAMA, in Atacora County in northern Benin. She is married to KOLA Joachin, a chauffeur by profession, and is the mother of four children (2 girls and 2 boys), all in school and supported by their father. Félicienne and her family live in the LOM-NAVA district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She sells yam tubers and onions in front of her home. She has already had three loans from ALIDÉ to develop her business. Félicienne has repaid her loans. To improve her business and to diversify it through the sale of beans, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDÉ. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 50-kg sacks of yam tubers, a 50-kg sack of onions, and 50-kg sack of beans

loans.name: Mara

texts.es:
MARA R. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “NUESTRA SEÑORA DE LA ESPERANZA” su domicilio está ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano PEDRO PORTILLO Mz. I, Lt. 12 Distrito de Yarinacocha, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos, su esposo vende queso a domicilio y es taxista.

	Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invirtió comprando quesos, para venderlos a sus vecinos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,800.00 Nuevos Soles, dará mantenimiento a su automóvil y comprará llantas, aceite, repuestos para su motor, y todo lo necesario para que el vehículo funcione sin problemas, ya que es la herramienta de trabajo que ella tiene junto a su esposo.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos, los 3 años que viene trabajando le ha permitido implementar su negocio,  es una gran ayuda que me ha permitido seguir adelante.. remarcó.
texts.en:
Maria R. R. belongs to the Our Lady of Hope cooperative bank. She lives in the Pedro Portillo settlement in the district of Yarinacocha. She is 40 years old, has 3 children, and her husband sells cheese door-to-door and drives a taxi. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the purchase of cheeses to sell to her neighbors. With this loan of 2,800.00 soles, she will maintain her car and buy tires, oil, engine replacement parts, and all the other necessary items so that it runs problem-free, as this is the tool her and her husband use for their work. She thanks Manuela Ramos for the 3 years she has been working with them, as the experience has allowed her to outfit her business. She remarked: “it has been a great deal of help, and has allowed me to continue to get ahead”.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tires, oil, replacement parts, and maintenance for her car.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Aristides M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de bisuterías como cargadores de baterías, anteojos, relojes, controles de televisores, entre otros.

El señor Aristides ha decidido acudir a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de las bisuterías con el fin de continuar comercializándolas en su localidad en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market, in the city of Managua, Aristides M. sells miscellaneous products such as battery chargers, glasses, clocks, television controls, and other items. Aristides has decided to come to Ceprodel for a loan to buy jewelry to sell in his location the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
A medium-sized wooden house belongs to Khun N., age 29, and she has established her own family there in the Province of Pursat for years. She currently plants a few crops on her land near her house to earn a living, while her husband helps be responsible for the family by working as a barber. Khun N. is now blessed with two kids who are pupils in the local school.

Khun N. is applying for a loan of $750 and will be using most of loan to buy pig feed and piglets to raise. With the remainder of the loan she will repair her old house that is frequently having problems.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets to raise and to repair her house

loans.name: Buguma Batega Hawa Group

texts.en: B. Hawa is a leader of Baguma Women's group. She is thirty-six years old, married with five children of whom four are going to school. She is looking after four dependents of whom two are schooling. She deals with poultry rearing, and she has been in this busines for five years. She needs medicines for her poultry; she also needs feeds, etc. Therefore she is using this loan to purchase chicks to add to the number of poultry she has, feed, and drugs for her poultry. She is a hard-working and courageous business lady whose dream is to obtain a motorcycle for daily income generation.

loans.use: To purchase chicks to add to the number of poultry she has, also feed and drugs for her poultry

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Samaritana Group

texts.es: el grupo de mujeres la SAMARITANA esta integrado por seis persona que realizan la misma actividad economica ya que son miembros de la misma familia que viene trabajando mas de diez años  en la elaboracion de canastas de plasticos ser un grupo de mujeres muy sencillos y trabajadora con el fin de mejora el nivel de vida de su familia ellas necesitan el apollo de la institucion para incrementar su capital ya que se aproxima en el mes de septiembre la feria de la comunidad y como las fistas patrias.
texts.en:
The Samaritana Group of Women is comprised of six members who are all in the same line of business because they are related to one another. For over 10 years, they have produced baskets made of plastic. They are a simple group of hardworking women who want to improve the living standards of their families.

They have requested assistance from the institution to increase their capital, since the month of September is approaching, when the community fair and patron saint holidays take place.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona E. is currently in the business of selling bread, sweet patatoes, beans, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell. Thirty years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Amanallah Group

texts.en:
Amanallah, the leader of Amanallah Group, is married and has three children. With hard work he formed a group of four members, each one of them busy with different jobs. Amanallah has a metal-working business. H. has a general store, while Meir Ways has a tailoring shop. Pary Gull is in the carpet weaving business. Since they all wanted to build and expand their businesses, they formed the Amanallah Group so they could request a group loan. 

Each member of this group request the loan to further their work and be a good client for Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company).

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband and one son. Her son is studying in pre-primary school.

Mrs. L. and her husband, Mr. Kumar L., opened a grocery shop two years ago. They sell different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, paddy and noodles. Mrs. L. is asking for a loan of Rs. 15,000 in order to buy different types of grocery items for the business. She plans to use the additional income to provide for a better education for her son.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Dony

texts.es: La señora Dony, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Vendedoras de Villa Universitaria”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 02 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.Lleva 02 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. Dony se inicio, con un capital de 300.00. Tuvo que pasar por altas y bajas, para llegar a ser una pequeña empresaria y administrar su negocio y generar sus propios ingresos, sin dar cuentas a nadie. Con su esfuerzo y vigor, llego a implementar ahora su bodega, es muy conocida por sus clientes en el barrio donde vive y sus ventas diarias son buenas. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su misma casa.Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos, insumos para el aseo personal, gaseosas en paquetes y productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela. Dony, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma, manifiesta su mas grande agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.

loans.use: Comprará abarrotes.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 47 years old, is married, and is the father of five children, all of whom are in school. Solomon, as he is popularly called, is very hardworking and dedicated to his business. For him to be focused and stable he has to shun unnecessary things that retard his family and his business growth.

In taking care of his family, Solomon deals in video, audio music, and movie discs, a business he has done for twelve years. He also sells polythene (polyethylene) bags to augment his profit. He buys stock from Nigeria and spends almost a week or two before he returns to Ghana.

Solomon dreams of expanding his business by renting a store so that he can stock his shop to attract customers. He would be grateful for your assistance to realize this dream of his.

loans.use: To buy video discs, African movies, foreign movies, etc., in bulk

loans.name: Mario Waldemar

texts.es: Don Mario V. tiene 21 años de edad, es casado de oficios Artesano,  “Elaboración de calzado”, habita junto  con su esposa, él y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un  Taller, llevan 4 años de laborar  su residencia que se encuentra en el  Caserío Xetinimit de la  Aldea Nimasac, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Craftsmanship - Shoemaking Mario V., 21, is a married craftsman. He lives with his wife who does the same kind of work as he. They have a workshop and have worked for the past 4 years. They live in Xetinimit homestead, Nimasac village, Totonicapán department, Guatemala, Currently, demand for their products has increased but their economic capabilities are insufficient to meet demand. For this reason, he has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request a loan which will be used to buy prime materials in order to increase sales hoping thereby to see his family get ahead and have imporoved living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es: Doña Hilda G.  es una mujer esforzada, madre soltera de dos hijos, ella trabaja en servicios domésticos desde hace ocho años, lo difícil ha sido lograr la confianza de sus patrones, su casa es pequeña y falta repellarla, su piso es de suelo, el baño lo tiene adentro por que no cuenta con más recurso para hacerlo afuera. Su sueldo es poco, con lo que se ayuda es con una pequeña pensión que da el papa de los niños con lo cual paga colegio, agua, luz y con su pago cubre la alimentación. Su objetivo es trabajar hasta cuando sus hijos puedan  sobresalir adelante. Lo que mas desea es poder seguir mejorando su casa, con el crédito anterior logro comprar las puertas para lograr tener mejor seguridad, con este financiamiento quiere  comprar un inodoro, ya que tiene una letrina que esta ya vieja y quiere lograr tener mejor higiene. Lo cual comprara cemento, arena, para hacer sumidero y que se la instalen y poder cada día hacer una vivienda digan para sus hijos. Contenta con la institución por permitir el crédito a mujeres pobres que gracia a su financiamiento ha logrado mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Doña Hilda G. is a hard-working woman, the single mother of two children. She's been working as a domestic worker since she was eight years old. The difficulty has been to gain the confidence of her employers. Her house is small, the walls are unplastered and it has an earthen floor. The bathroom is inside because she doesn't have the means to build one outside. She has her small wages along with a small income she receives from the father of her children with which she pays for school expenses, water and lighting. She uses her wages to pay for food. Her goal is to work until her children are able to make their own way in the world. What she wants most is to be able to continue fixing up her house. With the previous loan she was able to buy the doors in order to have better security. With this loan she wants to buy a toilet, since she now has a latrine which is old and she wants to be able to have better hygiene. She will buy cement and sand to make a drain and to pay to have it installed. And to be able every day to have a dwelling fit for her children. She is pleased with AFODENIC for providing loans to poor women who, thanks to this financing, are able to improve their housing.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her bathroom.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona D. is from the city of Biray in Ozamiz City. She is 34 years old. Chona is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Chona sells vegetables in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Chona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Chona's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Tania Elizabeth

texts.es:
Tania González de 23 años de edad, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo y su mama la ayuda con el.

Tania empezó vendiendo arroz a los clientes de la mama por lo que ella tiene un comedor y así poco a poco comenzó vendiendo aceites, sal y azúcar hasta que puso en su casa una pequeña tienda. Ahora Tania vende legumbres y víveres desde las 06h30 hasta el anochecer con su hermano que a veces le ayuda, una de las mayores complicaciones que tiene es transportar la mercadería a tienda por lo que el bus la deja muy lejos de su casa.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar 2 cajas de aceites, 2 cajas de atún, 1 caja de sardinas para poder así agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener mejor surtida su tienda, ayudarla a su mama y que su hijo pueda estudiar.
texts.en:
Tania González is 23 years old and lives in the semi-urban district of Paraíso in Guayaquil. Her home is constructed of reeds and receives electricity as the only basic service. She is a single mother with one child. Her mother also lives with her.

Tania began selling rice to the customers of her mother, who operates a diner. Eventually she also started selling oil, salt, and sugar until she was able to open a small store. Tania now sells vegetables and other foodstuffs beginning at 6:30am until sundown. Her brother sometimes helps with business. One of her biggest problems is transporting the merchandise to her store since the bus stop is quite a distance away from her house.

Tania will use her loan to buy two cases of oil, two cases of tuna, and one case of sardines in order to expand her business. In the future, she hopes her store will be better stocked. She also wants to support her mother and provide for her child’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, tuna, and sardines

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en: C. Ngô Thị is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, C. raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. C. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2.000.000 Vietnamese Dong a month from these activities. In 2008, C. joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. C. is now requesting a new loan of 7.840.000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan she has taken out from SEDA. C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her extended family. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. C. Ngô Thị (20209050053) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, C. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. C. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. C. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên trong gia đình mở rộng của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm C. phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Evans Thomas

texts.en:
Evans Thomas N. is 40 years in age, married and a father of five children. He is a resident of Manyole Division, Busia District. Evans runs a dairy farming business at his homestead. He started this back in 2006 as a source to generate extra income. He sells his milk twice daily; in the morning and in the evening. 

Evans would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he intends to use to acquire feed, pesticide and vaccination drugs for the dairy cattle. His future dream is to buy more dairy cattle and expand his farm.

loans.use: Acquire feed for cattle and vaccination expenses.

loans.name: Jeina

texts.en:
Jeina A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and beer, and she is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Jeina is 30 years old and is married. Her husband is a policeman. She has nine children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights, as well as legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La señora Doris Guzmán R. tiene 68 años y vive en el barrio Educador de la ciudad de  Cartagena de Indias.   Es dueña de un negocio, donde presta servicios de internet, llamadas internacionales  y servicio de  fotocopiado a clientes que en su mayoría son jóvenes  estudiantes de bachillerato y universitarios. Su negocio inició desde el momento en que su hermano se lo ofreció en Mayo del 2009;  al principio  contó con la experiencia de él, pues la acompañó por dos meses día a día,  por eso ella aprendió a manejarlo muy bien.  

La señora Doris es  soltera y no tiene hijos pero vive con sus tres hermanos, uno de ellos es alérgico y como su casa  tiene piso de plantilla rustica en mal estado, emite mucho polvo a pesar de hacer limpieza constantemente;  ella quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y por eso pide este, su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $2,300,000 pesos, para comprar las materiales de construcción y mejorar  el piso y el baño, que se encuentra en el patio, también en muy mal estado; Igualmente quiere que su casa sea mas segura levantando una   paredilla para tener más control de las personas que ingresan a ella,  pues el patio tiene comunicación con los vecinos.  

La señora Guzmán es una mujer activa, hace parte de la comunidad pastoral social de la iglesia y además es voluntaria en el comedor del colegio ubicado en la parroquia.  Su familia se caracteriza por ser muy unida, solidaria y fieles servidores de la iglesia de Dios.  Su sueño es triunfar en sus proyectos de negocio y todos los días pide a Dios que le vaya bien, para contribuir con su país en la generación de empleo.
texts.en:
Doris Guzmán R., age 68, lives in the Educador neighborhood in the city of Cartagena de Indias. She has a business where she offers internet services, international calls, and photocopies. Most of her customers are young students attending high schools and universities. Her business started from the time her brother offered it to her in May of 2009. At first she counted on his experience. He stayed with her everyday for two months. That is how she learned to manage it so well. Doris is single, and she does not have children. She lives with her three siblings. One of them is allergic. The floor in her house is very rudimentary and in bad shape. It emits a lot of dust even though it is constantly cleaned. She wants to improve the house’s conditions, and that is why she is asking for her second loan for 2,300,000 pesos from the Mario Santo Domino Foundation. She will buy construction materials to improve the floor and the bathroom, which is on the patio. It is also in very bad shape. At the same time, she want her house be more secure by putting up a wall. That way she will have more control over the people who enter. The patio is not sheltered from the neighbors. Mrs. Guzmán is a very active woman. She participates in the social pastoral community in the church. She also volunteers in the school dining room, which is located in the parish. Her family is characterized as being very united, supportive, and loyal followers of the church of God. Her dream is to be successful in her business projects. Everyday she asks God for it to go well so that she is able to contribute to the generation of jobs in her country.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to improve the floor, fix up the bathroom, and raise a wall on the patio

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia R. is from the city of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Celia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Celia owns & operates a business venture providing motor transport services. Celia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Celia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel S. had started up a small hog fattening business when she joined ASHI in 2009. After four months of fattening, Maricel reinvested her income in the business by buying more piglets. She enjoyed spending her profit towards the needs of her three children, in addition to the income of her loving husband, a security guard. 

Looking beyond her present life, where her children between the ages of two and eight years old, Maricel is worried that once they will be studying in higher level of education, they will be needing a large amount of money for support. With her economic status now, she cannot afford to pay the tuition through to their graduation them from college so that they may have a better career. With that in mind, she wants to grow her hog fattening business. She wants to raise more hogs to sell: more either alive or slaughtered, after four months of raising, for a much larger amount of profit. To be able to accomplish her business desires, and her dreams for her famil,y she is requesting for a much larger amount of loan to ASHI. With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to be able to feel in her heart someday the fulfillment of being a great wife, mother and a businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Victor Francisco

texts.es: Víctor es de 37 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujer cuenta con un taller donde fabrica ropa típica, la actividad lo viene desarrollando hace aproximadamente 12 años, solicita su cuarto crédito que le servirá para comprar una máquina para confeccionar ropa, los anteriores préstamo lo pagaron sin problema.
texts.en:
Víctor is 37 years old, and has 4 children - 2 boys and 2 girls. Victor has a workshop where he makes clothes, which he's been doing for the past 12 years. Victor is asking for his 4th loan, which he'll use to purchase machinery to make clothing. He has paid off his previous loans without a problem.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, stone and other items)

loans.name: Salimahon's Group

texts.en:
Salimahon K. is the leader of her group. She is 49 and a widow. Salimahon has raised two sons. The older son is 22; he manufactures bricks and sells them. In this way he makes 10000 soms (217.62$) per month. The younger son is 21; he studies at university. When he has free time, he helps Salimahon with housework. Several years ago with the initial investment of 6000 soms (130.57$), Salimahon began to grow rice and sell it. In this way she makes 3000 soms (65.28$) per month. This profit made it possible for her to purchase furniture and household appliances. With money received from the loan, Salimahon will purchase 150 kg of seeds and 100 kg of fertilizers, which are needed for the sowing process. In the future she plans to build a new house for her son.

Mubarahon K. is the treasurer of the group, she is 45. Her husband works as a private driver. in this job he earns 5000 soms (108.81$) per month. A 22 year old son is a bread baker and his monthly income is 5000 soms (108.81$). Mubarahon's daughter is 20. she takes orders and sews dresses. In this job she earns 2000 soms (43.52$) per month. Mubarahon grows rice and sells it. She started doing this 9 years ago, with the initial investment of 10000 soms (217.62$), and now she makes 4000 soms (87$) per month. She wants to get a loan to purchase fuel, seeds and fertilizers which are needed for the sowing process.

Dilfuzahon K. is 24. Her husband manufactures bricks and sells them. The income from this business is 10000 soms (217.62$) per month.  Dilfuzahon grows rice and tobacco. She started this business 3 years ago, with the initial investment of 8000 soms (174.1$). Now she makes 3000 soms (65.28$) per month. With money received from the loa, she will purchase two sheep for breeding. In the future, Dilfuzahon wants to open a grocery store.

Oydinahon T. is 26. Her husband is a bus driver. He earns 4000 soms (87$) per month. He also helps Oydinahon to sow and harvest rice and tobacco. They stated to grow tobacco five years ago. The initial investment in this business activity was 12000 soms (261.15$) and now they make 3000(65.28$) - 4000 soms (87$) per month. This profit made it possible for Oydinahon to purchase a vehicle and furniture. She needs a loan to purchase 100 kg of seeds and 50 kg of fertilizers for sowing wheat. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase 150 kg of seeds and 100 kg of fertilizers, which are needed for the sowing process.

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en: Arafa T. is an entrepreneur. She is a married woman. She runs a business selling charcoal at Kitunda ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the charcoal direct from wholesale suppliers and sells it to retail customers for domestic use. Charcoal is the main source of power in most developing countries. She also runs a salon at Kitunda, selling cosmetics. She employs two other people who help her run the business. She is requesting a loan of TZS 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel V. R. es un  señor de 44  años de edad quien vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada El Sauce de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y siembra de café. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. La comunidad tiene paisajes muy pintorescos que combinan el bosque tropical con dos lindas lagunas, plantaciones de café y lecherías.
Don Miguel y su familia   se han dedicado por mucho tiempo al negocio de la lechería, y aun más desde que se instalo en su comunidad la planta de elaboración de quesos, propiedad de la Asociación de Productores de Leche de El Sauce. Debido a su experiencia   él conoce ,miuy bien acerca de  todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de sus familiares  a lo largo del tiempo. 
Don Miguel  desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera  mas y así aumentar  su producción a mas de 40 litros de leche por día  con esto el   lograra  crecer  su negocio ya que desea ser un microempresario exitoso para   ayudar a que su familia siga adelante y poder pagar la universidad de su hijo.
Don Miguel  es socio de la Asociación de Productores de El Sauce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su octavo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. El asegura está muy agradecida por la ayudad que esta organización le ha proporcionado para cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Miguel V. R. is a 44 year old gentleman who lives with his wife in the community of El Sauce de Santa Tersita in Turrialba, Cartago Province. This small rural community has approximately 2000 residents, most of whom make their living by producing milk and growing coffee. The area is hilly and much of the land consists of humid tropical forests. In addition, the community has picturesque views that combine the tropical forests with two beautiful lakes, coffee plantations, and dairy farms.

Don Miguel and his family have dedicated much of their time to their dairy business. They focus even more of their time now that a cheese factory has been built in their community by the El Sauce Milk Producers Association. Since he has experience, Miguel is able to take care of all the demands required of his business. In addition, he has imparted his knowledge to the rest of his family over time.

Don Miguel wants to obtain a microloan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy another dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production by more than 40 liters per day, which will allow him to grow his business. He wants to become a successful micro-entrepreneur so that he can help his family get ahead and pay for his son’s university expenses.

Don Miguel is a member of El Sauce Association of Producers, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his eighth loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level. He says he is extremely grateful for the assistance the organization has provided so that he can accomplish his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of contruction materials (iron, cement, sand, and labour).

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia S. is from the village of Kinabkaban, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Cresencia is single. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business buying and selling ready to wear products like t-shirts and blouses in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4.000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cresencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cresencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak G. is 24 years old and lives in Paravaqar village, Lievan area. Artak is married and lives with his wife, parents and little daughter. Artak is a military man and since 2006 he has been working in the Armenian army. At the same time Artak and his family are engaged in stock breeding and farming. Thanks to profits from their agricultural business, Artak has been able to meet his family needs, buy a car and repair his house.

Besides stock breeding Artak has decided to start a pig-breeding business, so he is asking from Kiva lenders, a 500.000 AMD loan to buy young pigs to realize his business idea.

loans.use: To buy young pigs to raise and breed

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky L. is from the village of Lucban. She is 44 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Vicky owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Vicky joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Vicky is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will again be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be her 3rd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Comité San Antonio, así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá en fecha 17 de junio de 2008, gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas, quien se dedica a la elaboración y  venta de artículos artesanales, contactó y con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y de esta manera con la capacitación de una asesorada  formaron sus con mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 8° ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. 
La señora Gloria es una de las integrantes y se encuentra muy satisfecha con su grupo y con los créditos que reciben a culminar exitosamente cada ciclo. 
Así ella trabaja en la venta de mercerías y cada crédito que recibe lo invierte en su negocio a fin de ampliar y contar con todas las necesidades de los clientes que visitan su local. 
Este crédito lo destinara a la compra de mercadería como artículos de mercería, bazar, regalos, cuadernos, bolígrafos, papeles de todo tipo, carteras y otros.
Agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible este proyecto ya que es muy útil para las mujeres que integran los distintos comités.
texts.en:
This group of women started up the communal bank called "San Antonio" in the city of Itá on Jun 17, 2008. The current director of finance, who has a business making and selling handicrafts, contacted a counselor in a weekly meeting that she held in the area to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras works, and with some training provided by the counselor she got some women to form a group. They are now comfortable working with each other; they are in their 8th loan cycle and work together cooperatively in the program. Gloria is one of the members, and she is very pleased with her group and the loans that they received, and the fact that they are completing each loan cycle successfully. Gloria works selling notions (sewing and craft supplies), and she invests every loan that she receives in her business so that she can expand it and have everything that her customers need when they visit her store. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as notions, consumer goods, gifts, notebooks, pens, all types of paper, handbags and other items. She is grateful to all of the people who make this project possible, since it is very useful for the women who belong to the various groups.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: notions, stationery goods, consumer goods, appliqués, gift arrangements, and decorations

loans.name: Orla Maria

texts.es:
ORLA MARIA S. Q.,Trabaja Como Aseadora en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 tiene un hijo asu cargo y este se encuentra en edad escolar, ha trabajado dos creditos con ceprodel y todos estos ha sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en: Orla Maria is a maintenance worker at the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. She takes care of her school-aged son. She has received two loans from CEPRODEL (Center for Promotion of Local Development and Poverty Eradication), which she used to make home improvements.

loans.use: Home Improvements and Family Expenses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es casada, tiene 64 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos ya independizados. Vive junto a su esposo en el anexo La Viña, distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora y cincuenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde que se casó, ella nos explica que tuvo que empezar a trabajar en este negocio debido a que los ingresos que su esposo percibia como trabajador de una empresa agrícola de la zona no eran suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares. Durante todo este tiempo su negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia.

Juana cría aves de corral, cerdos y cuyes, para venderlos a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Eventualmente los vende a sus vecinos. Ella ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva y nos comenta que gracias al dinero recibido su negocio pudo crecer y mantenerse, los animales que compró en aquella oportunidad ya se han desarrollado y ya han sido vendidos por completo.

Actualmente Juana se encuentra solicitando un nuevo préstamo de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales desea adquirir mas animales para seguir con su negocio de crianza y venta. Ella espera seguir creciendo como empresaria y agradece a las personas que colaboraron con ella a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Juana, age 64, is married and has five children who are already grown and independent.  She lives with her husband in the La Viña annex in the Cayaltí district.  It is 1 hour and 50 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been raising and selling animals since she got married.  She tells us that she had to start working in this business because her husband’s income as farm worker in the area did not cover the family expenses.  During all of this time her business has been a lot of help in getting her family ahead.

Juana raises poultry, pigs, and guinea pigs.  She sells them to merchants who usually visit the area where she lives.  Sometimes she sells to her neighbors.  

She has had a Kiva loan.  She tells us that thanks to the money she received, she was able to keep the business, and the business was able to grow.  The animals that she bought with this opportunity have developed, and they have all been sold.

Juana is now requesting a new loan for 500 soles.  She wants to get more animals to continue with her business of raising animals and selling them.  She hopes to continue growing as a businesswoman.  She is grateful to the people who collaborated with her through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy animals to expand her business of raising and selling animals

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is married and has five children. To make a living, Wilfreda owns and operates a tailoring business. Her main source of income comes from providing general tailoring and alteration services to local community members. Wilfreda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

Wilfreda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilfreda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional materials such as needles and thread. Wilfreda plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as needles and thread

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 19 años, es una joven muy responsable y con muchas aspiraciones, ella vive junto a sus padres y sus 3 hermanos en la localidad de Casacoto. Ella agradece a Dios, por haberla encaminado. Como buena hija apoya a sus padres en los gastos de la casa. Trabaja en las mañanas en una tienda agropecuaria y, por las tardes estudia la carrera de Computación, ya le falta pocos años. Terminando desea ejercer su carrera, pero también desea tener algo propio; por ello está planeado abrir su propia tienda agrícola, donde no solo podrá vender productos propios para la agricultura, también desea capacitarlos e instruirlos. Ahora su proyecto es sembrar papa y habas; en el terreno que su padre le heredó,”por el momento, solo comenzaré, con una pequeña producción”, afirma. Es el primer crédito con MFP y, está  feliz de pertenecer a un banco comunal, que integran personas triunfadoras y con muchas ambiciones. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa adquirir abono y semillas de habas; que dentro de poco sembrará.
texts.en:
Judith is 19 years old.  She is a very responsible young woman with many aspirations.  She lives with her parents and 3 siblings in the town of Casacoto.  She thanks God for having put her on the right path.  As a good daughter she supports her parents with the household expenses.  She works in the mornings in a farming and livestock store and, in the afternoon, she is studying a computing course.  She hasn't got many years left in her course.  When she finishes, she would like to pursue her career in computing but she would also like to have something of her own.  For this reason, she is planning to open her own agricultural store where she will not only sell farming products but also provide training and teaching.  Now her project is to sow potatoes and beans in the land which her father gave her as an inheritance.  “Right now, I will just begin with a small production”, she confirms. 

This is Judith's first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to a community bank which has such successful members with many ambitions.  She intends to use the loan she is requesting to acquire fertilizer and bean seeds which she will sow very shortly.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and bean seeds

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita J. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Merlita is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks & other delicacies like rice cake and cassava cake in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients  and as working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old man married to Agnes 30 years who is a farmer and also owns a salon. They are blessed with two children, aged 12 and eight years.

He has been in the retail business for 10 years and is therefore able to identify his potential clients. He is more likely to succeed because his wife is able to help in meeting the family expenses, thus allowing room for Paul's business growth. He was introduced to Kadet by friends who benefited and this is his first loan. He plans to use the add more stock of wheat, flour, and sugar. With the expected profits, he plans to educate his children to the highest level of education  possible. His future dream is to own a plot and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat and sugar

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel A. is from the village of Brgy. Paungan, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 33 years old. Maribel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and five school-age children. He started his career by selling car spare parts from his house 20 years ago. He works hard day after day to provide a good income for his family. He has obtained three Kiva loans and he was an excellent client with on time payments. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business so he can increase his sales and therefore his profitability.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Soumaïla D. est un homme marié de 34 ans et père de 1 enfant. Il vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père  à Bougouni dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après l’école coranique, monsieur Soumaïla D. décida de partir en aventure, précisément en Libye à la recherche d’une vie meilleure.
Ses ambitions n’ont pas été réalisées faute de moyen, il décida de retourner au pays précisément à Bougouni auprès de son oncle pour apprendre le commerce notamment la vente d'habits, de chaussures, de slips etc.
Avec une expérience de 5 années, monsieur Soumaïla D. maîtrise son activité.
Dans le but de se renforcer, monsieur Soumaïla D. décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter divers articles à savoir 30 paires de chaussures et une cinquantaine de complets de prêt à porter. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako,(capitale de la république du Mali). Sa  clientèle est composée d’hommes et femmes. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Avec ce prêt, monsieur Soumaïla D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaila D. is a married man who is 34 years old and the father of one. He lives with his family and son at his father's house in Bougouni, in the quarter of Heremakono Nord. 

Following Koranic school, Mr. Soumaila D. decided to set out on an adventure, more exactly to Libya in search for a better life. 

His ambitions were not realized for the lack of means, so he decided to return to his country, to Bougouni, to learn from his uncle the business of buying and selling party supplies. 

With a 5-year experience, Mr. Soumaila D. has mastered the business. 

In order to strengthen his business, Mr. Soumaila D. decided to access a loan from Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner), with the goal of purchasing a variety of clothing items, namely 30 pairs of shoes et 50 complete outfits. He makes his purchases in Bamako (capital city of the Republic of Mali). His clientele is made up of men and women. It is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. 

With this loan Mr. Soumaila D. expects to earn a monthly income of 70 000 FCFA. 

In the years to come he foresees expanding his store.

loans.use: To purchase party supplies.

loans.name: Ghulam Khadija

texts.en:
Ghulam Khadija is a 32 year-old lady, residing in a city named Kasur, in Pakistan. Kasur is a small city and known for its tannery industry. She is an educated lady. She got her education up to the 12th standard. She wants to study further but her parents wished for her to be married and settled in her life. She got married to M. Y., who runs a medical store in the market. He has been in this business for the past 11 years. During those years, he has gotten a good reputation among his clients by providing them with quality medicines.  
Ghulam khadija has given birth to three children, two daughters and one son. Her elder daughter is in 5th grade and a son is in first grade. Her younger daughter is just one year old. 
Ghulam Khadija is a very cooperative lady. She operates a school in the community. All the children of her community come to her school to get an education. She earns a good income every month. Now she has become an earning part of the family. Her family respects her alot and loves her for her good and hardworking nature. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy medicines to sell in his medical store.
She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes that It will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy medicines for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 52 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Julia ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papas, choclo y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia, age 46, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Héctor, age 52, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Julia works very hard on her farm to provide everything she needs to support her family. Before the first rays of sunlight appear, she leaves her house and walks almost an hour before reaching her land where she grows potatoes, corn, and peas. These products are eventually sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is cultivating her land, which she feels has been put to good use. Julia has been farming for thirty years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to Tarma because the sacks are heavy and the work is tiring. Within time, she wants to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her second loan with MFP. Julia is pleased to access this loan and wants to express her appreciation to everyone who made it possible for her to obtain the money she needs. She is a well-respected member of her Communal Bank because she tries to keep the meetings orderly. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to make her land more productive.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
V. Trương Thị is 31 years old and lives in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married, has three children and earns a living by making wood products. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 5,000,000 VND a month from her work.

In 2009, V. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business.
