She has successfully repaid two previous loans from SEDA and is applying for a new one, for 8,736,000 VND, to buy additional supplies for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to continue expanding her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and northern Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


V. Trương Thị (20203050027) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, V. Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  V. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, V. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, V. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  V. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  V. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to buy supplies for a wood-making business.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz, tiene 43 años de edad es originaria del departamento de Estelí, esta casada tiene 4 hijos de 23,22, 18 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ella se dedica a vende ropa y zapatos usados. Empezó  vendiendo fritangas ambulantes  por las calles de Estelí pero en la actualidad se ha dedicado a vender ropa y zapatos usados este negocio lo inicio en el año 1992 atraves de una financiera que le presto dinero. Vende sus productos en su barrio también sale a vender al pueblo llamada San Pedro Susucayan localizado en el departamento de Madriz donde ella toma un bus que le transporta hasta ese lugar el cual tarda 2 horas para llegar. Su esposo coopera en el hogar el trabaja como chofer de una unidad de transporte.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar más inventario de ropa y zapatos usados. Con esto espera lograr aumentar sus ventas, clientela mejorar sus ingresos. Dentro de sus planes esta poder tener una tienda propia en centro de comercio en Estelí. Su próxima meta esta comprar una camioneta que la usara para transportar y vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Luz, age 43, is from the department of Estelí; she is married and has four children, aged 23, 22, 18, and 12. Luz earns her living selling second-hand shoes and clothing. She started out selling fritangas (a deep-fried dish) on the streets of Estelí, but in 1992 started the second-hand clothing business thanks to a loan from a financial institution. 

Luz sells her products in her neighborhood and also goes out on sales trips to the town called San Pedro Susucayan located in the department of Madriz; she needs to take a two-hour bus ride to get there. Luz's husband helps at home and works as a public transportation chauffeur.

Luz is asking for a loan to purchase more inventory of used shoes and clothing. With this loan, she hopes to expand her client base and increase her sales which would allow her to improve her income. In the future, she would like to have her own store in the commercial center of Estelí. Her next goal is to purchase a pick-up truck to transport her inventory and sell her products.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of second-hand shoes and clothing

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and three young children who are still attending school. She has owned a female beauty salon since 1995. Her husband has owned a small shop since 2001 where he sells different electrical equipment and machinery. They cooperate together to reach the required financial goal in order to make their family live in appropriate conditions.  She has taken her first Kiva loan and has been a good client with prompt payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase beauty products and related accessories. She is very positive and hoping to increase her business level.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and related accessories

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells beans and groundnuts. She is 39 years old, married and has 6 children, 4 of whom go to school. Regina borrowed a loan to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Mitirikwi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 54-year-old Evelyn (holding the yellow file) from Masvingo. She is married with four children, all of whom have attended school. She also cares for two dependants. Evelyn runs a retail business selling blankets, clothes and shoes and employs two people. The business has been in operation for 11 years. She says the main challenges faced are market factors as those clients in the target market only get cash towards month's end. 

Evelyn has requested a loan of $300 to increase her stock levels of products. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s quality of life - increased stocks mean increased sales which in turn mean more income for the family. In the future Evelyn plans to own a shop and grinding mill.

loans.use: to increase stock levels of products such as blankets, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 56 year old, runs a bakery that earns $3 per day in income.  Her husband is a soldier and his salary is $60 per month.  they both have 3 children and they are 25, 20, 18 years old. They have jobs as a garment factory worker, driver, and car repairer and they can make $8.50 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $60 on food and $15 on electricity.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to buy wood for repairing her house.  In the future she wants to sell wood instead of selling cake because it can make more profit.

loans.use: To buy wood for house repairing

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el distrito de Yarinacocha de la ciudad de Pucallpa, Martha tiene una tienda, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas, como cerveza, gaseosas, vinos, piscos, los cuales son rápidamente consumidos por sus vecinos, ya que ella tiene la fama de vender solo bebidas de buena calidad y no adulterados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, de esta manera hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que quedarse hasta altas horas de la noche atendiendo a algunos clientes que desean sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea hacer arreglar la infraestructura de su tienda, para poder brindarle a sus clientes una mejor atención. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más bebidas para implementar mejor su tienda, con lo cual podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad para elegir.
texts.en:
Martha is 33 years old. She is a straightforward and hardworking woman. She lives her own house along with her 4 beloved children, for whom she wishes to provide the best quality of life. She has a store in the district of Yarinacocha in the city of Pucallpa. She sells drinks, such as beer, soft drinks, wines, and pisco, which are rapidly consumed by her neighbors because she is well-known for selling only drinks that are of good quality and not adulterated. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. This makes her long work days more pleasant. She has been in this business for 8 years and she thinks the most difficult part of it is having to stay until late at night to tend to customers who want her products. 

Eventually, she would like to improve the infrastructure of her store so she can provide her customers with better service. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is willing to work hard to make her repayments on time. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member and is always knowledgeable about the decisions made in the group. With the PEN 500.00 that she has requested, she will buy more drinks for her store so she can offer her customers a greater variety to choose from.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of drinks.

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Jeralyn has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Jeralyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jeralyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Pedro William

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, en su familia solamente él trabaja vendiendo ropa y medicina, este negocio lo aprendió cuando era empleado de un comercial y luego se decidió a instalar el negocio, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades y tiene la esperanza de continuar creciendo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa (blusas, faldas, camisas formales) también medicamentos como analgésicos, antibióticos, vitaminas, esta inversión le ayudara a mantener el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes una variedad de productos.
Su objetivo es para el futuro ganar experiencia e instalar un negocio fuerte, estable, con local fijo, donde pueda atender a los clientes y garantiza a su familia ingresos constantes, que cubran todas las necesidades.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and three children.  He is the only one in his family who works.  He sells clothes and medicines.  He learned this business when he worked as an employee in a store and then decided to set up his own business.  Up to now, he hasn't had any problems and he hopes his business will continue to grow.

Pedro is requesting a loan to buy clothes (blouses, skirts and dress shirts).  He will also buy medicines such as painkillers, antibiotics and vitamins.  This investment will help him to keep his business running and enable him to offer his customers a variety of products.

Pedro's goal for the future is to gain experience and have a strong, stable business with fixed premises where he can serve his customers and guarantee constant income for his family in order to meet all their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes (blouses, skirts, dress shirts) for his business

loans.name: Mbootu Diam Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "MBOOTU DIAM" est composé de cinq femmes mariées.Elles vendent des produits alimentaires et du sel et les revenus de ce commerce leur permettent de satisfaire leurs besoins personnels tout en participant aux dépenses d'alimentation de leurs familles.Leur groupe est membre d'un grand " mbotaay" (groupe de solidarité)qui regroupe 50 femmes de leur localité.Les femmes bénéficie de ce "mbotaay" d'une subvention chaque dimanche en plus d'un crédit revolving organisé en début de chaque mois."MBOOTU DIAM" est est dirigé par une femme dont l'activité principale est le commerce de sel.Elle dispose d'un lopin de terre dans la lagune qui ceinture la ville.Elle récolte le sel, le traite avant de le vendre aux boutiquiers détaillants.Son ambition est de construire un magasin un magasin au marché pour stocker et revendre son produit.Le groupe sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 250000F pour acheter du sel, de la patte d'arachide et de l'huile de palm.
texts.en: The "MBOOTU DIAM" group is made up of five married women. They sell food products and salt and the income from this trade enables them to meet their personal needs as well as participating in their families’ food expenditure .Their group is a member of a large “mbotaay" (solidarity group) which brings together 50 women in their neighbourhood. The women benefit from this " mbotaay" in the form of a subsidy each Sunday as well as a revolving credit organised at the beginning of each month. ” MBOOTU DIAM" is led by a woman whose principal activity is the commerce of salt. She has a plot of land in the lagoon which surrounds the town. She collects the salt, treats it, and then sells it to the retail shopkeepers. Her ambition is to build a shop at the market for the storage and sale of her product. The group requests a loan of 250000F from the UIMCEC for the purchase of salt, peanut butter, and palm oil.

loans.use: to puchase  salt,peanut butter and palm oil.

loans.name: Fernando Bismark

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 27 años de edad vive en unión libre junto a su esposa en el Cantón Pueblo Viejo perteneciente a Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDO SOMOS  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Marañón por la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo,  esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol.

Fernando se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Compra sus productos en Comercial  Agro insumos Karlita y los vende en el comercial Castillo.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y fréjol y comprar semillas, urea,  insumos y  abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes líquidos  para los cultivos.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima con la ayuda del crédito será más fácil para adquirir los insumos.
 Su sueño es poder comprarse maquinaria para poder trabajar en los terrenos. En su  tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Fernando is 27 years old.  He lives in a civil union with his wife in the Pueblo Viejo Canton which is part of Ventanas, in the de los Ríos Province.

He is a member of the Communal Bank "UNIDO SOMOS" ("We Are United"), which is located in the El Marañón district in the Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of the Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This bank works with short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.

Fernando works in agriculture, growing corn, rice and beans.  He buys his products at the Karlita agricultural supplies trading center, and sells them at the Castillo trading center.

He is requesting the loan to buy corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers for the crops.

The support of the loan will help him financially to meet his needs.  He faces challenges such as pests and illnesses, and the variability of the climate.  With the help of the loan, it will be easier for him to buy supplies.

His dream is to be able to buy machinery for working his fields.

In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and beans, and to buy seeds, urea, supplies, and agricultural manure and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: 18 En La Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “18 en la Fe”, está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales  se encuentran la venta de joyas, venta de productos para adelgazar, servicios de masoterapia, confección y venta de ropa de cama, bazar, kiosco, tejidos y preparación de tortas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Estación Central, ciudad de Santiago. 
Mirtha quien en la foto se encuentra en primera fila agachada de derecha a izquierda, se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace 3 años. 
Comenta que le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y que además mantiene un buen número de clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora en la cual realizan ventas para comerciantes. Además se dedica a vender cosméticos por catalogo y lencería.
Con el crédito comprará lencería, por lo que la encargará a su hermana quien trabaja en una distribuidora. 
Sus metas en sus negocios son invertir una gran cantidad de dinero, para comprar joyas y vender a comerciantes, una de sus expectativas es tener una distribuidora, para abastecer a los pequeños negocios.  
Mirtha vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 11, 4 y 2 años de edad. Sus sueños son estabilizarse económicamente para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Otro de sus sueños es tener una boutique para niñas, para compatibilizarlo con el negocio de una de sus amigas quien vende zapatos y ropa de niñas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza. El grupo del Banco comunal al cual pertenece es muy comprometido, responsable, solidario y organizado. 
Estación Central es una comuna emplazada en el área céntrica de Santiago (capital de Chile), que debe su nombre a la Estación Central de Ferrocarriles, que data del año 1887, declarada Monumento Nacional en 1983. En sus inicios esta estación, junto con la estación Mapocho, fueron la entrada a la capital en el tramo Valparaíso -  Santiago y también desde la zona sur del país.
texts.en:
This community bank is called '18 en la Fe'.  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who are engaged in different business activities including selling jewelry, selling slimming products, providing massage (therapy), making and selling bed linen, running a general store, running a kiosk, knitting and making cakes.  All the members of the bank live in Estación Central, in the city of Santiago.

Mirtha, who in the photo is kneeling down in the front row on the right, has been selling jewelry for three years.  She says that her business has done very well and that she has a good number of customers.  She buys her merchandise from a wholesalers where they sell to people who sell retail.  She also sells cosmetics through a catalog and underwear.

Mirtha will use her loan to buy underwear which she will order from her sister who works at a wholesalers.  Mirtha's goals for her businesses are to invest a large quantity of money so that she can buy jewelry and sell to retailers.  She also plans to own a wholesalers so that she can supply small businesses.

Mirtha lives together with her husband and her four children who are 16, 11, 4 and 2 years old.  One of her dreams is to achieve financial stability so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.  Another of her dreams is to own a boutique selling clothes for young girls.  She will merge it with the business of one of her friends who sells shoes and clothes for young girls.

Mirtha is very happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza.  The members of her community bank are very committed, responsible, supportive and organized.

Estación Central is a community which is located in the central area of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  It takes its name from the 'Estación Central de Ferrocarilles' (Central Railway Station) which dates back to 1887 and was named a national monument in 1983.  Originally this station, together with Mapocho station, was the entrance to the capital city on the Valparaíso - Santiago line and also on routes from the south of the country.

loans.use: to buy underwear which she will order from her sister who works at a wholesalers

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos ya independientes.  Cuenta con educación primaria (incompleta).
La señora se dedica a la venta  de abarrotes y zapatillas, hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su préstamo anterior de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,500.00 nuevo soles, comprará papa, chuño, golosinas chompas para niños y vender su mercadería en la ciudad de Arequipa.
Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en transportes (chofer).
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción para ella.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” communal bank located in Yunguyo District in Yunguyo Province, Puno Department.  She’s 52 years old, married and has two children who are independent now.  She did not complete elementary school.

She sells groceries and sandals.  She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for seven years.  Her previous, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her business.  She will use this new, 1500 new sol, loan to buy potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, snacks and children’s sweaters.  She will sell her merchandise in the city of Arequipa.  She works alone in her business; her husband works in transportation (driver).

Her dream is to stay in business and to improve her quality of life.  What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction for her.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, snacks and children's sweaters.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan. 

Sawsan is doing embroidery from home and is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials such as beads and cloth.

Sawsan is looking to expand her business and customer base so that she can increase her family's income and improve their life conditions..

loans.use: To purchase beads and cloth

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man aged 60. He has operated a retail shop for the last seven years to make a living. He has been able to retain his business because of his hard work and determination.  In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, salt and juice for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and juice.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Mustafa has been the owner of a cafeteria since 2008, where he prepares a variety of food choices. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His cafeteria is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting $2,100 in order to make a showcase and a sliding door for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a showcase and a sliding door for his shop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva cuenta con 37 años de edad es mama soltera tiene una hija la cual se encuentra estudiando 2º grado de la preparatoria  ella se llama Ana yaritza.

Ella se dedica al comercio de carnicería vende carne lo cual invirtió su préstamo en comprar puercos para matanza a doña Eva le gustaría que su negocio fuera creciendo más ella dice que sacara su negocio adelante para así irlo incrementando día a día.
texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old.  She is a single mother and has one daughter who is in her second year of high school.  Her name is Ana Yaritza.

Eva's business is selling meat.  She invested her loan in buying pigs to slaughter.  Eva would like to grow her business further so that she can continue increasing her business every day.

loans.use: to buy pigs to slaughter

loans.name: Konyololo Farmers Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kunyololo Farmers Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Roswel is the facilitator of the Kunyololo Farmers Group. She takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Roswel had an excellent maize yield harvesting 6 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roswel was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roswel and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Roswel will educate her children and ensure food security. In 2012, the members of Kunyololo Farmers Group will each plant between half and 1 acre of maize.
The photograph shows the members of the group.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor is  46 years old and has two children. The eldest attends college while the youngest is in elementary school. He runs a farming business as his source of his income. He had been in the rice production business for 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP during harvest.

Melchor is requesting for a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy herbicides and pesticides for his farming business. He hopes to achieve an abundant harvest to increase his earnings and keep sending his children to school. Melchor's priority is to support his family and assure them of a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Rossana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rossana, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyería por catalogo, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos, trabaja de manera ambulante, visitando clientes en las viviendas o sitios de trabajos, para ofrecer productos de las revistas con las que trabaja.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para vender a  detalle, por ejemplo,labiales, lociones, maquillajes, collares, aretes, pulseras, comprando ella de sus revistas los productos más llamativos, así tener disponibilidad para ofrecer a los clientes. Esta inversión espera que le ayude para que sus clientes se animen a comprar más productos.
Su aspiración es mejorar el negocio y su casa, que sus hijos también tengan lo necesario para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Rossana works selling cosmetics and jewelry from catalogs.  She lives with her husband and two children.  She sells her products by visiting her customers in their homes or workplaces, where she offers products for sale from the catalogs with which she works.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products to retail, for example lipsticks, lotions, make-up, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.  She purchases the most requested products from her catalogs, so that she always has them available to sell to her customers.  She hopes that this investment will help her as her customers will be encouraged to purchase more products.

Her aspiration is to improve her business and her home, so that her children will have everything necessary for their development.

loans.use: to purchase lipsticks, lotions, make-up, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Collique Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Fidelina, tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera. Es socia del grupo "Las Emprendedoras de Collique" formado por 7 integrantes todos residentes de la zona de Collique en el distrito de Comas.
la Sra. Fidelina se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de ropa, luego de dejar su trabajo de secretaria iniciò su pequeño negocio, junto el dinero de su liquidación y compró mercadería para ofrecer a sus conocidos.Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado tener una economía estable.
Una de sus metas es viajar al extranjero para traer ropa y venderla.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para ofrecer a sus amigos y familiares.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 51 years old and single. She is a member of the group "Las Emprendadoras de Collique" [The Enterprising Women of Collique], set up by 7 members who are all residents of the Collique area in the Comas district.

Fidelina has sold clothes for the past 5 years. After leaving her job as a secretary she started her small business with her severance pay and bought merchandise to sell to her acquaintances. Thanks to her work she has managed to become financially stable.

One of her goals is to go abroad to bring back clothes to sell.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothes to sell to her friends and family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for adults, young people and children.

loans.name: Santos Violeta

texts.es:
La señora Santos Violeta es casada tiene 41 años de edad, cursó sus estudios de educación primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría y tricotado de hilo, inició este trabajo como operaria, lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuanta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al mismo trabajo. 

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales, hilos y tinte y mejorar su producción de tejidos. En el futuro espera tener mas oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Santo Violeta is married, 41 years old, and studied through primary school. She works weaving and knitting yarn. She began this business working on a weaving loom, and has ten years experience with the help of her husband who is engaged in the same work.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies, yarn, and dyes to improve her production of weavings. In the future she hopes to have more work opportunities.

loans.use: to buy yarn and dye in order to weave

loans.name: Flora Argentina

texts.es: Flora es una microempresaria originaria de Masaya ella se dedica a destace de cerdo y venta de refrescos naturales desde hace 7 años, es una mujer que esta casada y tiene 48 años de edad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos en pie para luego destazar al cerdo y vender sus carnes.
texts.en: Flora is a micro-businesswoman and is originally from Masaya.  She makes a living slaughtering pigs and selling natural refreshments.  She has done this for seven years.  She is a married woman and is forty-eight years old.  She will invest the loan money in the purchase of live pigs to later slaughter and sell the meat.

loans.use: to buy live pigs.

loans.name: Taurinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TAURINAS” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, ayudante de limpieza, venta de refrescos, venta de menudencias de pollo, ventas de plásticos, servicio de chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carnicería; da a conocer que este negocio aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde apoyada en esta actividad, posteriormente decide emprender su propio espacio de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará a pedido del público. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el el apoyo del asesor de crédito.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Taurinas” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Susana is the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as weaving blankets, working as a cleaning assistant, selling soft drinks, selling chicken giblets, selling plastic goods, and providing chauffeur services.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Susana.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer one loan cycle ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization.  Susana currently has a butcher shop.  She is knowledgeable about this line of work because she learned the trade from her previous job where she was a butcher’s assistant.  Later on, she decided to establish a space for her own business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying meat in bulk.  She acquires her inventory from the wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells her goods to the public upon request.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Susana is single and has four children.  
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Susana said that she enjoys the support of her credit advisor.

loans.use: to buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.  Oanh is 26 years old and she is married with 2 children.
She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province

This is Oanh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Oanh has been involved in this business for 5 years.

The main harship that Oanh faces in her life is not having hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.


With her business profit, Oanh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Wobolo

texts.en:
Madam Wobolo A. was born in 1972 at Tsèkpo in the district of Yoto. Married and mother of six (06) children, she lived in an incredible poverty, because of the carelessness of an irresponsible husband who spends most of his time in drinking alcohol. Basic household expenses have become a true burden to the wife who struggles everyday. As a qualified, very dynamic, courageous and hard-working baker, she had $ 150 as credit and begun her activity of salted and sugared bread which is very appreciated in the local population and inhabitants of neighboring villages. She had three credits of $200, $ 350 and $ 550 respectively; which she paid back without any problem. Now, she has more than eleven (11) apprentice-bakers from different regions to acquire her expertise. The development of her business shows that she needs more financing. To satisfy more and more needs of bread, Madam A. would like to have a credit of $ 800 which will help her buy: wheat flour, salt, sugar, brewer’s yeast and have a permanent stock; it will also help her increase her production and her income in order to better meet her basic needs and take care of her children at school.

Madame A. Wobolo est née en 1972 à Tsèkpo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Mariée et mère de six (06) enfants, elle a vécu dans une misère indescriptible à cause de la négligence d’un mari irresponsable qui passe l’essentiel de son temps à boire de l’alcool. Les charges du ménage sont devenus un véritable poids pour la femme qui se bat au quotidien. Boulangère de formation, très dynamique, courageuse et assidue au travail, elle a bénéficié de $150 comme crédit et commença son activité de fabrication de pain salé et sucré très apprécié par la population locale et les habitants des villages environnants. Elle a bénéficié par la suite de trois crédits respectifs de $ 200, $350 et $ 550 qu’elle avait bien remboursé sans incident. Aujourd’hui, elle a plus de onze (11) apprenties boulangères venues de différentes régions pour acquérir son savoir-faire. Vu le développement de son affaire, elle a besoin des financements plus consitants. Aussi, pour satisfaire les demandes de pain de plus en plus croissantes, Madame A. sollicite-t-elle un crédit d’un montant de $800 qui servira à l’achat des intrants (farine de blé, sel, sucre, levure de bière) pour assurer un stock permanent. Cela lui permettra d’augmenter sa production et par conséquent ses revenus afin d’améliorer ses besoins élémentaires et de s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, salt, sugar, brewer’s yeast and have a permanent stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her groceries business by purchasing additional fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and water storage equipment for his dairy business

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José is 51 years old. He has been married for many years to Ermelinda, who is 45 years old. Ermelinda is a housewife and has sacrificed a lot to raise their 4 children, now 24, 22, 19 and 13 years old.

All of José's children live with him. Although the two youngest children are still in school, they help their father with his daily work like their older siblings.

José makes clay planters and flower pots in large quantities which he then sells in various Paraguayan cities. He has a truck in which he transports his products.

He has been working in this busines for more than 30 years. He talks with pride about how he successfully opened foreign markets for himself, thanks to the excellent quality of his products. He is currently exporting a large part of his production to Argentina.

José needs a loan to buy the raw materials that he uses in the manufacture of his planters: clay and the firewood he uses to fire his pots.

José is a very enterprising person who dreams of exporting his products to more countries. In his factory he gives work to 4 other people so that they can support their families with the income they earn with him.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. José tiene 51 años. Está casado desde hace varios años ya con Ermelinda quien actualmente tiene 45 años. Su esposa es ama de casa y ha criado con mucho sacrificio a sus 4 hijos que tienen 24, 22, 19 y 13 años de edad.

Todos sus hijos viven con él. Los dos últimos aún siguen estudiando y ayudan al padre en sus labores diarios al igual que los dos hermanos mayores.

El Sr. José elabora planteras de barro (macetas para cultivar plantas ornamentales) en grandes cantidades que luego comercializa en distintas ciudades del país. Para ello cuenta con un camión en el que transporta todos sus productos.

Se dedica a la misma actividad hace más de 30 años ya. Cuenta con orgullo que debido a la excelente calidad de sus productos consiguió abrirse mercado en el extranjero y actualmente está exportando gran parte de su producción a la Argentina.

El crédito que el Sr. José necesita es para la compra de materias prima que utiliza en la elaboración de sus planteras, tal como el barro y la leña que utiliza para cocinarlas.

Es una persona muy emprendedora que sueña con exportar a más países sus productos. Además, en su fábrica, da trabajo a 4 personas más para que éstos a su vez puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias con los ingresos que obtienen con dicho trabajo.

loans.use: Buy clay and firewood

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria N. is a member of Abagalana Women’s group located in Kawuku, a few kilometers from Entebbe Airport. She is married and a mother of three: two girls and one boy. She also takes care of her sister's two daughters. She has serviced two loans very well and her business is progressing.

Maria makes and sells dresses, skirts, blouses and lady’s pants. She is well-known in the village for making quality and fashionable dresses and particularly for being honest.

Having attended training from Abagalana Women's group on how to start a business, Maria went ahead and started making bricks for sale. She earns about $200 profit over three months. Her parents have given her a large plot of land, on which she hopes to expand her business and increase production of bricks.

loans.use: Maria wants to hire 2 more brick makers as well as buy logs for burning the bricks.

loans.name: K,ernest

texts.fr:
Aged 60, Mr. Ernest K. K. was born in Djagblé. Married with seven children, he is a house painter in Alinka. He has been doing this for 20 years. As this was not giving him enough income, he opened a small store selling wood, which has done very well. With no financial means, Mr. K. is unable to meet market demand. He is therefore asking for a loan of $1,200 to stock up on wood and buy paint supplies. This would enable him to increase his income and provide for the well-being of his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Agé de 60 ans, Monsieur K. K. Ernest est né à Djagblé. Marié et père de sept (07) enfants. Il est peintre bâtiment à Alinka. Cela fait 20 ans qu’il est dans ce domaine. Ses revenus n’étant pas suffisant, il a ouvert une petite boutique de vente de bois qui lui réussit bien. Faute de moyens financiers, Monsieur K. n’arrive pas à satisfaire la demande du marché. Pour cela il sollicite un apport financier de $1200 pour faire un stockage de bois et acheter des matériels de peinture (colle, chaud etc.). Cette réalisation lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et assurer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wood and building materials

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Bakhtiyor A. is married and has 3 children. He has been in the business of reselling various types of dishes for 10 years. His wife Mahbuba Akhunova is helping him because this business is the sole source of income for their family.

After separation of Tajikistan from the Soviet Union, he has lost his job. For this reason he started reselling dishes on the market. He transports his goods from the city of Hujanda. Currently, he doesn't have sufficient amount of funds to increase the assortment of his inventory. The earnings obtained during the previous months were partially used to fix his house before the beginning of the winter season.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Ахунов Бахтиёр Камолович женат. Имеет 3-их детей. Он занимается, куплей продажей столовой посуды занимается около 10 лет. Из за того что этот бизнесч является основным источником дохода семьи в этом деле ему помогает жена Ахунова Махбуба. После распада СССР он остался без работы и чтоб прокормить семью начал торговать на рынке перепродажей столовой посуды товара. Он привозит товар из города Худжанда. На данный момент он имеет не большой оборотный капитал и для расширения ассортимента товара он нуждается в финансировании. На полученный доход от прошлых месяцев он частично отремонтировал дом до наступления холодов.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old and has three children. Two of them are already studying in school and his small son will go next year. He has a small bakery shop which he depends on it for his living. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new bakery machines, hire one unemployed person and renovate the shop to improve his life and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk. Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase new bakery machines

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Grace S. is 44 years old and she is single with three children. Her children are 10, 12, and 18 years old, and she has two other dependents, her grandson and her maid. In 1993 Grace established a tailoring, computer services, and crop-selling business. Grace now seeks a loan in order to purchase material and accessories for her tailoring business, paper and printing cartridges for her computer business, and additional stocks of crops for sale. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase material and accessories for her tailoring business, paper and printing cartridges for her computer business, and additional stocks of crops for sale.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Doña Martha is a specialist in beauty. She is a single mother with 2 children to feed and raise, so she decided to use her knowledge about cosmetics - which she obtained when she was very young - to work. She was able to find some capital with which to start her beauty salon, which is located in her home. Thanks to her good service and personalized attention she was able to acquire a good number of customers who visit her frequently. This same business allowed her to develop an Academy of Cosmetology. Given the talent she developed over thirty years of experience, her customers themselves desired to learn about beauty from her. The success of her business has allowed her to finance an improvement of the infrastructure of the place in which it is located, thus making it more pleasant. She has also expanded the service offered to include spa treatments and massages. Doña Martha wants to buy accessories for her Academy, since the students now need to practice what they have learned.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Martha es una especialista en el ramo de la belleza, siendo madre soltera y con 2 hijos a quien alimentar y sacar adelante, decide poner en práctica los conocimientos de belleza que adquirió desde muy joven, es con un financiamiento como emprende su salón de belleza, el cual ella misma atendía en su casa de habitación. Debido a su buen servicio y atención personalizada logra captar un buen número de clientes fieles que la visitan frecuentemente. El mismo negocio le permitió desarrollar una Academia de Belleza, debido al talento que la señora ha desarrollado, ya que son 30 años de experiencia con los que cuenta, sus mismas clientas deseaban aprender y actualmente, ella misma es la que brinda los cursos a jóvenes y mujeres adultas en el ramo de belleza. El mismo negocio le ha permitido mejorar la infraestructura del local, acondicionando el Salón y la Academia bajos condiciones agradables, además de expandir las líneas del servicio que ofrece como es Spa y Masajes. La señora desea comprar accesorios de belleza para la academia, ya que sus alumnas necesitan poner en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos en cada etapa del proceso de enseñanza.

loans.use: Purchasing dryer, iron, combs, scissors, razors and brushes

loans.name: Karina

texts.en:
Karina T. K. has a business selling clothing door-to-door in the city of Pucallpa. She sells underwear, shirts, and pants for all ages. Karina has many loyal customers; she uses a credit system so her customers can pay over a week or month. This credit system works well because many people get paid monthly.

Karina is 29 years old with 3 children and is happily married. She enjoys working, helping her family and earning money. Karina never had the opportunity to study, so sending her children to school is very important to her.

A member of the community bank Amigas Siempre Unidas, Karina is requesting a loan of $450 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy more clothing from the local distributor

loans.use: To buy more clothing from the local distributor

loans.name: Alfoncina

texts.en:
Alfoncina is 48 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 16-25 years old. Alfoncina is a tailor. She started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $240 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her tailoring business

loans.name: Atsoupé

texts.fr:
Mrs. Atsoupé G. was born on July 21, 1974 in Lomé. She is a married mother of two children. Her business consists of selling food and drinks. In 2001, she opened a bar-restaurant named “Bar Desiadenyo” in the Agbalépédo neighborhood in Lomé. Her business is located near the neighborhood bus station, which brings many customers to her restaurant. This first loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase 50 units of yams, three bags of corn and 12 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame G. Atsoupé est née le 21 juillet 1974 à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a pour activité principale la restauration et la vente de boissons. C’est en 2001 qu’elle a ouvert un Bar restaurant qu’elle nomme « BAR DESIADENYO » dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo à Lomé. Son lieu d’activité est situé près de la gare routière du quartier ; ce qui fait qu’il y a beaucoup d’affluence dans son restaurant. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter cinquante (50) tubercules d’ignames, trois (3) sacs de maïs et douze (12) casiers de bière.

loans.use: Purchase of root vegetables

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.es:
Crescencia G. is 56 years old. She is single and has no children. She opened a grocery store in 2001 in Santa Roa neighborhood where she lives after resigning from another position in the downtown area of Ciudad del Este. Currently she is working exclusively in her store. She shops for items for her business in the neighboring country (Brazil) or in the city market. She needs this loan to purchase supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Crescencia G. cuenta con 56 años de edad, es soltera y sin hijos. La señora monto una despensa en el Barrio Santa Roa de Ciudad Pdte. Franco donde ella reside.

Su negocio lo tiene desde el año 2001, dicho negocio había emprendido después de renunciar a un trabajo en una casa de negocio en el microcentro de Ciudad del Este .Actualmente ella se dedica exclusivamente a su despensa. Casualmente la señora Crescencia va de compras ya sea en el vecino país (Brasil) o en el mercado municipal de la ciudad.

Ella está necesitando del crédito para aumentar stock de mercaderías.

loans.use: Purchase of grain, oil, various kinds of meat, and sugar

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji is the wife of M. S. and has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 3 years, where she owns a two room brick house. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband is a mason by profession. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to take care of her children. She is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools (beams, hammer) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Shahida baji wants a loan to buy a juicer machine; Naziran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle); and Shakooran baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa O. started her local restaurant nine years ago in Sunyani where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the most popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 37 years old and married with two kids, who are currently in school. 

She serves many kinds of local dishes, like fufu, rice balls, and banku, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Yaa wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood. She also hopes to use part of the proceeds to finance her children's education. She is a member of the community group called Proverb Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and firewood.

loans.name: Jose  Santos

texts.es:
El señor José Santos Ordoñez desde muy jovencito se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo perteneciente a la ciudad de Chinandega. Por medio de esta actividad logra mantener a su familia brindándole a su pequeño hijo los estudios que se merece.

El motivo por el cual hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito con el cual comprar las herramientas necesarias para la construcción de una cerca y de igual manera para brindarle asistencia técnica a sus cultivos. Muy confiadamente espera en Ceprodel sabiendo que su crédito será otorgado y así logrará construir la cerca para su actividad agropecuaria.
texts.en:
Señor José Santos Ordoñez, since he was very young, has worked in agriculture in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. By way of this work, he succeeds in supporting his family, providing his little boy with the studies he deserves.

The reason that he is turning to Ceprodel today is to get a loan with which to buy needed tools for the construction of a fence and also to provide technological assistance to his crops. He trusts that he will be given a loan and that way he will succeed in building the fence for his agricultural work.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a Fence for his Agricultural Work

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Sembrar en quechua. Julia es casada, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos, Julia tiene un kiosco que se ubica al frente D. un grifo a la salida D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, en donD. venD. golosinas, artículos D. aseo, bebidas, pastillas, panes, actividad que realiza todos los días con el apoyo D. sus hijos en sus tiempos libres. Además en algunas oportunidades venD. ropa dependiendo D. los pedidos que tenga.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. champú, jabón, alcohol, pastillas bebidas. Julia sueña con construir su casa D. material noble, sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un carro para realizar otros negocios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Tarpuy (which means sow/plant in quechua). Julia is a 47-year-old married mother of 5 children. Julia has a kiosque situated in front of the fountain at the exit of the city of Ayacucho where she sells sweets, grooming items, drinks, lozenges, and breads. She works every day, sometimes with the help of her children during their free time. When she can, she also sells clothing, according to the requests she receives.

Julia asks for a loan to purchase shampoo, soap, alcohol, lozenges, and beverages. She dreams of building her home with superior materials, of seeing her children become professionals, and of buying a car in order to perform other types of businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business and purchase shampoo, soap, alcohol, lozenges, and beverages

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.en:
S. Mahliyo is 25 years old. She is living with her parents and two sisters. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing that she has been working there for more than 7 years. Seven years ago, Mahliyo decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a tailoring machine. Since then, she is providing tailoring services. The entrepreneur says that she now has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. 
Now she is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($900 USD) for the term of 10 months for purchasing new modern fabric for sewing the national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Mahliyo and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new modern fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Dang Thi Le Group

texts.vi:
Đặng Thị Lệ sinh năm 1957 ( Mã số 010105060022) hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã lớn. Gia đình có máy xay sát gạo nên hàng ngày có thu nhập. N.ài ra, chị còn tăng ra sản xuất, chăn nuôi lợn, gà. Chị là người chịu khó và chăm chỉ, tháo vát, năng động, có nhiều nguồn thu( thu nhập từ nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi, công sát gạo,….). Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Ngô Thị Hào sinh năm 1966  ( mã số 010105060023). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/ tháng.
 Phạm Thị Nghi sinh năm 1972 ( Mã số 010105060024) chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hang  sửa chữa xe máy. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 4.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Đào sinh năm 1979 ( mã số 010105060025). chị vay mức 3.270.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ/tháng.
 Đặng Thị Lự sinh năm 1971 ( mã số 010105060026). chị vay mức 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ /tháng.
texts.en:
Đặng Thị Lệ, born 1957, lives with her husband and two grown children. They own a rice grinder which they use to earn a daily income. She will use the loan to increase her sales of rice flour, and also to invest in raising pigs and chickens. Mrs. Lệ is industrious, hardworking, resourceful, and energetic. She will have many sources of revenue to repay the loan (farming, raising animals, and grinding rice). She is the leader of the group of borrowers which includes: Ngô Thị Hào, born 1966. She requests the amount of 4,142,000 VND (245 USD) to raise pigs. Her family's average income is about 2,500,000 VND (149 USD) per month. Phạm Thị Nghi, born 1972. She requests the amount of 4,142,000 VND (245 USD) to invest in a motorbike repair shop. Her family's average income is about 4,000,000 VND (238 USD) per month. Nguyễn Thị Đào, born 1979. She requests the amount of 3,270,000 VND (195 USD) to raise chickens. Her family's average income is about 3,000,000 VND (178 USD) per month. Đặng Thị Lự, born 1971. She requests the amount of 4,142,000 VND (245 USD) to invest in raising livestock. Her family's average income is about 2,500,000 VND (149 USD) per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens. Motorbike repair shop. Grinding rice.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Alicia E. solicita ayuda para cubrir gastos médicos. En el año de 2007 a Bertha se le detecto cáncer en un seno; el cual fue prevenido a tiempo y se lo tuvieron que quitar. Ella se encuentra bien de salud  pero siguen realizando estudios para asegurarse que el cáncer se haya ido por completo. Ella cuenta con seguro por parte de su esposo pero el préstamo es para cubrir gastos como hospedaje alimentación y otros. Solicita la cantidad de $8,000 pesos
La señora E. obtiene ingresos de este negocio que se observa en la foto y su esposo trabaja en una empresa de servicio.
texts.en:
Ms. Bertha Alicia E. is requesting aid in order to cover her medical expenses. In 2007, Bertha was diagnosed with breast cancer, which was treated just in time; the tumor was removed. She is currently in good health, but the doctors are still running tests on her to make sure that the cancer is completely gone. She has health insurance through her husband, but the loan will be used to cover the food and hospital stay costs, among other things. She is requesting $8,000.00 Mexican Pesos. Ms. E. earns a living through this business pictured here. Her husband works in a service company.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hospital stay costs

loans.name: Hortance

texts.en:
Greetings from Hortance U. in Nyakabanda Sector, Nyarugenge District, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Hortance is 30 years old, married with one child.

She started her business 9 years ago. This entrepreneur operates a shop where she sells different kinds of men's and women's clothes (Fashion House). Hortance employs one person to help her to run this business; she earns about 116,000 Rwf as monthly income.

Hortance is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Mrs. Romana D., 59 years old, married,  lives in Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with five children. Her husband is government employee. Romana thought of a project that could help her husband particularly on meeting financial needs of her family. She  then ventured on pig raising, starting up with only one piglet. Needing capital to finance the daily feeds of her piglet, she then joined PMPC last July 2008 and availed of loans to increase the number of her piglets.  Now, she applies for PHP 14,900 loan  to buy one sow and a few sacks of feeds for the piglets. She plans to raise them but some of it will be sold to Sotto Meat Dealer. Romana will be very happy and excited if she sees all her piglets grow healthy, for she knows that this will be additional income for her family. She hopes to see her children finish their studies as it will be a great fulfillment for her as a mother.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feeds for pig raising

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael de la ciudad de Managua la señora Reyna C. es muy esforzada por lo que se dedica a su actividad e agricultura donde a diario atiende en la siembra de las plantas.  Es importante destacar que ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y por poseer amplios conocimientos en su trabajo.

Con el propósito de salir adelante en su actividad ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la ampliación  y mejoramiento de su finca ya que  es de importancia para continuar saliendo adelante en su actividad agrícola que tanto requiere de inversión.
texts.en:
In the San Rafael municipality of the city of Managua, Reyna C. works hard on her agricultural business, taking care of sowing plants on a daily basis. It should be mentioned that she is known as a very hard working lady who knows her work inside out. In order to develop her business she has come to Ceprodel for credit in order to extend and improve her land as this is important to continue moving her agricultural business forward, which so badly requires investment.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her agricultural land

loans.name: Benkadi. Group

texts.fr:
Toutes les sept  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont  mariées avec  en moyenne  35 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent des  familles monogames à Noumousso un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo préfecture de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. .
 Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de condiments alimentaires, d’huile, d’éventails , de gingembre , d’haricots et d’habits.  
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt solidaire. Tous les  prêts précédents ont été  bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1balle de friperie, une vingtaine de mètres de tissus, 6 bidons de 20 litres d’huile, 6 paquets de condiments, 1 centaine d’eventails, 3 sacs de 100kg d’haricots, 100 kg de gingembre, 50kg de sucre et autres ingrédients pour la préparation du  jus de fruit >. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville, à Kadiolo ville et les localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues,  la plupart au comptant, au marché de Kadiolo ville, devant la porte aux abords de la voie principale qui traverse la ville et souvent devant les écoles à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins quotidiens, l’épargne et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Benkadi ambitionnent de s’acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation, d’autres d’acheter un congélateur.
texts.en:
All seven women of the Benkadi group are married, with an average age of 35 and 4 children. They live in monogamous families in Noumousso, one of the districts of the town of Kadiolo, prefecture of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.

They have various businesses, among others, selling condiments, oil, palm fans, ginger, dried beans, and clothing. They work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele and are on their 8th solidarity loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly reimbursed.

With this new loan, they expect to buy 1 bale of used clothing, some 20 meters of cloth, 6 jerrycans of 20 liters of oil, 6 packets of condiments, 100 palm fans, 3 sacks of 100-kg of dried beans, 100 kg of ginger, 50 kg of sugar, and other ingredients used in making fruit juice. They get their supplies at the big open-air market of the town of Sikasso, in the town of Kadiolo, and neighboring localities.

The merchandise is sold, mostly for cash, in the market of the town of Kadiolo, from doorways near the main road that crosses through the town, and often in front of schools, to a clientele composed of men, women, and children.

They each expect to make a monthly average profit of 17,500 F CFA of which part will be used for daily needs and for savings, with the remainder reinvested in their businesses. The ambition of certain women of the Benkadi group is to buy a plot of land to build a house on; others hope to be able to buy a freezer.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of diverse articles for re-sale

loans.name: Pili

texts.en: Pili T., 31, is single with no children.  She has many year(s) of experience in the general store business. She sells to the villagers/public 7 days per week. She has 4 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Pili’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.All will be used to maintain business needs.

loans.use: Purchase box of herring, box of noodles , laundry powder, bar of laundry soap , lollies , twisties , toilet rolls etc.

loans.name: Nhuan's Group

texts.en:
Nhuần Thị Nguyễn, the group leader for this loan, was born in 1948. She sells rice in the market. She lives with her husband in her son’s house and she has 2 granddaughters and a grandson. Her husband, son, and daughter-in-law have salaries: they are engravers. They have a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy rice to sell.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Ngào Thị Nguyễn was born in 1967. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy scrap-iron to resell.

Đãi Thị Nguyễn was born in 1953. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy vegetables to sell in the market.

Nhôi Thị Hoàng was born in 1963. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to breed pigs and poultry.

Thường Thị Nguyễn was born in 1978. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (about $285) to buy food for chickens.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell

loans.name: Rainero

texts.en:
"I previously made baskets and other native products. Now what I do is manage a small sari-sari store business together with my wife. We work so hard to sustain our family and provide for our daily needs," says Rainero G., a 45-year old father of three children. He would like a loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase additional stock for his sari-sari store. He thinks that the loan will increase his profit and family income.

CEVI provides financial services to poor communities in the Philippines. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for sari-sari store

loans.name: Timotea Irene

texts.es:
La señora Timotea Irene C. Rubiños tiene 45 años, vive en el Distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Incompleta,  no tiene  hijos que depende económicamente de ella.
Timotea se dedica a la venta de Productos de Belleza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de Belleza como colonias, cremas, champús, lápices labiales para implementar su negocio.
Timotea tiene como sueño implementar su restaurante para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Timotea Irene C. Rubiños is 45. She lives in the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She went to high school, but did not finish. She does not have dependent children. Timotea sells beauty products in her house. With her first loan for 300 PEN, which she received from her Community Bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she will buy beauty products like colognes, creams, shampoos, and lipsticks to increase her business. Timotea’s dream is to set up a restaurant to grow as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products like colognes, creams, shampoos, and lipsticks to set up her business

loans.name: Shamim Muhammad Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Ghulam Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell.

Shamim S. baji wants a loan to buy another water-buffalo for her milk selling business.

Allah rakhi baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit-selling business.

Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Shamim baji, wife of M. A., is the group leader of these aforementioned ladies. Her husband runs an ice-selling business. He sells ice on a cart and treks to different communities and towns to sell it. His business grows in the summer season. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy ice to advance her husband’s business.

Shamim baji is seated on the left side in the photo wearing a pink dupatta and the water-buffalo belong to Shamim S. baji.

loans.use: To buy more ice to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a 44-year-old woman married to Ethlebert, a laborer, and they have eight children ranging in age from 22-4 years old. They live in Pandan, a beautiful coastal town in the north of Antique province. When she started her business three years ago, it was just a small capital to buy and sell rice for consumption. With every loan, she is able to expand just a little bit more. With this loan of 22,000 Pesos, she is going to buy 60 sacks of rice to sell in smaller quantities. She is going to buy two piglets and the feed and vitamins they need to go strong and fat and be ready for market.

On the side, she has also started a manicure business where she goes to her neighbors to give them manicures and pedicures. This is good for her and her family because if the weather is bad or typhoons hit, she has more than one way to keep an income.

Her hope is to be able to save enough to help all of her children finish school. She's like to help her husband open a store of his own and hopefully one day build a big enough house for all her children to be able to live there to. For Nida, family is always the most important thing.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Buying and selling of rice, hog fattening and possibly supporting her manicure business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon R. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 56 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Corazon owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 61 years old, is divorced, and lives with her son and his family.

Lidia started her own business when she was 50 years old. She sells cosmetics and small home products at the open market. She has a booth that closes so that she does not need to take her inventory back and forth every day any more.

Lidia's goal is to help her son's family financially and improve their living conditions. She would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her inventory. This is her second micro-loan from HOPE.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Taman Satwa Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut Suarti (-) is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Tuwed - Melaya. She is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Taman Satwa (DNR.M-0594). Ni Ketut Suarti is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month. In 2009, Ni Ketut Suarti joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs. Ni Ketut Suarti is now requesting a new loan of 1,400,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her first from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About DINARI: The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Ni KetutSuarti - (-) merupakan 45 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tuwed - Melaya. Ni KetutSuarti adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 11 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Taman Satwa (DNR.M-0594). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni KetutSuarti sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni KetutSuarti menghasilkan sekitar 0,500 IDR. Dalam 2009, Ni KetutSuarti bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni KetutSuarti telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1.000.000 IDR dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.400.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Tentang DINARI: Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil. *Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Charlita
