texts.en: Charlita M. is from the village of Mohon. She is 57 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Charlita owns and operates a snack vending business, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Charlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposa, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Para Elías la crianza de ganado es una actividad que le viene de familia, desde muy pequeño aprendió a realizar esta actividad y actualmente los sigue haciendo y su ganado es muy solicitado en las ferias de su localidad.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo a Elías es pastear a sus animales y poder permanecer al aire libre, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para él es llevar su ganado hasta las distintas ferias para venderlos. Para más adelante espera incrementar el número de animales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Elías con MFP y se siente feliz de la oportunidad de crédito, en su banco comunal es un socio muy querido ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una vaca para incrementar su ganado, para ello está dispuesto a poner también parte de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Elías, 28, lives in his own house with his wife. What he wants more than anything is to improve their quality of life. For Elías, raising cattle is an activity that came to him from his family. Since he was very small he learned how to do this activity. He currently continues doing it. His cattle are very sought after in the local fairs. What Elías likes most about his work is taking his animals to graze and being able to stay in the fresh air. He has been doing this activity for 15 years. The most difficult part for him is taking his cattle to the different fairs to sell them. He hopes to later increase the number of animals he has to be able to improve his income. This is Elías’ second loan with MFP. He feels happy about the opportunity for the loan. He is a much loved member of his communal bank. He always helps with everything that is needed. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to buy a cow to have more cattle. He is prepared to use part of his savings as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, de 46 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposa Teodosia y sus 2 hijos: Norma de 15 y Christian de 13 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Todos los días, junto a su motocarro, Moisés sale en busca de clientes para transportar, su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, ya que la experiencia de los años le ha demostrado que mientras más temprano trabaja, más dinero lleva a su hogar y se queda hasta altas horas de la noche, llegando sólo a su casa para dormir.
Aparte de trabajar con su motocarro, Moisés ha logrado implementar una carretilla de golosinas, la cual es atendida por su esposa, quien de esta forma contribuye con el sustento de su hogar.
Lo que más le gusta a Moisés de su trabajo es conversar con sus pasajeros y hacerles más ameno el viaje, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar las noches frías de la ciudad de Juliaca. 
Para más adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Moisés con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido, ya que es el único varón. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará arreglar los asientos de su motocarro, los cuales ya están muy gastados por el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Moisés, 46, is a very hard-working man. He lives in the house he inherited from his parents with his wife, Teodosia, and their two children. Norma is 15, and Christian is 13. They are the motivation for all of his efforts. Everyday, together with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), Moisés leaves looking for customers to transport. His day starts very early in the morning. His years of experience have shown him that the earlier he works, the more money he will bring home. He works until late at night, arriving home only to sleep. Besides working with his motocarro, Moisés has set up a little cart with sweets. His wife tends the cart. This way she contributes to the support of the household. What Moisés likes the best about his work is talking to his passengers and making the trip more enjoyable. He has been doing this for 13 years. The most difficult part is having to endure the cold nights in the city of Juliaca. Later he hopes to get together the necessary money to buy a new motocarro with which he will be able to improve his income. This is his second loan with MFP. He knows that he has to pay it on time if he does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank. He is much loved in his communal bank; he is the only man. He will use the money he is now asking for to fix the seats in his motocarro. Because of the passage of time, they are very worn out.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the seats of his motocarro

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel A. is 30 years old and has three children. Her husband is Mr. Artemio A. and they happily live in a village located at Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. All of their children are studying in the secondary and elementary levels of education. Because of their interest to give their children a better future, they are striving hard to support their schooling.

They cultivate their farm lot twice a year by planting vegetables and root crops. Aside from this, Maribel also buys and sells vegetables to help her husband in gaining  more income. She sells her products at Solano Public Market during market days, as well as in their village through house to house delivery. Since her capital is not sufficient to acquire more vegetables, she wants to borrow additional capital from Kiva lenders of Php10,000 to increase her capital and improve her small business. She expects that with this financial assistance, she will be able to improve her business and earn more income for the sake of their children.

loans.use: For additional capital to buy and sell vegetables.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
Henry Zuñiga M., tiene la edad de 18 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de  cerdos de cría y arreglar la porqueriza de los mismos. Es la primera vez que don Henry se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. El tambien estudia y trabaja en la agricultura.
El espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer y así pueda en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Henry Zuñiga M. is 18 years old, single and without children. He is requesting a loan to buy pigs (for raising) and to fix the pigpen. This is the first loan that Henry is requesting through FUDECOSUR. He says that the credit committee has been very helpful and has made it very simple for him to request the loan. Henry studies and works in agriculture. He hopes that this project will enable him to grow, to have a better quality of life and be financially stable. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and education programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs for raising.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en: Leab L., 24, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She raises pigs and earns US$1 of profit a day while her husband is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$4 of profit a day. This couple has two young children. Leab L. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to replace her husband's old and unreliable motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Claudia Eugenia

texts.es: Claudia Eugenia C. Equite  39 años de edad, casada desde hace 10 años, tiene 4 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la  de venta de huevos juntamente con su esposo desde  hace 2 años, a iniciado como vendedora ambulante a los  alrededores de su localidad, San Pedro Sacatepequez, Guatemala.  Ella va a utilizar su prestamo para comprar huevos para vender.  Su hija mayor cursa el grado de 6 primaria,  por lo cual ella anhela en un futuro, en su negocio llegar a  engrandecer y  tener  su propio local, y así poder distribuir su mercadería  a las tiendas de su comunidad, y así podrán  seguir ayudando con los estudios de sus hijos y que lleguen a una carrera profesional en el futuro. Ya que para ellos esto es un sueño ver prosperar a su familia,  que es algo esencial en la vida.
texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Claudia Eugenia C. Equite has been married for ten years and has four children. She and her husband have sold eggs for two years. At the beginning, they worked as traveling salespeople, selling throughout the outskirts of their town, San Pedro Sacatepequez, Guatemala. She will use the loan to buy eggs for her business. Her oldest daughter is in the sixth grade. Claudia longs to have her own place of business, from which she would be able to sell merchandise to the stores in her community; in this way, she could continue to help her children with their studies and could help them become professionals in the future. The dream of Claudia and her husband is to see their family succeed, which is important in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase eggs

loans.name: Kirima United Atugonza Constance Group

texts.en: A. Constance is twenty-five years-old, unmarried and a hardworking businesswoman. She is blessed with one child. For the last five years, she has owned a retail shop. Due to inadequate capital and lack of stock in her shop, she is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, salt, flour, paraffin, etc. for sale. She is very hardworking and active and dreams of building a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items for sale.

loans.name: Charles Muyodi

texts.en:
Charles Muyodi N. is a cereals business person in Malanga, Busia district. He has been a farmer for over ten years and started his cereals business in January 2009. He buys his cereal stock from Uganda twice a week. This is easy since Busia district borders the Ugandan Republic.

Charles Muyodi would like a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will partly go into the expansion of his cereals business and partly to farm preparation.

loans.use: To expand his business and prepare his farmland

loans.name: Gen's Group

texts.en:
Gen U. is from the village of Villaflor in Oroquieta City. She is 46 years old. Gen is the leader of a 3-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gen is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gen owns and operates a store where she sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Gen has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Gen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gen is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional product to sell. This will be Gen's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 58 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Nayef owns a home product shop. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties except making himself known to the public. Nayef decided to enter into the home products business because of his experience. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to change the décor of his shop. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To change the décor of his shop.

loans.name: Faatupu

texts.en:
Faatupu P. is 48 and married with 5 children (ages 15 - 28).  She owns a business venture, selling dairy products in the local community.  Faatupu has many years of experience in this business.  Faatupu needs a loan of WST $1750 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2006, Faatupu joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faatupu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faatupu P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.6 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.65 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Juan B., a farmer, She is blessed with one child. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own vegetable stall for quite some time now.

Edith has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her vegetable business.

To ensure the success of her business, Edith would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of products to be incorporated into her inventory.

Edith dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Yesenia tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a vender artesanías, mercadería que obtiene de los mismos artesanos de su localidad. Es así que lleva a venderlos a la ciudad de Lima, que en compañía de su mamá, quien la ayuda a vender. Adicionalmente a este negocio, también vende productos alimenticios oriundos su zona, como: la trucha, papa y maíz. Por  lo que cada 15 días trae algo nuevo que vender, de acuerdo a la  temporada. Este negocio le ha resultado ser muy rentable, ya que siempre compra al por mayor, además que tiene clientes fijos. Su deseo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, considera además este aporte le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de artesanías y también de productos alimenticios, de esta manera incrementara su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. More than 12 years ago, Yesenia began selling handicrafts from the local artisans in her area. She brings the handicrafts to Lima, with the help of her mother, where they sell them. In addition to this business, she also sells food products typical of the area, such as trout, potato and corn. Every 15 days she brings in new things to sell, according the season. This business has been very successful, as she always buys wholesale, and she has a fixed customer base. She would like to grow her business and increase her income. This is the fourth loan with MFP, and she has always been responsible with her payments. She considers this kind of support very important to the growth of her business. With the new loan, she will purchase more handicrafts as well as food products, to continue to increase her sales and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more handicrafts and food products to sell so that she can continue to grow her business.

loans.name: Jenny Paola

texts.es:
Para Jenny PaoL. S. L. experiencia de sus padres en micro exportación, ha sido valiosa para su desempeño como joven emprendedora que diseña y fabrica  sus propias carteras, bolsos y accesorios principalmente elaborados en materiales de cuero. ElL. a sus 27 años tiene mucha proyección y visiona un futuro promisorio desde L. ciudad de Bogotá para el mundo, pues vive en el barrio  San Fernando  de esta capital, desde donde hace sus primeros intentos. En L. actualidad está aplicando a su cuarto crédito, que invertirá en L. compra de cuero y sus derivados e insumos pues quiere sacar nueva colecciòn de bolsos, carteras y porta celulares. Cuando Jenny inició en el año 2.000 se capacitó como diseñadora y entró con pie firme participando como expositora en L. feria exporartesanias en el año 2006, donde pudo llevar  productos diversificados, entre bolsos monederos y porta celulares, que poco a poco se han ido expandiendo en toda L. ciudad.
ElL. es una cliente  de L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que con sus créditos logró aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar una maquina plana devastadora  con L. que redujo su tiempo en L. producción, gradualmente sus productos son conocidos también en  República Dominicana. Su mayor sueño es abrir mercado en otros países, seguir expandiéndose y dándose a conocer en otras partes del mundo.Su mayor desafío son las fluctuaciones  que ocurren con el precio del dollar  y muchas veces el no tener suficiente capital de trabajo para producir y cumplir con pedidos importantes que hacen clientes en Colombia.
texts.en:
For Jenny PaoL. S. her parents’ experience in micro export has been very valuable in her development as a young entrepreneur: she designs and manufactures her own line of leather wallets, purses and accessories. At the age of 27 she has quite a bit of future projection and vision from the city of Bogotá to the world; she lives in this capital city’s San Fernando neighborhood and it is here where she is making her first inroads. She is currently applying for her 4th loan which she’ll use to buy leather and its derivatives as well as other raw materials to launch a new collection of purses, wallets and cellular phone carrying cases. When Jenny started out in 2000 she trained as a designer and then started out with a firm first step: she was an exhibitor at the 2006 Exporartesanias Fair where she showed a line of diversified products like coin purses and cell phone carrying cases. Gradually she has been expanding citywide. She is a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has used loans to buy equipment that has drastically reduced her production time; her products have become known in the Dominican Republic. Her greatest dream is to establish herself in foreign markets, to continue expanding and becoming known in other parts of the world. Her greatest challenge is the fluctuations in value of the dollar and often not having sufficient capital available to fill all the orders she has from important Colombian customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy leather and its derivatives as well as raw materials to launch a new collection of purses, wallets and cellular phone carrying cases.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita E., 43, is from the village of Banisilon. She is married and has nine school-aged children.  To make a living, Joelita plants, harvests and sells corn. Joelita has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Joelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC.  Joelita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to pay for services to increase her crop yield.  This loan will be her 10th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

--------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Adelmo

texts.es:
Adelmo tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutas que pertenece a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la ganadería desde hace diez años, el cría ganado vacuno en unos corrales ubicados cerca a la zona en donde vive. Todos los dias el extrae la leche que producen y la vende a la Municipalidad de la zona, la cual utiliza este producto para repartirlo entre los pobladores de bajos recursos y estudiantes de los colegios. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos familiares por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo cuidando sus animales y brindándoles una buena alimentación.

Adelmo desea adquirir alimento balanceado y forraje para mejorar la alimentación de sus animales y lograr que produzcan leche de mejor calidad, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Adelmo es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia, en la zona donde vive se ha sabido ganar la estima y respeto de las personas que lo conocen. En la imagen aparece junto a sus animales.

gullosa de ella, ya que con su esfuerzo está sacando adelante el negocio.
texts.en:
Adelmo is 65, married and lives with his family in the Tambogrande district, a zone dedicated primarily to the cultivation of fruits. It is in the province of Piura in the region of the same name, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He has been a rancher for 10 years, raising cattle in pens located near the area where he lives. Every day he extracts the milk that they produce and sells it to the local government which uses the milk for distribution among the low-income residents and college students. This business is an important source of income for his family and so he always goes the extra mile in taking care of his animals and offering them good nutrition. Adelmo wants to acquire balanced food and fodder to improve his animals' nutrition so that they produce milk of the highest quality. Thus, he is requesting his first loan of 1000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. Adelmo is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. In his neighbourhood he has succeeded in winning the esteem and respect of those who know him. He appears in the photo with his animals. He is proud of them, and with his effort he is getting his business ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fodder and balanced food to improve milk production

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en:
Davaanyam D., 28, resides with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvs Province, Western Mongolia. His wife is a shoemaker who helps with his shoe-making business. Davaanyam has been making shoes for five years now, his products well known as “ white soled shoes” which are popular and warm and valued by his customers for their quality and design. He would eventually like to expand his business to the point of making a variety of shoes. 

Davaanyam, a shy, modest person with poor literacy skills, says “I will try my best to make shoes well and pay the loan on time.” He is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase materials such as glue, leather, rubber and tools for his shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wedding materials

loans.name: Mrs. Sem Ea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem E. is the village bank president selected by 14 people located in Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. All the members make up the village bank and they will use their portion of the loan for various goals. 

Mrs. Sem E., who was born in 1970, is a rice middleman and a pig breeder, who is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Khum Samret, is a rice wine maker from home. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve this business, Mrs. Sem E. is seeking a loan to buy more rice to make rice wine to sell. She is the mother of five children: one is a laborer, one is a seamstress in garment factory, another one helps the father to make rice wine, another one is studying in school, and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make rice wine to sell

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong V. is a 37-year-old father of five teenage children, all of whom are in school. His wife raises poultry and grows rice. Since early 2005, Vong has made a living by both driving a taxi and working in construction, normally earning around $4 of income per day to support his family and buy them food. He will put his loan towards purchasing farm supplies for his wife to use on their farm field.

Note: Vong V.'s wife appears in the photograph

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. sells provisions at Elmina. She has received junior high education. She is divorced and has one child. She is able to take care of herself and child with the income she makes from her sales.

Maame’s loan will be used to buy additional provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop from which to sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions to sell

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
El cliente Pablo Antonio R.. Vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Costado Oeste Iglesia Católica, Es Casado tiene 4 hijos a su cargo  trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como administrador tiene 12 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación en malas condiciones el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de Ladrillo y Cemento. para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio R. lives on the west side of the Catholic church in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, located in the department of León. He is married and has four children under his care. He currently works as administrator at the Santa Rosa del Peñón town hall and has been employed there for the past 12 years.

Mr. R.'s house is in poor condition and he wants to repair it. The loan will be used to purchase brick and cement to make housing improvements. This will allow him to improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: To purchase brick and cement.

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin S., from the city of Barangay 6 Tangub City, is 48 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, Madelin owns and operates a motor transport service. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Madelin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan for 5000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La srta. Veronica tiene como actividad la elaboracion y venta de empanadas tucumanas en dierentes lugares donde las distribuye por mayor, atendiendo pedidos y otros contratos, trabajando de esta manera junto a su Mamá dentro de su hogar elaborando estas riquisimas empanadas, generando de esta manera ingresos para ella, sus estudios y su familia, que esta compuesta por ella y su mama; en esta oportunidad solicita credito porque se presento la oportunidad de comprar un puesto de venta con el cual mejorar su atencion y brindar mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que es muy conocida por sus ricos productos, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Veronica has a business making and selling beef empanadas in various places where she distributes them at wholesale and takes orders and other contracts.  She works with her mother inside her home making these rich empanadas, in this way generating an income to support her studies and her family, which is composed of herself and her mother.  At this time she requests a loan because she has been presented with the opportunity to buy a sales post where she could provide better attention and service to her customers, since she is already known for her delicious products.  She is a very responsible and hardworking young person, and she is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a stall where she can sell her food

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas R. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $1 per day. Her husband also helps her in the same business.  Meas R. owns a farm that she inherited from her grandmother and she grows various crops on it.

Meas R. currently has one small shop in front of a garment factory where she sells a few products such as snacks, plastic products, and soft drinks.

This couple has been married for years and they have four children.  All of them are employed in the factory and receive a formal salary per month. Meas R. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan to be used to buy a larger number of essential items to sell.

loans.use: To buy a larger number of essential items to sell.

loans.name: Dorcah

texts.en:
Dorcah is 39 years old, a resident of Kisii Town in Western Kenya. She is married with six children aged between twenty and six, all attending school. She has been doing mixed farming for thirteen years, producing millet, maize and beans, and sells locally. She has employed one farmhand.

She has requested this loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.She says the milk will be a good source of food for the family and will pay the children's school fees. Dorcas wants to own a retail shop for cereals and buy better quality dairies in future.

Her challenges are fluctuating market prices and diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Esther N. is in her mid-twenties and is married with two children. Esther has been running a small fruit and vegetable stall near her house for the past year. The shop is open between 08:00 am and 07:00 pm and earns Esther a low monthly profit. 

This will be Esther's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther used her first loan to buy some second-hand clothes, which she began selling door to door. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With her second loan, Esther aims to increase her stock of vegetables at the store. Esther's dream is to earn enough money to buy land and to start building herself a house. 

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, Nadia, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Esther is the first on the left, wearing black and white.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng K., 51, is a teacher for a public school, earning an income of $4 per day. K. is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of $2 per day. 

The family has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $80 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Joseph Kipkemoi

texts.en:
Joseph Kipkemoi A. is 62 years old. He is married to Esther Koskei and blessed with nine children. Joseph has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for mixed farming.

Joseph learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy farm supplies. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to educate his grandchildren. His hope and dream is to educate his grandchildren. Joseph is a scrupulous man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bread and juice

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman who lives in Madridejos, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  pig fattening, fishing and fish selling businesses. Her husband Pepi, who is 31 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 7 months to 12 years old.

Maricel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maricel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 35,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy feed, medicine and vaccines for the pigs, and repair the fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for future education and expansion of business. Maricel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs such as candies, biscuits, rice, noodles, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Tikdankay

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Tikdankay J.. She is married and has five children aged 4, 7, 9, 11 and 13. In 1995, Tikdankay established her plastic utensil business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income and facilitate the educational process for her children. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to add stock  such as pans - 15 sets @ Le 65,000, 20 rubber bowls @ Le 110,000 and other items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of home utensils

loans.name: Nora Alexis

texts.es:
La señora Nora Alexis L. A. tiene 44 años de edad, esta soltera y vive en la aldea El Guayabo Numero 1, Nora se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general y granos basicos en el mercado municipal de San Lorenzo.
Doña nora se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años y su negocio le a dado buenos frutos y se siente muy satisfecha con su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor y asi tener mas surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nora Alexis L. A. is 44 years old, single, and lives in the neighborhood of El Guayabo Number 1. She sells groceries and dry goods at the municipal market in San Lorenzo.

Doña Nora has been in this business for several years and achieved good results. She is very satisfied with her business. This loan will be used to buy groceries in bulk so that her business will be well-stocked.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise in bulk.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 20 سنة يعمل كسائق سيارة اجرة اعزب له في عمله 3 سنوات علي طموح جدا ويعتمد على نفسه في تطوير عمله ومجتمعه يعمل حتى يطور نفسه ويؤمن مستقبل فهو يحلم في تأسيس عائلة ويريد ان يساعد اهله دائما فعائلته هي من اهم اهتماماته فرابط العائلة هو اساسي عنده يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة سيارته وثم مساعدة الأهل في تحسين المنزل يتمنى بأن يصبح صاحب عدد اكبر من السيارات فهو في عمر طموح جدا واهم شيء لديه هو عمله وتطوير نفسه في المجتمع
texts.en: Ali is 20 years old and single. He works as a taxi driver. He has three years of experience in his line of work. Ali is very ambitious, and he is self-reliant when it comes to developing his business and his community. He works because he wants to improve his own life and secure a good future for himself. He dreams of starting a family, and he hopes that he will always be able to provide his parents with some sort of financiA. support. The reason why he is focusing on these goals is that he considers his family and his ties to his family to be some of the most important things in his life. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he would like to have maintenance completed on his car and to help his family improve their home. He would like to own a number of cars one day, as he is a very ambitious person, and the things which are most important to him are his work and improving his sociA. standing in society.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his taxi and to help his parents improve their home.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Don Anselmo, reside en Anamoros departamento de la Unión, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y el cultivo de granos básicos, vive con su esposa, no tiene hijos a cargo porque estos ya viven fuera. Él inicio hace 10 años la crianza de ganado, trabaja con ayuda de su esposa y en ocasiones contrata mozos.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vaca con cría que cuesta alrededor de $475.00, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el número de ganado y sobre todo las vacas con crías le ayudan a aumentar la producción de leche.
Las aspiraciones de don Anselmo es sacar un buen provecho del terreno que dispone para que el ganado tenga espacio suficiente y alimentación.
texts.en:
Don Anselmo lives in Anamoros, department of La Unión.  He raises livestock and cultivates basic grains.  He lives with his wife but has no dependent children as they already live on their own.  Ten years ago, he began raising livestock.  He works with the help of his wife and sometimes hires workers.  Currently, he is requesting this loan to buy a cow with calf that costs around $475.00.  This loan will help him to increase the number of livestock and, most importantly, the cows with calves will help him to increase the production of milk.  

Don Anselmo plans to take advantage of land available for the livestock so that they have enough space and food.

loans.use: buy a cow with calf.

loans.name: Kum Nicholas

texts.en:
Kum Nicholas K. is 61 years old. He is a polygamist and has eight children, three of whom are below the age of 15. Given the low level of education of his older children, most of them are unemployed, requiring them to rely on their parents. He also faces a lot of food shortages in his home because of his large family size. 

Given this loan, he plans to buy more yam seeds and fertilizers, and also to expand his cassava farm. He is an old and experienced farmer and this loan will go a long way to boost the quality and quantity of his harvest. The size of his family is also an added advantage as they will provide the needed labor in the farm. The harvest will be sold in local market to provide other commodities to the family that they cannot produce and also to provide a means for the children to take a step further in education. 

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People s’ Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy more yam seeds and fertilizers and to expand his cassava farm.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel  is from the village of Looc, Libertad,Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling  fish in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish for sale. This loan will be Richel's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Santa Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Santa Lucia tiene ya más de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de, televisiones, ropa, asesoraos de cocina y juguetes. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es ropa para niño, hombres, zapatos y aparatos electrónicos.
Desea de esta inversión en su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a tres hijos los cuales están estudiando.
texts.en:
For more than eight years, Sra. Santa Lucia has been selling televisions, clothes, kitchen accessories, and toys. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business because she lacks a wide variety of merchandise in her inventory such as clothing for children and men, shoes, and electronics.

Santa Lucia wants this investment for her business since it is the source of income by which she supports her family. She is a single mother and responsible for three children who are in school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for children and men, shoes, and electronics.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending (catering) business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her catering business.

Melanie has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from making cakes and pastries.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food catering business

loans.name: Lester Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Lester Alfonso  es de la cuidad de Managua Nicaragua se caracteriza por ser una persona Responsable es padre de familia.
El señor visito nuestra oficina ceprodel  para solicitar Un préstamo para el mejoramiento de su vivienda para Invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción Como  zinc y perlin para mejorar el techo de su Vivienda.
El señor Léster le agradece a ceprodel por haberle otorgado el crédito para hacer las mejoras y hacer mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lester Alfonso is from the city of Managua, Nicaragua. He is a responsible person and the father of a family.

He visited the Ceprodel office to request a loan to improve his home. He will invest in construction materials such as metal sheets and beams to improve the roof of his house. 

Lester is grateful to Ceprodel for having granted him the loan to make these renovations and improve his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Menorida

texts.en:
Menorida is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Menorida has a fish shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional fish to sell.

Menorida is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Menorida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 46-year-old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Francis has been in the transport business for 20 years. He acquired capital to buy a car from farming. His main hardship is traffic officers who demand money, even when he is not in the wrong. His vision is to own a taxi. Francis is requesting a loan facility to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is 43 years old.  She is married and has a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh city. 

Hue's husband earns money as a delivery tricycle driver for hire. Hue supports her family by sewing clothes at her house.  She intends to use her loan to buy fabric and other materials to increase her production.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school. She also hopes to be able to save to buy a computer for her children's studies.

loans.use: buy fabric and sewing materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal “Noche de Luna II” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 53 años y tiene 5 hijos, sólo 1 hijo de 12 años vive con ella y estudia en el colegio. 
Desde los 25 años de edad empezó a trabajar vendiendo yuca y  plátanos en su casa debido a que su familia tenía necesidades económicas y ella deseaba apoyar a sus padres, al poco tiempo se fue a vivir con su pareja y como estaba acostumbrada a ser independiente económicamente decidió seguir trabajando con la venta de verduras y frutas en un puesto del mercado de su localidad.  Se inició con un capital de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. Actualmente ella continúa con el mismo negocio y lo ha implementado con otros productos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles comprará verduras y frutas, como sacos de papas, sacos de cebolla, sacos de tomates, sacos de repollo, sacos de naranjas  y otros.
Norma es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, anhela progresar e incrementar  su negocio con nuevos productos, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad de mantener su negocio y su independencia económica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma belongs to the “Noche de Luna II” Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, in the province and department of San Martín. She is 53, lives with her partner, and has 5 children. Only one of her children, age 12, lives with her and is in school.
Twenty-five years ago she started selling yucca and plantains in her home, as her family had financial needs and she wanted to support her parents. In little time, she moved in with her partner, and because she was accustomed to being economically independent she decided to keep working, selling fruits and vegetables in a local market stall. She started off with a capital of S/. 300 Nuevos Soles. She is currently continuing with the same business and she has added other products. With this loan of S/. 800 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase fruits and vegetables. For example, she will purchase bags of potatoes, bags of onions, bags of tomatoes, bags of cabbage, bags of oranges, and other items.
Norma is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She wants to progress and expand her business with new products. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for offering her the opportunity to maintain her business and her economic independence.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida dedicada al comercio de frutas esto en el mercado de la zona por donde ella vive, ya hace muchos años atrás que realiza esta actividad, ella provee de buena calidad de frutas a todos sus clientes, temprano compra las frutas al por mayor y por este motivo solicito el  credito, y después lleva a su puesto en el mercado, ella es una joven mujer emprendedora que realizando este trabajo ayuda a su familia económicamente, para mantener la alimentación de sus hermanitos que son menores que ella, ella pretende ayudarles hasta que ellos sean profesionales, ese es uno de sus objetivos primordiales, ya que por casos de la vida ella tubo que hacerse cargo de sus hermanos, siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia con ganas de superación y de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Señora Aida sells fruit in the local market. She has done this for many years now, providing high-quality fruit to all of her customers. She buys the fruit wholesale early in the morning, and later brings it to her stall in the market. She is requesting this loan for buying the fruit wholesale. She is a young, enterprising woman who helps her family economically through her work. She helps provide food for her younger siblings, and hopes to help them until they are professionals. This is one of her most important goals, as circumstances in life have meant that she has had to take care of her siblings. She is always thinking about her family's well-being and has a desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 60 years old, married, and the father of six children.

Hussein has been the owner of a bakery since 2006. He produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven, such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,800 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to buy an electric dough machine. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to buy an electric dough machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is applying for another loan to expand her current retail business. She will use this 40,000 KES loan to purchase additional supplies for her shop. In the future, Jane aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future.  

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Jane and her family's lives have improved greatly. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for her shop

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 54 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Robert has been working hard to manage his small restaurant, which sells and delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ingredients for cooking, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay for school fees. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to have the best restaurant in Pallisa town. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for cooking,

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 20 años es un hombre trabajador y soltero. Vive en casa de sus primo, en el caserío de Pantipata. Se caracteriza por se luchador e independiente. Hace algunos meses salió de su casa, para forjarse un futuro por el mismo y para el bienestar de su familia. Las actividades de este joven son diversas. Las épocas de cosecha de maíz, trabaja como peón en diversos cultivos, donde le pagan 28 soles por día, asimismo traslada tierra con maquinaria pesada, que aprendió a utilizar gracias a su curiosidad, pues le dijo a un amigo que le enseñe. Por otra parte recibió una pequeña parcela de parte de su abuela, en donde siembra alverja, pues nació y se crío en el campo y sabe las técnicas de cultivo. Ahora este talentoso joven, desea incursionar en la compra y venta de toros, donde está seguro tendrá éxito. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “tancar puquio” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Félix de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un toro para su negocio.
texts.en:
Félix, 20, is a single, hardworking man.  He lives in his cousin’s house in Pantipata hamlet.  He is determined and independent.  He left home a few months ago to forge a future for himself and his family.  This young man’s activities are diverse.  During corn harvest time he works as a day laborer earning 28 soles per day.  He also moves soil using heavy machinery that he learned how to operate because he was curious and asked a friend to teach him.  On the other hand a grandmother left him a small parcel of land where he grows peas since he was born in the country and knows how to farm.

Now this talented young man wants to go into cattle sales where he’s sure to be successful.  He belongs to the “Tancar Puquio” communal bank and this is the first MFP loan.  He’s happy to have financial support because he feels surer to make progress in his work.  He commits to make his installment payments.  It pleases him to be part of his association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Félix were to get your support, he’ll use the money he requested to buy a bull for his business.

loans.use: to buy a bull.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa integrante del Banco comunal “Oportunidad” perteneciente a la comuna de Padre de las Casas, ciudad de Temuco.
Se dedica al rubro del comercio vendiendo flores en un local que tiene ubicado al frente del cementerio de la misma comuna.
Se dedica a éste oficio desde hace 30 años. 
Su horario de trabajo es durante todos los días de la semana, los únicos días que no atiende es cuando debe abastecerse de flores para su negocio. 
Comenta que las temporadas de más alta demanda son para el día de la madre y diversas festividades. 
Sus flores las encarga y compra directamente en la ciudad de Santiago.
Con el crédito comprará flores para abastecer su florería. 
Las metas en su negocio son continuar con su negocio y que le siga brindando utilidades. 
Luisa vive junto a su hijo, su nuera y sus dos nietos de 21 y 14 años de edad. Su hijo también se dedica al mismo rubro y cuenta con una florería.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son descansar del ritmo de trabajo y poder tomarse vacaciones, salir a conocer diferentes ciudades dentro de Chile. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio, además comenta que disfruta de las reuniones y del grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que son muy unidos, responsables, por lo que Luisa se siente muy cómoda. 
Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar de mejor manera su negocio. 
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Oportunidad” [Opportunity], and lives in the municipality of Padre Las Casas, in the city of Temuco.
She sells flowers in a shop she has which is located across from the municipality’s cemetery.
She has spent thirty years in this business.
Her working hours are during every day of the week. The only days she is not in her shop are when she needs to restock flowers for her business.
She comments that the times with the highest demand are around Mother’s Day and other festival days.
She orders and purchases her flowers directly in the city of Santiago.
She will use the loan to purchase flowers to supply her flower shop.
Her goals for her business are to continue operating and receiving profits.
Luisa lives with her son, her daughter-in-law, and her two grandchildren, who are twenty one and fourteen years of age. Her son also works under the same title and has a flower shop.
Her dreams on a personal level are to slow down the pace of her work and be able to take a vacation, so that she can visit and get to know different cities in Chile.
She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza [Hope Fund] has provided her to invest in her business. Additionally, she comments that she enjoys the meetings and her Communal Bank group, since the members are all very united and responsible, and this makes Luisa feel very comfortable.
With respect to the training courses, these have served her well to better organize her business.
Padre Las Casas is a municipality in southern Chile, close to the city of Temuco, in the Araucanía region. Its name was given in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of the indigenous peoples during the Spanish exploration of America. A significant Mapuche population lives in the municipality. The economy is based in agro-industry and commercial services.

loans.use: To purchase flowers to supply her flower shop.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Gilbert has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gilbert has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gilbert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a married woman with 2 school-going children. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Zawadi has operated a food stall for the past 13 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access financial services to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy de 59 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su hijo de 28 años de edad. Desde la edad de 15 años, no hace otra cosa más importante que confeccionar, pues fue un oficio tradicional que aprendió de su madre, quien con él se defendió cuando murió su padre. Gradualmente Nancy fue perfeccionando su arte, pues su hermana le enseñó a fabricar pantalones y mediante la repetición adquirió mas pericia, con la hoy realiza su trabajo. Cuando inició su negocio lo hizo confeccionando pantalones, pantalonetas y camisas en la línea infantil, pero gradualmente amplió su mercado y en la actualidad también le confecciona al género femenino. Su actividad la complementa con el comercio de mercancía, lo que ha ce mediante guías especializadas de productos, desde hace 5 años.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, séptimo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que lleva 12 años de estar vinculada.  Con el credikiva,  comprará materias primas e insumos pues en Diciembre es una época en la cual ella no detiene su trabajo, es decir da el feliz año a sus vecinas con la máquina en la mano y esto es lo que hace que sus ingresos sean exitosos. Durante todo este tiempo de vinculación con la FMSD, Nancy se ha caracterizado por ser una clienta fiel de la organización, su negocio ha mostrado un gran crecimiento en su capital de trabajo y en su diversificación de productos y esto se lo debe a su responsabilidad y capacidad de trabajo que hacen de ella una gran empresaria de la microempresa..
texts.en:
Nancy is 59 years old and lives to the south of the city with her son, who is 28 years old.  From the age of 15, she hasn't done anything more important than sewing.  It was a traditional trade that she learned from her mother, who supported herself this way when her father died.  Gradually, Nancy perfected her art.  Her sister taught her to make pants and with practice and repetition, she got more skills, which she now uses in her work today.  When she started her business, she made pants, shorts, and infants shirts, but she has gradually expanded her merchandise and now also makes items for women.  In addition to sewing, for five years she has worked selling merchandise through specialized product guides.  

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her seventh loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has worked with for twelve years.  With the loan, she will purchase raw materials and supplies since December is a time when she never stops working.  She celebrates the new year with her neighbors with her machine at hand, and this is how she is successful.  

During the time she has worked with FMSD, Nancy has been known as a loyal member of the organization.  Her business has shown large growth with her working capital and her diversification of products.  This is due to her responsibility and hard work that makes her a good small business owner.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mardoni Andres

texts.es:
Mardoni es un joven de 23 años de edad muy luchador, el vive en Imperial, una ciudad muy acogedora que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Lima (capital del Perú), Imperial es una ciudad muy tranquila, en la cual se puede ver la influencia de la cultura afroperuana, ciudad dedicada a la agricultura y a la preparación del producto bandera como es el Pisco, Mardoni vive en esta ciudad con su medio hermano, al cual apoya con los ingresos producto de su trabajo. 

Mardoni trabajaba en el campo (agricultura) es así que junto el dinero que ganaba y se compro una mototaxi, en la cual hace servicio de transporte a los pobladores de su barrio, Mardoni es muy trabajador y lleva un año trabajando en este negocio, el se animo a seguir este negocio ya que veía la necesidad de transporte de los pobladores de su barrio y porque veía que podía obtener buenos ingresos. 

Mardoni está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá comprar otra mototaxi para su negocio y así obtener más ingresos y transportar a los pobladores de su barrio ya que es muy alejado y no hay muchas movilidades de transporte de pasajeros y no solo ello sino también porque Mardoni quiere seguir progresando para salir adelante ya que seguirá ahorrando para sí lograr en algunos meses su más grande sueño: “Tener su propia empresa de mototaxis”.
texts.en:
Mardoni is a 23-year-old youth and a real fighter. He lives in Imperial, a cozy city located to the south of the city of Lima (capital of Peru). Imperial is a calm city in which the Afro-Peruvian cultural influence can be seen. The city is dedicated to agriculture and the preparation of its flagship product, Pisco. Mardoni lives in this city with his half brother, whom he supports with the income he earns from working.

Mardoni works in the field (agriculture). This is how he got the money together from working and bought a “mototaxi” (motorcycle taxi), with which he provides a transport service to the residents of his neighborhood. Mardoni is a hard worker and has been working in this business for a year. He became engaged in this business, because he saw the transportation need of the residents of his neighborhood, and because he saw that he could obtain a good income.

Mardoni is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the support provided, he was able to buy another mototaxi for his business. In this way, he can obtain greater income and transport the residents of his neighborhood, since it is very far away, and there are not very many transportation means for passengers. Additionally, Mardoni wants to continue progressing in order to get ahead, since he will continue saving to achieve in a few months his biggest dream: “to have this own mototaxi business.”

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Otilia Maria

texts.es:
La joven señora Otilia tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera de 1 hijo y se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta Baleadas (Tortillas de harina con frijoles, huevo, mantequilla, queso y carne) su negocio esta ubicado en un punto muy estratégico, por ese sector transitan muchas personas que se dirigen a los centros educativos y centros de trabajo, ahora en estos momentos sus clientes se han triplicado y no logra cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
Otilia utilizara el credito para la compra de alimentos para la preparacion de sus sabrosas baleadas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su hijo.
texts.en: Otilia, 22, is a young single mother of 1 son, is a businesswoman who sells "baleadas" (flour tortillas with beans, eggs, butter, cheese and meat). Her business is in a very strategic location: many people pass through the area on their way to school or work. At this point, her customers have tripled and she can no longer meet all of their requests. Otilia will use the loan to purchase ingredients for her flavorful "baleadas." She needs the income so she and her son can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cheese, butter, eggs, corn flour, lard, oil, condiments, sodas, meats, gas, and disposable plates and cups.

loans.name: Yassine's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois abritant ce groupe a été créé le 21 décembre 209. Il est composé de 34 femmes habitant le même village et exerçant une activité qui est le petit commerce.
Khémesse, âgée de 67 ans, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est veuve et est mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle fait du commerce de mil, d'arachide et de niébé. Elle achète le kilo de mil à 150 F, l'arachide à 250 F et le kilo de niébé à 300 F. Elle revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires le kilo de mil à 200 F, d'arachide et de niébé à 400 F.
Avec les bénéfices, elle améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture et appuie dans la scolarité et la santé en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' that houses this group was created on December 12, 2009. It is composed of 34 women living in the same village and doing the same work, that is, small-scale commerce.

Khémesse, 67 years old, is standing at the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is a widow and the mother of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). She does commerce in millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas. She purchases a kilo of millet at 150 francs, peanuts at 250 francs, and black-eyed peas at 300 francs. She resells her goods at the weekly markets at 200 francs a kilo of millet and 400 francs for millet and black-eyed peas.

With the profits, she improves her children's living conditions and helps to cover the schooling costs and healthcare when needed.

loans.use: to trade in millet, peanuts, and black-eyed peas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Esi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Esi is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as an auto mechanic. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
In Nyamanga B village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Charles has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Charles is a friendly member of the community with 5 children. Charles lives with his family in a house made of mud walls, dirt floor, and iron roof.

Nyamanga B village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from the local spring. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Charles’ family and the 35 other households using the local water source need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Charles has volunteered to be the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Charles volunteered to be the promoter because he wants to help the community to treat water and prevent water-borne diseases. There are also four other volunteer promoters from the surrounding community who are part of this group loan: Joseph, Benard, Ladislaus and Alfred.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Charles’ community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow the community to treat their water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Munyaradzi

texts.en:
Munyaradzi lives in Chitungwiza and has 2 children, aged 3 and 5. He is divorced and now has sole responsibility for the children.

His business is mainly for producing dishwasher, toilet cleaner, hard surface cleaner and multipurpose cleaner detergents. His business is home based. Raw materials for the business are locally available around 15km away from the business. The applicant has a ready market for the products in the area comprising tuckshops, established shops, schools and individual clients.

Munyaradzi intends to use the money from his loan as working capital for the purchase of raw materials, packaging and thereby boost his business since currently he is unable to satisfy the current demand for his products.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for detergents manufacturing

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 25 years old. She is married and has one child.

She has had a posho mill business for five years.

She will be using the loan to purchase 10 sacks of maize.

Janet hopes that with the anticipated profits, she will be able to buy clothes for her child.

Her hope for the future is to educate her children to university.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of maize.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria E. is 39 years old, a trader who deals on sales of beverages, food items and drinks. A business she has been doing since 8 years. She is a dedicated LAPO client and also she needs $500 to improve her business.

loans.use:
To buy more beverages, food stuffs and 
drinks for sale

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.en:
Alexandra sells clothing. She began her business with help from her brother-in-law who gave her merchandise to start her business. In the beginning she only sold children's clothing door-to-door. Now she continues to offer children's clothing together with clothing for adult women and men. Alexandra hopes to sell all types of clothing together with other boutique items. She will use the loan to invest in wholesale merchandise and to purchase a display case. She is sure that this new merchandise will help her business grow. Amexandra is a mother of four children. She is 39 years old and has been married for several years. Her husband is her right hand man in the business, and he moved to Guayaquil after living in Los Rios. Her business is the only source of income for her family.
