Alexandra hopes that this loan will give her financial security to save for her children's education and to continue the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Alexandra es comerciante de ropa. Ella empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su cuñado quien le dio mercadería para que empezara su negocio. Al principio ella solo vendía ropa de niños puerta a puerta. Ahora ella continúa ofreciendo ropa de niños junto con ropa de damas y caballeros. Alexandra aspira vender todo tipo de ropa junto con articulos de bazar. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir comprando mercadería al por mayor y una vitrina. Ella tiene la seguridad de que con esta nueva mercadería su negocio crecerá. Alexandra es madre de cuatro hijos. Ella tiene 39 años tiene varios años unida a su esposo quien es su mano derecha en el negocio, se mudo a Guayaquil después de vivir en Los Ríos. Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso en el hogar. Alexandra tiene la esperanza que este préstamo le dará seguridad financiera y pueda permitirle ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y poder seguir construyendo su casa.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale clothing and a display case.

loans.name: Claudia Verónica

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudia is married and has three children who all attend school. Her husband is umemployed, and despite his ongoing job search, has been unable to find work, while the family debts have begun to augment. And so, to help her family, Claudia began to fabricate and to sell pinatas, her children help her as well, and little by little their production and their sales have increased.

At this moment in time, Claudia needs a loan of $375, which she will use to purchase the needed materials to construct pinatas. The well being of this family and the success of this business lie in your hands, and the family sincerely thanks you for your support and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

La señora Claudia es casada y tiene tres hijos que actualmente están estudiando, su esposo quedó desempleado y a pesar de buscar incansablemente, le fue muy difícil encontrar un empleo, mientras tanto, las deudas de la familia comenzaron a incrementar y para ayudar con estos gastos Claudia empezó a elaborar y vender piñatas, sus hijos le ayudaba en el negocio y poco a poco empezaron a incrementar su producción y sus ventas.

En estos momentos Claudia necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los materiales necesarios para continuar con la elaboración de las piñatas y con su negocio. En tus manos esta en bienestar de esta familia y el crecimiento de este negocio, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Oysha

texts.en:
Oysha L. is 58 years old. She has a high education and her specialization is teaching her native language. She is married and has 6 children. Currently she is working in a Yavan college as native language teacher. Oysha has a big family, so in addition to working in the college, she is breeding animal for milk and meat. She use milk for cream, butter, kefir and curd.

Currently she has one dairy cow and two bull-calves. Oysha’s husband is veterinarian so the animals have good care. She is gong to buy one dairy cow for the loan amount of $580. This loan could help to Oysha to increase her milk yield so she can sell dairy products in the neighborhing village at low prices. She is going to pay off the loan in 10 months.

loans.use: To buy dairy cow

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: "I have no cause to regret anything. Though I am 40 years old, married mother of four (4) children, my numerous customers gives me satisfaction," says Roseline. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells clothes, shoes, bags and costume jewelries in her business venture and has been in this business since 1995. She needs a loan of US$ 400 to buy more goods for the inventory of her micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, shoes, bags and  costume jeweleries for sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a 50-year-old mother of six and an energetic and dynamic resident of the Vituka area. She has been doing petty business for the past 20 years and has been able to support her family. She sells Kanga, vitenge (traditional attire) and used clothes. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in higher quality wood and workshop tools

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old she has 4 children, all going to school. Her husband died two years ago in a big car explosion and she is now responsible for all of her family expenses. She has a small grocery shop and she has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new balance machine and new ice box, and to bring in more new grocery products, and renovate the shop and make a new door to keep the shop safe. She wants to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering her name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new balance machine and new ice box

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is a forty-six-year old entrepreneur and mother of six school-aged children.  She lives in the Mata Los Indios community of Santo Domingo, where she runs a small business selling traditional Dominican meals.  She prepares the food within her house and sells it in a public place.  Monica explains that she hopes that someday she’ll be able to buy a local spot to run the business.  With her loan, Monica will buy a wide range of products in order to keep producing her food and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials and other goods in order to keep producing food for the customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a mother who is very committed to the progress of her family. Despite having had to fight a lot to achieve her family's well being, she has not relinquished any of her dreams nor has she changed her way of thinking. As of always, she has thought that effort and patience are the best allies of the women in her country. For this reason and thanks to this way of thinking, she is very happy, given that she was able to install her own ice cream factory at her house with the help of a freezer that her father got for her. Her delicious and solicited ice creams are found in a large part of the city since she distributes them to small vendors. Her hopes of bettering the quality of her products and creating new flavors have spurred her to ask for a loan to purchase a mixer and to repair her great freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen, es una madre muy comprometida con el progreso de su familia, a pesar de haber tenido que luchar mucho por alcanzar el bienestar de su familia, no ha mitigado cada uno de sus deseos ni ha cambiado su forma de pensar.Ella desde siempre ha pensado que el esfuerzo y paciencia son las mejores aliadas de las mujeres de su país, por esa razón ahora gracias a este pensamiento está muy contenta ya que ha podido instalar su propia fábrica de helados en casa con la ayuda de una máquina congeladora que le obsequió para trabajar su querido padre.Sus deliciosos y cotizados helados los encontramos en gran parte de la ciudad, ya que los distribuye a pequeños comerciantes. Su deseo de mejorar la calidad de los mismos e innovar los sabores hacen que solicite un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de una batidora y el refaccionamiento de su gran congeladora.

loans.use: Purchase a mixer and repair her freezer

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria de la Luz M. is a hardworking woman who once divorced assumed all the responsabilities in the raising of her son. At that moment she started working on her own in order to obtain money to cover all of her daily expenses as well as her son's studies. She started her business more than 12 years ago, and during this time she has learnt that you have to try everything in order to obtain earnings. There were times when one product would not sell well, and then she would have to try to sell another product so that she would not depend on the sales of one product only. Currently she sells menudo (a traditional soup), sausages, and beauty supplies. That way she can ensure that she will always have work and it also helps her keep active. On top of all these activities she also works at a laundromat where she has the opportunity to get more clients for her products.

She requires a $750 loan which she will repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and also beauty supplies . With your help Maria can keep on working.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Ma. de la Luz Martínez es una mujer trabajadora y ejemplar al divorciarse asumió sola las responsabilidades de su hijo fue entonces que empezó a trabajar por su cuenta para poder obtener dinero y solventar los gastos de su casa y también los estudios de su hijo. Su negocio comenzó hace más de 12 años y a lo largo de este tiempo ha aprendido que se tiene que intentar de todo para poder obtener ingresos. Había ocasiones en que no se vendía un producto y había que intentar con otro para no depender de la venta de un solo producto. Actualmente vende menudo, chorizo y también ofrece productos de belleza, de esa manera siempre tiene trabajo y se mantiene activa. Además de todas estas actividades trabaja en una lavandería donde tiene la oportunidad de buscar más clientes

Requiere un crédito por US $750 que liquidara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y también algunos pedidos de productos de belleza que tiene pendientes por surtir. Con tus contribuciones María podrá seguir trabajando.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha  M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 31 years old, married, and has three children aged 11, 13 and 16. She also cares for two dependents, who live with her because they are disabled.  In 2007, Martha  established a palm oil  business. She now requires a loan of $425 in order to buy more stock and transport facilities.

loans.use: To buy more stock and transport facilities.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
The most important economic activities in Paraguay are agriculture and stockbreeding. With this in consideration, Reinaldo N. has always worked in the production of cassava root, strawberry, tomato, lettuce, and others. For a long time the production and sale of local vegetables and fruits was the main source of income for his family. Approximately 4 years ago, Reinaldo decided to expand his business and sale charcoal. Now Reinaldo has 2 different sources of income.

The money from the loan requested will be used to purchase charcoal.

Reinaldo has been married to Nelida N. for 22 years. The couple has 2 children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Las actividades económicas más importantes del Paraguay son la agricultura y la ganadería. Teniendo esto en cuenta, Reinaldo N. siempre de dedico al cultivo de mandioca, frutilla, tomate y lechuga, entre otros. Desde hace ya mucho tiempo la venta de vegetales y frutas cultivadas a despensas de la zona constituyeron la fuente principal de ingreso para su familia. Hace aproximadamente 4 anos, Reinaldo decidió expandir su negocio e implementar la venta de carbón. Actualmente Reinaldo ya cuenta con dos diferentes fuentes de ingreso.

El dinero del préstamo solicitado será destinado a la compra de carbón.

Reinaldo se encuentra casado desde hace ya 22 anos con Nelida N.. La pareja tiene dos hijos.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in large amounts

loans.name: Ana Julieta

texts.es:
M. is married and  two children depend on her.  Both of them are studens and live at home.  Her husband is out of country receiving help outside of Cost Rica.

She is currently involved with the Leon 2000 Foundation and has been with them for 6 years.  Her credits have been put towards working capital of her slowly growing business, a grocery store.  Her living conditions are good because as she was investing in her business she was also renovating her home.

She works every day, making her sales in cash only, and purchasing her merchandise directly from the markets since none of the local providers delivery to her home..

Her greatest dream is to establish a distributorship and to see her children successful in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.


La señora M., es casada dependen de ella dos hijos, ambos estudian, viven en casa propia su esposo se encuentra fuera del pais recibiendo ayuda del exterior en costa Rica.
Trabaja con fundacion leon 2000 desde hace 6 años,  sus creditos han sido para capital de trabajo, habiendo crecido poco a poco con su negocio siendo este una pequeña pulpería, sus condicones de vida son regulares, al mismo tiempo que ha invertido para capital de trabajo tambien le ha realizado mejoras a su casa de habitacion.
La señora ofrece sus servicios a diarios, vendiendo de contado, sus compras las hace en el mercado directamente, ya que no pasan proveedores por su domicilio.
Su mayor sueño es poner una minidistribuidora, y ver formados a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anorboi

texts.en:
Anorboi A. first applied  to  MicroInvest in 2008 but he could recommend himself as a serious and reliable client. Mr. A. was born in 1960 in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and ever since he was a young man, he has been engaged in the livestock business. First he helped his father to take care of their livestock. Now he has his own livestock business and dreams of owning an outlet where he can sell meat and meat products. 

Mr. A. also works in the pumping station but the main business in his life is his livestock. Mr. A. is applying to KIVA to request a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 6 months to purchase a new pedigreed bull.

loans.use: purchasing a new pedigreed bull

loans.name: Jonas Amabo

texts.en:
61-year-old Jonas is a farmer and married with three children. He has been a member of GHAPE in Cameroon since 2004, and has used his loans to expand his farm. He used his last loan to buy pigs, and also to grow cassava, a starchy staple popular in many Cameroonian meals.

With the loan he has recently applied for, Jonas intends to buy more palm trees and invest in an oil-milling machine and one for milling cassava. As well as making tasty palm wine, the trees are used to produce (unrefined) palm oil, which is a deep orange colour and rich in flavour and nutrients. It is the most important oil used in Cameroonian cooking and forms the basis of many dishes.

Jonas says he will use his experience to build a successful business and plans to hire at least two workers over the coming year.

loans.use: To buy palm trees and invest in an oil milling machine.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 27 años. Hace algún tiempo ella empezó un pequeño negocio de bordados artesanales. Ahora, ella trabaja en su pequeño taller que logró implementar gracias a los créditos que recibió.  Sin embargo ella cuenta que le gustaría comprar una máquina de coser para poder incrementar su producción y poder contratar una empleada que le ayude con el trabajo.
texts.en:
Raquel is 27 years old. Some time ago she began a small handmade embroidery business. Now, she works in her small workshop that she successfully started thanks to the loans that she received. However, she now would like to buy a sewing machine to increase her production and hire an employee who can help her with her work.


Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Luvy Maria

texts.es:
Luvy B. es una dama originaria del municipio de Chichigalpa en la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de lácteos como queso, cuajada y crema ofrecidos en el mercado municipal de Chichiglapa. Son sus sueños obtener un tramo que preste las condiciones necesarias para la venta de los lácteos.

Ella es una dama con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus pequeños hijos y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel una vez mas para solicitar el crédito oportuno con el cual comprar los lácteos y continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa.
texts.en:
Luvy B. is a lady originally from the town of Chichigalpa in the city of Chinandega. At present, she sells dairy products like cheese, curd and cream in the local Chichiglapa market. It is her dream to have a space that provides the necessary conditions for the sale of dairy products.

She is responsible for taking care of her young children, and for this reason, she seeks the support of Ceprodel once again to request a timely loan. She will use this loan to buy milk and to continue to offer her products it her establishment in the local Chichigalpa market.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of milk

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en:
G. Mahmud is 35 years old. He is married with 4 children of school age. His wife is a housekeeper, and she is taking care after their children. Thus Mahmud is the main breadwinner in the family. Mahmud’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. 
For more than 20 years Mahmud is baking the national bread “lepeshka.” He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonal lows. He gets up early and bakes lepeshka and bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast. All the ingredients like flour, salt, and yeast he purchases in the local market. Now Mahmud requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 US dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the lepeshka. Mahmud has already had one loan and demonstrated himself as an honest client and he promises to repay the current loan promptly as well.

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking the national bread “lepeshka”

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel J., who is 24 and single, still lives with his parents, but he is preparing for his future family by striving hard to have a better life. In their village, he operates his family's passenger tricycle. The tricycle carries a minimum of five passengers. He transports passengers from their village to the town proper and other nearby municipalities like Roxasand Ilagan, Isabela. Joel uses the daily income from operating the tricycle to purchase feed for his pigs.

He requests a loan of $100 (4000 PHP) for maintenance of his tricycle and to buy stocks of feed for his pig-raising business. “The amount will be helpful in my business,” said Joel.

loans.use: Maintenance of his tricycle and to buy more feed for the pigs

loans.name: Maria Benigna

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Las Entusiastas (“The Enthusiasts”) Village Bank. She is 47 years old and married with three children. Maria has a store in the Ayacuchan jungle where she sells replacement car parts, which she buys in the city of Ayacucho and in Lima. She and her husband also have a mechanic’s shop. Maria needs a loan of 1750 soles to buy brake shoes and pads. Maria’s dream is to offer a wider variety of products at her store, and to buy a car and a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas. Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en la selva ayacuchana, en donde vende repuestos de carros, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Ayacucho y Lima. Además Maria junto a su esposo tienen un taller de mecánica. Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatas, pastillas. Los sueños de Maria son surtir su tienda, comprar un carro y un terreno.

loans.use: Buy brake shoes and pads for her mechanic's shop

loans.name: Attaa

texts.en: Attaa A. is 34 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children – one boy and five girls. Almost all of her children are in school. The last born is yet to start. She lives together with her children and husband in Koforidua, a small town near Offinso. Koforidua is a business and farming community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Attaa’s husband is a farmer. She works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a fish monger. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She also treks to nearby markets to sell. Attaa procures her goods from big time fish mongers in the Western Region and the coastal areas of the country. Attaa has been in business for six years. According to her, most of her customers are food vendors in her community. She wants a loan to buy fish in bulk to make more profit so she can help her children in school.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Burhon

texts.en:
Burhon P. was born in 1961 in the rural area of the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children who help him in their livestock-raising family business. Burhon has been engaged in raising livestock for 10 years and he is a skilled livestock owner because he worked before on a collective farm.

Burhon is a builder by professional background but that is seasonal work and livestock is the general business he is involved in. Burhon has a milk cow and rams. He wants to build a suitable seasonal barn and is asking KIVA for financial support, a business support loan of 2000 STJ for 8 months.

loans.use: to build a suitable seasonal barn

loans.name: Mex

texts.en: Mex M. is fifty-six years old, married, and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about $2 each day and are supported by two children working in the garment factory. In light of economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This will reduce their daily transportation costs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said M. is married with three school-aged children. He runs a photographic studio at Bombom, Kiwalani in Dar es Salaam. He photographs many people from Kiwalani and the surrounding area, and produces different types and sizes of picture. Said's business items are purchased from Kariakoo Photo Studio shops, and he is requesting a loan of 800 000 TZS to buy more business items.

loans.use: To purchase items for his photo studio business

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Гульсара женщина , которая занимается продажей мужской одежды.Она привозит товар с Бишкека каждый месяц.Гульсара пунктуально погашает свои кредиты.Каждый свой займ она использует для завоза сезонного ассортимента товаров. Она торгует на рынке города Чкаловска на видном месте.У неё хороший поток клиентов, потому что товар разнообразный.За время кредитования у неё оборотный капитал заметно увеличился.
texts.en:
Gulsara is involved in the sales of men’s clothing. She brings the goods from Bishkek every month. Gulsara timely repays her loans. She uses every loan to bring seasonal goods assortment. She sells at a market in the city of Chkalovsk, in a prime location. Gulsara has a good consistent clientele because she has a variety of goods. Since Gulsara started borrowing, her working capital noticeably increased.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of men's clothing

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро Шерматова  1985 года рождения ,замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет.  До сих пор сидела дома. Время от  времени помогала маме на рынке торговать детской одеждой. Сейчас когда дети подросли мать сдала часть товара Зухро и помогла ей вести бизнес. В начале было страшно , муж не разрешал, но потом со временем муж разрешил и она сама научилась торговать. По совету матери обратилась за кредитом в Микроинвест узнав об условии кредитовании , на полученный кредит  приобрела товар детской одежды.
texts.en:
Zuhro S. was born in 1985. She does not have a university degree. She is married with 2 children and up to now, she has been a stay-at-home mom. From time to time she was helping her mother sell children's clothing at the market. Now, when the children are no longer little, her mother helped her start her business, also by sharing goods. In the beginning, Zuhro found it quite scary to sell at the market; her husband did not approve of this occupation either. However, with time he changed his mind and she also learned how to sell. It is Zuhro's mother who advised her to apply for a Microinvest loan. Zukhro used the loan for the puchase of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to expand the variety of goods

loans.name: Nozimchon

texts.ru: Нозимчон и его жена торгуют детской одеждой на центральном рынке города Исфары Сам Нозимчон кроме торговли имеет постоянную работу и поэтому в магазине в основном сидит его жена. Нозимчону 24 года. Ассортимент товаров небольшой, но включает в себя все необходимое, чтобы иметь постоянных клиентов. Нозимчон планирует немного расширить ассортимент своего бизнеса, и поэтому подал заявку на КИВА. На фото Вы видите жену Нозимчона.
texts.en:
Nozimchon and his wife sell children’s clothing at the central market in the city of Isfara. Nozimchon has a steady job in addition to selling, because of this his wife is the one who mostly sits in the store. Nozimchon is 24 years old. His product assortment is not large, but has everything necessary to have regular customers. Nozimchon plans to grow his product assortment a little bit and because of this has applied to KIVA. In the photo you can see Nozimchon’s wife.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow product assortment

loans.name: Zyodullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Умаров  Зиёдулло – молодой  человек  29  лет,  женат,  имеет  2-х  детей.  Год  назад  он  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  куда  он  ездил  на  заработки.  На  заработанные  деньги  он  решил  арендовать  прилавок  на  продуктовом  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского  района  и  торговать  продуктами  питания.  Два  раза  в  неделю  он приезжает  за  товаром  в  город  Худжанд,  где  расположены  оптовые рынки.  Его  младший  брат  помогает  ему  в  реализации  товаров.  Накопив  немного  денег,  Зиёдулло  собирается  построить  собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Zyodullo U. is young man, 29-years-old, and married with two children. Last year he came back from the Russian Federation, where he had gone for work. To make money, he decided to rent a stall at the Jabbor-Rasulov produce market and sell food products. Two times a week, he goes to Khujand, where they have wholesale markets, to get supplies. His younger brother helps him sell his goods. Once he's saved some money, Zyodulo plans to build himself a store.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Amen Group

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz and I have been a citizen of the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan for the last 11 years. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines. My husband is M. A., and he makes a good living selling used handsets. I never received a formal education because our community was conservative and not in a position to send girls to school. Instead, my parents suggested that I stay at home. My father ran a carpet-weaving business, and taught me this art. Now I have expanded this activity into business, and am able to help my husband meet our expenses. I am applying for this loan so my husband can buy more handsets to sell.

I lead a group of four other women from my locality. Muniran baji wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell. Sabran baji wants a loan to buy timbers to sell. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shahnaz baji is seated on the floor and showing her products.

loans.use: To buy used handsets for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking his store

loans.name: Taskirya

texts.en: Taskirya is married with four children. She has a small business selling clothing and has been in business for thirteen years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. Taskirya has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more new clothing for her business

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d'Atikoumé à Lomé où elle s'est spécialisée dans l'activité de tresse qu'elle exerce depuis 1993. Elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d'apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer et dans l'éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Actuellement elle a besoin d'acheter 15 pièces de mèches Curly, 10 pièces de mèches Outrées, 10 pièces de mèches Lisses. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de réaménager son atelier de tresse.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Atikoumé district of Lomé where she became specialized in braiding hair as her work, a business she has been operating since 1993.  She is married and the mother of two children.  This business allows her to bring her monetary contribution to home life and for educating their children.  Currently, she needs to buy hair extensions: 15 Curly, 10 Outrées, and 10 Lisses.  To do so, she's requesting a loan from WAGES.  This loan will also enable her to fix up her hair salon. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions for doing weaves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
“Do not do unto others what you don’t want others to do unto you”. This is the guiding principle of Grace O., a resident of Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She and her husband are already separated and she has a daughter named Dainty Claire. Being a single parent is not easy so she is doing her best to support the needs of her child.

Grace is a retailer, selling different snacks and coconut oil and she also retails cell phone loads through electronic loading. Wanting to further develop her business, she decided to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders as additional capital. This amount will be of great help in maintaining her small enterprise.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus Engarcia is from Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old, separated with two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a boarding house. Most of her boarders are students. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month.

In May 2009, she joined PMPC to access financial services and to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC in the amount of 5,000.00 PHP with a good record of repayment. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy building materials to improve her boarding house and make it more presentable. Venus plans to use the additional revenue to sustain her everyday expenses.

loans.use: Buy building materials for her boarding house.

loans.name: Danelyn

texts.en:
Danelyn C. is a 21-year-old single woman living in the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. Danelyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Danelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Danelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana M. is from the village of P-4 Villaflor in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Juana is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Juana owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Juana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juana is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Juana's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo B. is commonly called “Ilyong” in his village located in Barangay Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. Danilo is a widow with six children. Despite this, he has a strong determination to give his children a better future. He works hard to earn a living for their survival and save for their future. Most of his children are already married and manage their own families.

The common source of Danilo's income is farming, and he plants rice and vegetables twice in a year. Furthermore, he is also engaged in hog raising to earn some additional income. He aims to increase his crop production and improve his piggery but he does not have enough capital. Therefore, he wants to borrow 5,000 PHP to purchase agricultural supplies to achieve these objectives. He believes that he will be successful in his plans through this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies to increase crop production and improve his piggery

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel V. está muy agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos los cuales le han ayudado a que su negocio sea mejor y tenga más ingresos y clientes.
Nuevamente está solicitando su cooperación para comprar una maquina de soldar más moderna y herramienta, ya que la que tiene actual mente esta en muy malas condiciones y no quiere que sus trabajadores tengan ningún problema para realizar los trabajos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel V. is very grateful for the past financing which was of great help to him in seeing that his business is more productive. He is again seeking financing to buy an updated welding machine and tools because the one he currently owns is in very bad shape and he doesn't want his employees to have any problems when they are doing the jobs. He plans to repay the loan with part of his business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an updated welding machine and tools.

loans.name: Garden Of Eden Group

texts.en: Rebecca is thirty–eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation in the region. Rebecca runs a pharmaceutical store in the community. Rebecca is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Garden of Eden. All the members are engaged in trading. They work so hard to put food on the table of their households and also support their kids in school. They believe the loan will help them to be more resourced to purchase food ingredients and stocks in bulk and in time to serve their customers. They believe your support would enable them grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en: K. Sherali, age 51, is a cattle breeder and the responsible father of five children, who has always watched over his family’s financial security. He accomplishes this by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become independent, with a small number of animals and a small patch of land. Sherali has more than fifteen years of experience. Cattle-breeding is the main source of income for his family and generates the necessary income allowing Sherali to support his family and improve their living conditions. Now he has applied for a loan of 2,000 USD, which he is planning to use to purchase cattle. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es: Sergio Antonio habitante del Municipio El Coral,  tiene un año de labora para la Alcaldia del Coral Chontales como responsable del área de proyecto y planificación,  su esposa trabaja y le apoya con los gastos familiares y con los compromisos adquiridos, esta solicitando su primer crédito a la institución de AFODENIC, para invertirlo en mejora de su casa de habitación, ya que actualmente tiene embaldozado una parte y desea ponerle el piso a toda la casa para que se vea mas bonita, sueña con dar mas seguridad a su casa y vivir en mejores condiciones para cuando nazca su primer hijo, este joven se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta y responsable, su sueño es tener estabilidad laborar y  mejorar su vivienda, que es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio Antonio lives in the town of El Coral. He's been working in the planning division of the town government of El Coral Chontales for a year. His wife works and helps him with household expenses and outstanding financial obligations. He's requesting his first loan from AFODENIC, to be used in renovating his home. At the moment only part of it has tile flooring, and he'd like to install flooring throughout the house to make it look nicer. He dreams of making his home safer and more pleasant to live in for any children he might have in the future. This young man is honest and responsible, and his dream is to have steady work and improve his home, which will be his family's legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: intalling a floor in his home

loans.name: Eusebia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Eusebia del Carmen L. L., es madre soltera, comerciante desde hace 14 años, tiene a su cargo tres hijos, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado central, abre el negocio a la seis de la mañana y lo cierra a las cinco de la tarde hasta los domingos, a veces le Viene ayudar uno de sus hijos, ella inicio su negocio con ayuda de su hijo el mayor que esta fuera del país.
Antes mi negocio se veía pequeño por que casi no tenia inventario pero ahora lo he acondicionado bastante con los financiamientos que ceprodel me a brindado, ahora tengo mas inventario, gracias a Dios a los financiamientos que me han otorgado y a mi negocio hemos podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Senora Eusebia is a single mother of 3 children and has run her own shop in the central market for 14 years. She opens the shop at 6am and closes at 5pm every day except Sunday. Sometimes one of her children help her with the business. She began this business with the help of her oldest son, who is outside of the country. Eusebia says that her business used to be much smaller because she never had enough inventory. With the help of the Ceprodel loans she has been able to grow. She says she now has more inventory, and thanks God for the loans she's been given, which have enabled her to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, corn, and other products for her small store

loans.name: Vevien's Group

texts.en:
Vevien G. is from the village of Upper Rizal in Oroquieta City. She is 39 years old. Vevien is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vevien is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Vevien makes and sells snacks in the local community. Vevien has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Vevien joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vevien is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used additional capital. This will be Vevien's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more merchandise to increase profit

loans.name: Jaquilen's Group

texts.en:
Jaquilen B. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Jaquilen is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business selling fresh fish to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Jaquilen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jaquilen is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Bebe Khowani Group

texts.en:
Zarmina is the group leader of Bebe Khowani Group. She lives in Kabul Afghanistan and is the married mother of four children who are all students in school.

Zarmina has a beauty salon where she works and through which she supports both her children and her husband. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years and she is quite experienced.

Zarmina needs the loan to purchase a new suite of furniture and new quality cosmetics for her salon. She hopes to grow her business and to be a better beautician.

loans.use: To purchase a new suite of furniture and new quality cosmetics for her salon

loans.name: Graciela Ester

texts.es:
La señora Graciela Ester B. R. se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y también artículos de primera necesidad.
Ella posee su puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad y muy temprano se traslada desde su casa hasta su negocio para realizar la venta de sus producto para esta actividad es apoyada por el marido.
 Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sus mercaderías(frutas y verduras) y otros gastos para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Graciela Ester B. R. sells fruit, vegetables and also basic necessity items. She has a stall in the city market very early in the morning she goes from her house to her business to sell her products. She is supported by her husband in this activity. She is asking for this loan to purchase her merchandise (fruits and vegetables) and for other housing expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions, tomatoes, apples, pears, pineapples, oranges, and other fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel L. is from the village of Mias, Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 59 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Isabel owns and operates a retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Isabel joined PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 5,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad L. is from the village of Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 61 years old. Trinidad is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Trinidad owns and operates a business selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her business. In 2010, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Magalie

texts.fr:
jeune coiffeuse de 27 ans, celibataire avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 a 10 ans,a ouvert un salon depuis 2008,ses recettes varient entre 8000frs a 15000frs par jour.
Avec le pret , elle compte acheter des produits cosmetiques,des meches, des tissages,des produits pour defriser , des demelants, des produits de beaute.
Pour aider a la croissance de son activite, elle s'est specialisee dans les tresses africaines, les plants, les bresiliennes et fait un travail de qualite pour satisfaire les desirs de ses clients.
Pour ses projets d'avenir,elle pense devenir une grande femme d'affaire, ouvrir un grand salon, ou elle pourrait employer des gens et aider a la reinsertion des jeunes filles meres. elle a un bon caractere et fait la fierte de son quartier.
texts.en:
A young hairdresser aged 27, a single mother to three children aged 1 to 10, she opened her salon in 2008. Her takings vary between 8,000 and 15,000 francs a day. With the loan, she intends to purchase cosmetic products, hair extensions, weaves, straightening products, cream rinses, and beauty products. To increase her business, she specializes in African braids, Brazilian extensions, and does a high quality job to satisfy her customer’s wishes. She plans to become a great businesswoman, to open a large salon, where she could employ people and help young single mothers’ reintegration. She is good-natured and is the pride of her neighborhood.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetic products, hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en: Sotera S. is from the village of Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 68 years old and is married with seven adult children. Sotera owns and operates a food stall selling banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar). She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Sotera joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to cook. Sotera is requesting a new loan of 2,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 5th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to buy more bananas to cook

location.town: Sindangan-Upper Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is very supportive of her family. She sews clothes by taking orders from different boutiques in her neighborhood and fulfills them on time to earn income for her family.

Nasreen is the mother of four children. She well knows the importance of education and wants to give quality education to her children. That’s why all of her children are getting an education in school.

Nasreen lives with her family in a city called Borewala in Pakistan where her husband runs a small restaurant. He serves tea and different kinds of Punjabi foods such as Nan chanay (famous Punjabi dish which made by chick peas and served with bread), kababs and lentils to his clients to make income. He has been running this business for over fifteen years and was the only breadwinner of his family before Nasreen's financial support. By presenting good quality food he has been able to improve his clientele base. He earns approximately 10,000 to 12,000 PKRs in profit.

Nasreen has applied for her third loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy in bulk required items such as lentils, cooking oil, potatoes and spices to increase his sales. Nasreen is sure that, as a result of the increased income, she will be able to enjoy a better standard of living and will repay the loan with no problems.

Nasreen maintained a good credit behavior in the last two years and didn’t miss a single meeting.

loans.use: To purchase required items for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Ngarama Farmers Women, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
They say that hard work pays, and a very determined K. Stella has gained from the fruits of hard work, having started her hotel enterprise over 20 years ago; she has no regrets. She provides lodging and accommodation services in Kambuga trading centre of Kihihi.

Due to the good management and esteemed customer care, the business has maintained customers for a long time, thus creating the good hotel market as they maintain high levels of hygiene. With this loan, Stella wants to renovate the lodges put in place good furniture, and also go shopping for hotel equipment as the existing equipment is out dated. This will enable her to get more customers, earn more profit, and meet her family and children’s requirements (such as education). She is very optimistic about achieving a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: renovating lodges

loans.name: Ivin

texts.en:
Ivin B. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 43 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs  for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $68 a month for these activities.

Ivin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Ivin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Vecinas está con formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas  una de ellas es Liliam S. Romero quien vende nacatamales, gaseosa y refrescos desde 1972. Ella tiene la meta de un día poder trabajar con su propio dinero. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Rosa V. quien tiene una pulpería y Lila Margarita Rodríguez quien vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The “Las Vecinas” (The Neighbors) group is comprised of three hard-working and dedicated women. Liliam S. Romero is one of them. She has been selling nacatamales, soft drinks, and snacks since 1972. Her goal is to one day be able to work with her own money. Rosa V. is another member of the group, and she has a grocery store. The third member of the group is Maragarita Rodríquez, and she sells nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn, onions, sweet peppers, rice, potatoes, soft drinks, and snacks

loans.name: Gregoria Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. L. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como una pequeña comerciante donde su negocio consiste en una pequeña pulpería donde ofrece abarrotería en general a dichos pobladores, tiene nueve años de tener este negocio. Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan, jabón, golosinas, gaseosas, ace, cloro y medicamento con el objetivo de surtir su negocio.
texts.en: Senora Lopez is originally from the municipality of El Sauce.  She works as a small business owner of a small shop where she sells basic grocery items.  She has had this business for over nine years.  She has worked with Ceprodel for over four years, where she has been given four credits.  She is applying for this credit to use towards the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, bread, soap, candy, soft drinks, playing cards, chlorine, and medicine, with the objective of stocking her shop.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, bread, soap, candy, soft drinks, playing cards,chlorine, and medicine.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: The two people in the picture are Mrs. Kang S., 34, and her husband, aged 36. They live in the province of Kompong Tom. The couple has three unmarried children. Mrs. Kang S. is a fish seller in the busy market and her husband sells cows. He buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the selling-animal business is the main source of income for this family, Mrs. Kang S. requested a loan as capital for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: To buy a cow to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es: Jenny Rosario E. P. tiene 24 años de edad, es modista y reside en
texts.en: Jenny Rosario E. P. tiene 24 años de edad, es modista y reside en

loans.use: To purchase clothe, thread, lace, etc.

loans.name: Everlita

texts.en:
Everlita B. earns her living by operating three business ventures: recycled materials, a general store, and an abaca weaving businesses. Her husband, Gideon B., age 31, helps his wife with the business. They have two children who are 4 and 13 years old. The family lives in Prk. Manghilao, Brgy. Masaba, Danao City, Cebu.

Everlita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired toward something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Everlita has been working hard and incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, improve the family's living conditions, and pay for the education of their children. Everlita B. is truly a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  
About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. "Dungganon" is a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable." Through this alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities they could not have imagined. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital for her recycled materials business, general store, and abaca weaving busines

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Ton S. V. has been married for many years to Phan Heng. They currently live in Kompong Chhnang Province. Ton S. V. sells a few products such as potatoes and wood charcoal in the S. Chrom District. She makes an income of approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband assists her with the business.  They also raise ducks to produce eggs to sell. Ton S. V. wants to improve her duck-raising business, which is the most profitable one for the family. She has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more feed, small ducks, and a small pig to breed.

loans.use: To purchase feed, small ducks, and a small pig to breed

loans.name: Raphel

texts.en:
Raphel J. is from the town of Labo, Aloran. He is 39 years old. Raphel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Raphel owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish in the local community. Raphel is just starting this business.

In 2010, Raphel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Raphel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raphel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie B. is from the town of Banga. She is 54 years old. Virgie is married and has 3 children aged 20, 23 and 25. To make a living, Virgie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Virgie also cooks food that she sells to their neighborhood.

Virgie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to buy feed and piglets. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Dancina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Dancina Koné est âgé de 36 ans et vit dans une famille monogame   avec ses cinq enfants à N’gomi, un des villages de la préfecture de Bougouni dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république Mali. 
Dans le souci de s’insérer dans le tissu économique, Monsieur Dancina  se lance dans le commerce (après quelques années d’apprentissage)  en ouvrant une boutique de vente d’articles divers. Avec une expérience de trois Dancina est très apprécié et sollicité.  
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso  avec lequel,  il est à son deuxième  cycle. Le premier fut correctement remboursé. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt il compte acheter, 500 kilogrammes de sucre, un carton de cigarettes, deux cartons de thé et des radios récepteurs à Bamako (la capitale de la  république du Mali).  
Il compte faire prospérer son commerce en faisant varier ses articles pour réaliser un chiffre d’affaire plus élevé dans les jours à venir. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 15.000FCFA par mois  qui sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Dancina Koné is 36 years old. He has five children and lives in a monogamous family in N’goi, a village in the Bougoni prefecture in the third region (Sikasso) of Mali. 

In order to be able to earn an income, Mr. Dancina launched a business (after a few years of apprenticeship) and opened a general store. Having three [years] of experience, he is well respected and popular. In order to increase his capital, he has joined the Soro Yiriwaso program, and is now on his second loan. The first loan was properly repaid.

With this new loan he plans to purchase in Bamako 500 kg [1100 lbs] of sugar, a carton of cigarettes, two cartons of tea and some radio receivers. He plans to build his business by increasing the variety of his goods in order to achieve a higher income in the future. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 15,00 West African francs, which will be reinvested in his is business.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous items

loans.name: El Mirador Group

texts.es:
Mirsa forma parte del banco comunal “El Mirador” conformado por 20 emprendedoras, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Calbuco.
Mirsa, quien en la foto se encuentra en la 3º fila a la derecha y viste polerón blanco, vende pescados, mariscos y verduras en su casa. Sus ventas son por mayor y sus clientes frecuentes son vendedores de ferias y restaurantes. También vende al detalle en su casa. Mirsa tiene este negocio hace 2 años. 
Ella viaja 3 veces a la semana a Puerto Montt (ciudad ubicada a 1 hora de Calbuco) a comprar su mercadería. Los días que sale se levanta a las 4 de la mañana.
Mirsa trabaja sola en este negocio, pero cuando tiene muchos pedidos contrata hasta 2 personas para que le ayuden.
Con este préstamo comprará pescados y mariscos. 
Vive con su esposo, quien trabaja fuera de la ciudad, con su hija menor, quien estudia ingeniería informática y con su nieto, hijo de esta hija.
El sueño de Mirsa es tener un local establecido de pescados y mariscos.
Ella está muy agradecida de los préstamos que recibe por medio de Fondo Esperanza, ya que han sido un gran aporte para su negocio. Además disfruta mucho del compañerismo dentro de su grupo.
Calbuco, es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, en la región de Los Lagos. Su  origen etimológico es del mapudungun (lengua mapuche) y significa "aguas azules". Es un archipiélago conformado por 12  islas. Su economía está basada fundamentalmente en la extracción de los productos del mar. En la actualidad existen numerosas fábricas de conservas, centros de cultivos de salmones, ostras, choros etc.
texts.en:
Mirsa is a member of the "El Mirador" community bank.  The bank has 20 female members who all live in the town of Calbuco.  In the photo, Mirsa is in the third row, on the right, wearing a white top.  She sells fish, seafood and vegetables from her home.  She makes her sales wholesale and her frequent customers are market traders and restaurants.  She also makes retail sales from her home.

Mirsa has had her business for 2 years.  Three times a week she travels to Puerto Montt (a town located one hour from Calbuco) to buy her merchandise.  On these days she gets up at 4.00am.  Mirsa works alone in her business but when she has a lot of orders she hires up to 2 other people to help her.  She will use her loan to buy fish and seafood.

Mirsa lives with her husband, who works outside the city; her youngest daughter, who is studying computer engineering; and her grandson (that daughter's son).  Mirsa's dream is to own an established fish and seafood store.  She is very grateful for the loans that she receives from Fondo Esperanza since they have been a great help in her business.  She also enjoys the friendship that she has found in her group.

Calbuco municipality is located in the south of Chile, in Los Lagos region.  The name 'Calbuco' comes from Mapudungun (Mapuche language) and it means 'blue waters'.  It is an archipelago made up of 12 islands.  The local economy is mainly based around extracting products from the sea.  There are currently a number of canning factories and salmon, oyster and mussel farms.

loans.use: To buy fish and seafood

loans.name: Sung

texts.en: Sung T. D. is 52 years old. She has been a farmer for a long time, and her main activities are focused on raising cows. She has milk every day to sell, and this activity creates a stable income to cover her family's expenses. She has been our client since 2004, and she has used loans very effectively in expanding her business. Last year, she borrowed 5,886,000 VND to buy grass and baby trees to supply food for the cows. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to improve the shelter for them.

loans.use: To improve cattle shelter.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a married woman who lives in Bago, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling Avon products and herbal medicine. Her husband Ernesto who is 66 years old, retired from work and helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are 35 to 42 years old. Leticia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leticia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000, to purchase more products to sell so that she can continue to save up for future daily needs and house repair. Leticia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia pertenece al banco comunal “Los Bendecidos” perteneciente a la comuna de Puente Alto. Ella tiene un almacén de abarrotes y lácteos en su casa, desde hace 10 años.
Con este préstamo comprará bebidas.
Su sueño es tener un minimarket en donde tendría más variedad de productos. Su motivación es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos: la mayor de 15 y el menor de 3 años, con quienes vive. 
El negocio de Olimpia es el único sustento económico de su hogar.
Para Olimpia los préstamos Fondo Esperanza han sido de gran ayuda para mantener su negocio, ya que además de comprar mercadería, logró ampliar un poco el espacio físico de su almacén.
Puente Alto es una comuna ubicada al norte de Santiago, capital de Chile. Fue fundada como un pequeño pueblo rural a fines del siglo XIX, pero dado su crecimiento demográfico es actualmente una de las comunas con mayor población de Chile, superando los 600 mil habitantes. Es la puerta de entrada a uno de los sectores precordilleranos de la región Metropolitana, conocido como el Cajón del Maipo, sector con espacios de caminatas, cabalgatas, rafting, entre otras actividades y servicios de alojamiento y alimentación.
texts.en:
Olimpia is a member of the 'Los Bendecidos' (The Blessed) community bank which is located in the town of Puente Alto.  She has a store in her home where she sells groceries and dairy products.  She has owned her store for 10 years and will use this loan to buy drinks.

Olimpia's dream is to own a mini-market where she will sell a larger variety of products.  Her motivation is to provide her 2 children with a better quality of life.  Her eldest child is 15 and her youngest is 3.  Olimpia's business is the only source of financial support for her household.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have been a great help to Olimpia in keeping her business running since they have enabled her to buy merchandise and also to expand the physical size of her store a little.

Puente Alto is a town which is located in the north of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  It was founded as a small, rural village at the end of the 19th Century but, given its demographic growth, it is currently one of the most populous towns in Chile, with more than 600,000 inhabitants.  It is the gateway to one of the foothill areas of the Metropolitan region which is known as 'Cajón del Maipo' (Maipo Canyon).  This area has spaces where people can hike, ride horses, raft and take part in other activities.  It also offers lodging and food services.

loans.use: To buy drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, blouses and underwear

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a resident of Kisii Town in South Rift Kenya where he has been practicing mixed farming for 25 years. He is married, with four children, two of whom are still schooling. His farm produce of bananas, tea, maize, and nappier grass are sold to the local market. Thomas solely relies on farming for his family upkeep.

Thomas has made a request for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the dairy cow will provide milk for family consumption thereby improving their health. He adds that the income will also help pay his children's school fees.  He hopes to purchase more land and rear more dairy cows in future.

He feels that the major challenge to farming produce in his area is poor prices due to disorganized markets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
