María, tiene 60 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad Rincones ubicada en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, esta casada, es madre de 7 hijos pero ella tenia 9 pero dos de sus hijos murieron así que en la actualidad tiene 7 hijos, ella es dueña de una pulpería, proveniente de un hogar pobre sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar, ella no aprendió a leer ni a escribir a como se debe, aun así ha sabido salir adelante, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería. Ella comenzó este negocio a los 30 años de edad, tenia muy poco inventario, su marido  apoyo, consiguió un préstamo para invertirlo en compras de productos para vender y así fue incrementando su venta de productos, gracias a ese negocio ha venido subsistiendo ella y su familia.  
Solicita el préstamo para comprar nuevos productos y reponer los ya que no tiene surtir mejor su pulpería. Con esta inversión espera mejorar su ventas, incrementar su clientela, ampliar su negocio donde ofrezca mas y mejores productos en su comunidad .Tiene planeado en un futuro hacer mas grande su negocio , hacerle mejoras de infraestructura su casa y poder dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
María, age 60, is from the Rincones community in Pueblo Nuevo in the Estelí municipality.  She is married and has seven children.  She had nine, but two of her children died.  That is why she now has seven children.

She is the owner of a grocery store.  Coming from a poor household, her parents did not send her to school.  She did not learn to read or write as she should have.  Even so, she has known how to get ahead.  She has her own small grocery store.

She started this business when she was 30 years old.  She had a very small amount of inventory.  He husband helped her.  She got a loan to buy products to sell.  That is how she was increasing the sales of her products.  Thanks to this business she and her family have been surviving.

She is requesting the loan to buy new products and to restock products that are not well-stocked in her grocery store.  With this investment she hopes to improve her sales, have more customers, and expand her business.  She hopes to offer more and better products to her community.

In the future she plans to make her business bigger, make improvements to the infrastructure of her house, and to be able to give employment to other people.

loans.use: to buy new products and to restock products that are not well-stocked in her grocery store.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Charles has a furniture-making shop business, which he has run for seven years.
To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more timber for making chairs. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Charles hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more timber for making chairs.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
A caring & supportive lady, Naseem supports her family financially with her  clothes-making business. She does this work for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. The earnings she makes help pay the utility bills. 

She has five children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is a plumber and provides sanitation repair services to his customers. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will use it to buy tools. This will allow him to provide better quality service to his clients and earn more profit. 

He has been operating this business for the past five years and has a good name in his region for the quality of his services. Naseem hopes that after the loan investment, he will be able to expand his business further. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy tools for a plumbing business

loans.name: Jaime Rolando

texts.es: El Sr. Jaime es un cliente que a través D. esta institución ha logrado hacer diversos mejoramientos a su vivienda donD. vive al lado D. su esposa  y  su  hijo, además D. su trabajo, su esposa  se  dedica a  la  venta D.  ropa usada los fines D. semana y con esos ingresos poco a poco han ido mejorando su vivienda  que es el patrimonio D. su familia, la  cual con esfuerzos la han estado construyendo, ahora  han levantado un cuarto  en el patio D. la casa, y necesitan instalar el piso D. concreto, ven  en el crédito la  posibilidad  D.   realizar  su  proyecto  brindando a  sus  familiares  y  amigos  que  los  visitan una mayor   comodidad, agradecen enormemente  el  apoyo  brindado  para realizar  su sueño.
texts.en: Jaime is a client of Credituyo who, through that organization, has completed various improvements to the home where he lives alongsiD. his wife and their son. In addition to Jaime's work, his wife sells used clothing on weekends. With their two incomes, they have been making improvements to their home -- their legacy -- little by little. Through their efforts, they have been building their home, and now that they have put up a room over the patio of their house,  they need to install a concrete floor. In this loan, they see the possibility of completing their project and being able to offer greater comfort to their family and friends who visit. They are enormously grateful for the support offered to them so that they can realize their dream.

loans.use: install a concrete floor in his house

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en: Camilo is 56 years old and married with 3 school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Camilo is a farmer working in the Philippines. He has been growing corn for 36 years. Camilo is asking for a loan of 27,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and rice seeds to be planted on his 8.0 hectares farmland. He wants to maintain his earnings from his farm to further bestow his family needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and rice seeds to be planted on his farmland

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
La  señora Xiomara   vive en la Cuidad de Managua,  es soltera tiene tres personas a su cargo.
Doña Xiomara   acudió a las oficinas de ceprodel a Solicitar un préstamo para hacer mejoras de su vivienda 
Para compra de materiales de construcción   como cemento, piedra, arena, piedrín y para el pago de mano de obra. La construcción que la señora Xiomara va hacer es la construcción de un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda.
La señora  nos manifiesta que gracias al financiamiento que ceprodel le dio va a poder darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. Xiomara lives in the city of Managua.  She is single and responsible for three people.  Mrs. Xiomara came to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a home improvement loan to buy construction materials like cement, stone, sand, and to pay for the labor.  Mrs. Xiomara is going to build a wall on the back part of her house.  She says that, thanks to the loan from Ceprodel, she will be able to have more security at her home.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 23-year-old father of one child aged four.  Charles runs a retail shop in Kilifi. This business has been in operation for the last two years and it has been a success. 

This marks his first borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, Charles plans to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to increase his stock of sugar, rice, cooking oil and tea leaves

loans.name: Rama

texts.fr:
Femme mariée de 28ans et mère d'un enfant âgée de 3ans. après son BEPC et par manque de soutien scolaire elle se lance dans la vente des oignons en 2006 avec un capital de  100.000. ses ventes journalière varient de 30000 à 80000.
 avec ce prêt elle va renforcer son activité en achetant plusieurs filets d'oignon, tel que l'oignon rouge et l'oignon blanc  et les echalotes .

elle aimerait avoir un stock plus consistant afin d'être grossiste dans les jours futurs.
Ses ambitions c'est de soutenir la scolarite de son enfant,ainsi que sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman is a 28-year-old married mother of one child aged 3. After her BEPC (secondary school certification), she did not have educational support and so began selling onions in 2006 with 100,000 Fr. worth of capital. Her daily sales range from 30,000 to 80,000 Fr.
With this loan, she is going to strengthen her business by buying several bags of onions of various types, including red onions, white onions, and shallots.

She would like to have a more consistent stock in order to be a wholesaler in the future. Her ambition is to support the education of her child as well as her family.

loans.use: To buy bags of onions.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, age 23 and unmarried, runs a retail shop where he sells auto spare parts. He has been engaged in this business for three years. He started by selling only motorbike and bicycle spare parts and has successfully expanded into auto parts sales. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management.  This has helped him to improve his business. Christopher hopes to expand his business and attract more clients in the future. 

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy shocks, springs, and oil.

loans.use: to buy shocks, springs, and oil for his auto parts sales business

loans.name: Belenda

texts.en:
Belenda is married with five 5 children. She is 41 years old and lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.  For the past 5 years she has been raising pigs to earn a living. She has requested a loan of  35,000 PHP to purchase more pigs.

Belenda has been a member of PMPC for two 2 years. In the future, she hopes to increase her earnings from pig raising so that her total net income is 50,000.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pedals, brakes, chains, and seats.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is married with four children.  Leonida is 41 years old and lives in South Poblacion, Larena, Siquijor.

Leonida has a small grocery store as one of their major sources of income and has had this business for two years.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

Leonida has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  In the future, Leonida hopes to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 31 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. She sells eggs to earn a living. She previously sold vegetables. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Esther hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To open a retail shop

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 and married. She also cares for three relatives and has a decoration business. Betty has been working in this business for about four years. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. most days of the week.

Betty has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase more decorations. With her profit, she will reinvest in this business, pay her children's school fees and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more decorations to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah Mueni

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself as business-minded. She operates a a general store with a grocery corner where she sells flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, detergents, fruits, vegetables and more. She has been involved in this business for three years. 

Her business is located in a shopping center. She says her biggest business challenge is inflation. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to stock general items.

Her business goal is to grow her business into a big supermarket within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will own a piece of land and a car.

loans.use: to stock four, sugar, cereals, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque en la inversión anterior tuvo buenos resultados, mejorando la producción de los cultivos, con la compra de insumos; por el momento también comprara abono y herbicidas para la nueva siembra, ya que él y su familia dependen de los ingresos que le genera la venta de granos básicos.
Él manifiesta que su familia no ha aumentado, pero sí el trabajo ha sido mejor, las ventas fueron más provechosas, todo al buen manejo del préstamo.
texts.en: Oscar decided to request a new loan because he had good results with the previous investment improving his crops with the purchase of farm supplies.  At present, he will again buy manure and herbicide for his new crops because he and his family depend on the income he earns from selling basic grains.  He states that his family has not grown but that work has been better, sales were more profitable thanks to the good management of the loan.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Madalena pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, del Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 02 hijas, una de 8 años que cursa el 3ero de primaria, y la otra niña de 3 meses.
Con la finalidad de apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de espejos, cuadros y recordatorio que ella misma fábrica y decora. Hace  tres años asistió a una reunión del vaso de leche (organización creada para alimentar a niños pobres) en la cual la invitan a participar de un taller relacionado a la elaboración y decoración de espejos, con el tiempo fue perfeccionando éste arte. Éste negocio lo inició con un capital de 160.00 nuevos soles y ahora goza de una buena clientela; para ella es un negocio muy rentable.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles comprará materiales como vidrios, espejo, pintura, goma y cartón dúplex.
Madalena es una mujer luchadora,  su sueño es poner un negocio de vidriería en su propia casa, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Señora Madalena belongs to the communal bank "Amor y Paz" [Love and Peace] in the district and province of  Moyobamba in the department of San Martín.  She is 31 years old and lives with her partner and 2 daughters, one of whom is 8 years old and in the 3rd grade and her other daughter who is 3 months old.  In order to help with the household expenses, she decided to work selling mirrors, pictures and mementos that she herself makes and decorates.  Three years ago she attended a Glass of Milk meeting (an organization started to feed poor children).  They invited her to take part in a workshop learning how to make and decorate mirrors.  With time she has perfected this art.  

She started this business with 160.00 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] and now enjoys a good clientele and her business is very profitable.  With the new loan of S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles she will buy materials such as glass, mirrors, paint, glue and paperboard boxes.  

Madalena is a hard-working woman.  Her dream is to be able to set up a glass business in her home.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for giving women like her the opportunity to realize their dreams.

loans.use: purchase materials to make and decorate mirrors, pictures and mementos.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Lucy has a shop that makes and sells snacks like pan cakes and rice cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Lucy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lucy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Abatiganda/cyrkr Group

texts.fr:
Sylvain   fait partie du groupe Abatiganda/Cyrkr. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 2 à 12 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 8 ans de primaire.

Sylvain est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, Sylvain voudrait être le fournisseur du riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants
texts.en:
Sylvain is a member of the Abatiganda/Cyrkr group. He is 33 years old and is married with five children ranging in age from 2 to 12, three of whom are in school. He has received 8 years of primary schooling.

Sylvain grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.

His strategy for increasing the size of his business is to enlarge his rice cultivation area. In the coming years, Sylvain would like to be a rice provider for his region. With his profits, he plans to ensure that his children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Akos

texts.en:
Akos is a food vendor. She cooks gari (a couscous-like grain made from cassava) for sale at Elmina. She is standing close to the gari she sells. 

Akos is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver. She helps to pay utility bills as a way of assisting her husband. 

She will use her loan to buy bags of gari. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari.

loans.name: Abdujamil

texts.ru: Абдучамилe 26 лет, женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке города. Имеет большой ассортимент продуктов для первой необходимости населения. Кредитуется Абдучамил с 2010 года и с тех пор сумел развернуть свой товарооборот вдвое. Сейчас в канун Нового года у него очень хорошая торговля и ему хотелось бы расширить ассортимент. На полученный кредит он хочет закупить несколько разновидностей шоколадных конфет Российского производства. Абдучамил рад сотрудничать с организацией, благодарен за своевременное финансирование и понимание.
texts.en: Abdujamil is 26 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in selling food products at a city market.  He has a wide selection of products to meet people's immediate needs.  Abdujamil has been obtaining financing since 2010 and, since then, was able to double his goods turnover.  Currently, prior to the New Year's, his sales are going well, and he wants to expand his selection.  He wants to use this loan to purchase several varieties of Russian-made chocolates.  Abdujamil is happy to be partnering with our organization and is grateful for the timely financing and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase several varieties of chocolate

loans.name: Celestina Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Celestina Carmen  es casada, tiene 35 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijos, se dedica a la artesanía a la elaboración de objetos de plástico: canasta y canastillas, inició este negocio por el apoyo de  un familiar y lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de materiales de plástico, cinta y venas de plásticos para elaborar mas canastas, ya que quiere mejorar su producción, sus venta y ganancias. Espera seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Celestina Carmen is married, 35 years old, and has a 6th grade education.  She has 1 child, and she works making handicrafts out of plastic, including baskets of various sizes.  She started this business with the support of a relative, and she now has 10 years of experience.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business including plastic, ribbon and plastic lanyard lacing to make more baskets, because she wants to increase her production, sales and earnings.  She hopes to continue to prosper.

loans.use: to buy materials to make baskets

loans.name: Infisal

texts.en:
Infisal is a 38 year old woman from Al Karak, Jordan who lives with 3 other family members. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to do home improvements especially in the kitchen. She would like to install new kitchen cabinets. 

Infisal prefers not to have her photos on the internet thus the above photo is of her husband

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa  tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su hijo de 7 años el cual ya se encuentra estudiando en la escuela. Su domicilio es alquilado y en el mismo local desarrolla la actividad de tapizado de sillones y asientos de vehículos. En las noches, de 18:00 a 22:00 hrs., y fines de semana en un local alquilado,  bebidas, gaseosas y refrescos. Por otro lado ella se encuentra estudiando Ingeniería Agroforestal en la Universidad.  La vida de Elisa es bastante sacrificada, pero ella es muy trabajadora y emprendedora, siendo que el crédito que solicita es para compra de máquina de costura y material de tapicería, para que así sus ingresos le alcancen cubrir los gastos de estudios, útiles, ropas y otros de ella y su hijo, también concluir su carrera para poder tener más oportunidades de trabajo y consecuentemente poder tener una mejor vida para su hijo y ella.
texts.en:
Elisa is 24 years old; she lives with her 7-year-old son who is currently studying at school. Her home is rented and it is on these same premises that Elisa produces upholstery for seats and car seats. From 6:00pm to 10pm and during the weekends, she sells drinks, fizzy drinks and refreshments on a rented site. 

In the meantime, Elisa is studying Agroforestry at university. Elisa's life is fairly demanding, but she is very hardworking and enterprising, the loan that she is seeking is to buy a sewing machine and upholstery materials. This is so that her income covers the costs of her studies, supplies, clothes and so on for herself and her son, as well as to enable Elisa to finish her degree so that she can have more work opportunities and consequently have a better quality of life for herself and her son.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and upholstery materials.

loans.name: Deranou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DERANOU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première  fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fatima Douwe est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Fatima Douwe est âgée de 28 ans et vit au Bénin. Fatima Douwe est mariée à un agent d’entretien du nom de Issifou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leur enfants le couple a trois autre enfants à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison Fatima Douwe vend depuis deux ans du riz, de la pâte de maïs et de l’haricot. Fatima Douwe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Fatima Douwe ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe DERANOU, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des du riz, de la pâte de maïs, de l’haricot et des condiments..

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther O. a 30 years old started her foodstuffs business 8 years ago. She joined LAPO two years after she started her business with her little saving. According to her LAPO came to rescue her when her business was at the point of collapsing as a result of inadequate running capital. She is eager to get the above amount for her business growth.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Edoh

texts.en:
Edoh A. was born in Kouvé (in Yoto prefecture) in 1971. She is a very active woman, is married, and has three school-age children. She owns a sugar cane field that she is busy with each day doing farm work. A very ambitious woman, she has set a goal for herself: to one day be the first woman producer of sugar cane in her area. Yet the tools she uses are still rudimentary. And so she is requesting a loan of $550 to buy modern tools and to increase her production. This will allow her to boost her living standards and her family’s too.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1971 à Kouvé (P/Yoto), Madame A. Edoh est une femme très active. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (3) enfants encore en âge scolarisable. Elle possède un champ de canne à sucre qu’elle entretient et vaque quotidiennement à ses travaux champêtres. La canne à sucre est un produit qui s’écoule très vite dans sa localité. Très ambitieuse, Madame A. s’est fixée un objectif, être un jour la première femme productrice de la canne à sucre dans sa localité alors que ses outils sont encore rudimentaires. Elle sollicite un appui financier de $550 pour s’acheter des outils modernes et accroître sa production. Ce qui lui permettra de relever son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy modern tools, fertilizers, etc., for producing sugar cane

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann S. C., is 28 years old, married with one child, and living with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She typically earns $4 day working at the local garment factory. Her husband works with her at the same place and contributes all his wages to the household. Mrs. S. C.'s child is a student at the nearby school. This couple hopes to use part of the loan to purchase a simple motorcycle for their transportation, so that they don't have to pay the daily taxi fee to to work and use the remaining funds to repair the roof of their house, which currently leaks in the rainy season.

Someday Mrs. S. C. plans to purchase a grocery stand at the market and eventually build a new house to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her family's transportation and to repair her house

loans.name: Todos Los Santos

texts.es:
Mrs. Todos los Santos D. V. is married and has three children. They were her reason for starting up her business, five years ago. She is a Tarahumara [indigenous people of northern Mexico, famous for their brightly colored clothing] and lives in the state of Chihuahua. She handcrafts the clothing and artifacts of her culture, which she sells in a recently acquired place of business. Her mother and husband help her run the business. Together, they have made the business a success, and through the business they educate people about their traditions and customs.

She is asking for a loan of $700 so that she can increase production and improve the quality of the goods she offers for sale. She will use the loan to buy raw materials. She expects to repay the loan in six months and asks for your help in improving and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Todos los Santos es casada y tiene 3 hijos, quienes fueron la razón para empezar con su negocio hace cinco años, ella pertenece a la etnia taraumara en el estado de Chihuahua y elabora artesanías propias de su cultura, recientemente a adquirido un local en el que las comercializa, donde cuenta con la ayuda de de su madre y su esposo, juntos han logrado sacas adelante su negocio y de esta manera han dado a conocer un poco de sus tradiciones y costumbres.

Para poder incrementar la producción de sus artesanías y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, Todos los Santos está solicitando un préstamo de $ 700 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus artesanías, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses y espera de tu ayuda para poder mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Mr. Wilder M. lives in his parent’s home in the ‘Alto Chijini Ladera Noroeste’ district in the city of La Paz with his father and 3 year old son. Wilder is a craftsman, creating decorations for the traditional festivals of our city. He currently occupies one room after renting a room in a different home. Due to the aged structure, the walls of his father’s home are at risk of crumbling which increases the urgency of the needed repairs. The requested loan is intended for demolishing the current adobe walls and replacing them with walls made of brick. This is his first request for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis favorably qualifies him and he is able to accept a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Wilder M. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de alto Chijini ladera noroeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su padre y su hijo de 3 año de edad; Wilder trabaja en la artesanía, elaborando adornos para las fiestas criollas de nuestra ciudad. Actualmente ocupan una habitación ya que anteriormente vivía en alquiler en otra vivienda. Por la antigüedad de la construcción, los muros perimetrales de la vivienda de su padre se encuentran en riesgo de desmoronamiento, por lo que se hace urgente un trabajo de refacción. El crédito solicitado será destinado a derrumbe del muro perimetral de adobe y a la construcción de un muro de ladrillo. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use:
Construction of a retaining wall

Construccion de muro perimetral

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zani is a 35-year-old mother of seven, and lives in the Vituka area in the city of Dar es Salaam. She has been in business for the past eight years. The profits from her business helps support her family. She sells new and used clothes, retail and sometimes wholesale.

Zani requests a loan of $550 to purchase more new and used clothing to sell.

loans.use: Purchase new and used clothing to sell

loans.name: Krista

texts.en:
Krista is 38 years old and a mother of one son, aged 12. Krista and her husband J. sell household goods such as cooking oil, snacks, rice and eggs. They usually earn $30 per day in profit. This small shop is their only source of income to support their family's needs.

Krista is a member of MBK. She is requesting IDR 1,000,000 ($125 USD) to buy more goods to fill her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Julião Fabião

texts.pt:
Julião Fabião P., married, 3 children, lives in the neighborhood of Ndlavela, in Maputo, Mozambique. Julião is in the business of selling clothes at the Xipamanine market. He joined the credit program in 2007 and is now on his 3rd loan cycle. He will use the current loan to keep improving and expanding his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

julião Fabião P., portador do BI nº 110776251V, residente no bairro de Ndlavela, vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos comerciante vende roupas Nova entrou no negocio a 22/02/07 agora encontra se no 3º ciclo entrou tomando o valor de 4000 mt a gora vai tomar 7000 mt a pagar em 5 meses vende no mercado de xipamanine com o valor vai expandir o negocio

loans.use: To improve his Clothing Sales business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to improve the variety and size of his inventory

loans.name: Ruty

texts.en:
A desire to be superior and being a natural born leader are personality attributes of Ruty. She is a woman with a high sense of responsibility that has made her become a multifaceted and creative lady able to go beyond difficult situations. After watching her children become honest men, prepared to face life, she has started social work and decided to be become the driving force for a children dining room for her community, she always is quick to help her neighbors. Helping for Ruty, gives her great satisfaction. She feels that her calling is social work. When she was young, she wanted to study and advanced but wasn’t able to go to university/college. Although many would say that it is already too late to study in college, this is not an obstacle for her. In order to pay for her home expenses and to cover the costs of a procedure for one of her children, she works weaving sweaters on a machine, while her husband is a driver for a small buss. She has a strong desire to continue her work, and therefore needs a loan to acquire a greater quantity of yarn and to repair parts of her knitting machine. With yur loan, this hard-working mother will continue with her supportive social work, weaving the dreams of her family with colorful wool.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Los deseos de superación y las habilidades natas para el liderazgo son atributos de la personalidad de Ruty. Ella es una mujer con alto sentido de responsabilidad característica que la ha llevado a convertirse en una dama multifacética y creativa para superar situaciones difíciles. Después de ver a sus hijos convertidos en hombres de bien, ya preparados para enfrentar la vida, se ha dedicado a ser obras de bien social y decidió convertirse en la impulsora de un comedor infantil para su comunidad, siempre está presta a ayudar a sus vecinas si se trata de ayuda solidaria, para ella ayudar es su gran satisfacción y siente que su vocación es el trabajo social, carrera que quiso estudiar de muy joven y postuló una vez pero no pudo ingresar a la universidad y aunque muchos dirían que ya es muy tarde para estudiar esto no es un obstáculo para ella. Para sostener los gastos que genera su hogar y para cubrir los costos del trámite de titulación de uno de sus hijos, se dedica a tejer chompas a máquina, mientras su esposo se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en un pequeño bus. Muy deseosa de seguir con su labor solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima y para reparar las fallas de su máquina de tejer.Con tu ayuda esta trabajadora madre continuará con su labor solidaria, tejiendo los sueños de su familia con lana de muchos colores.

loans.use: To Buy a Greater Amount of Product to Continue Her Work.

loans.name: Thi Hai's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hải, 26 years old, married with a small child, tends a small drug store. Her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan of 2006000 đồng, that’d paid off in 25 weeks, T. invest in her store. She’s never had a loan before. Her group has 5 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 22 years old, applies for a loan T. invest in her clothing shop
  • Trần Thị Vui, 26 years old, applies for a loan T. buy pigs
  • Tô Thị Sinh applies for a loan T. invest in her fruit stand
  • Trần Thị Hương, 25 years old, applies for a loan T. buy bamboo for her weaving material
  • Đào Thị Thành, 23 years old, applies for a loan T. buy rice for her noodle production

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Hải, 26 tuổi, có 1 con nhỏ. Chị là chủ cửa hàng thuốc nhỏ, ngòai ra, cửa hàng chị còn bán một số đồ dùng, mỹ phẩm... Chồng chị làm thợ mộc. Chị vay vốn để mua thuốc, một số mặt hàng bán. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nay tham gia chương trình vì thích được tiết kiệm trả góp hàng tuần. Các chị còn lại trong nhóm chị đều vay mức 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần. Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 22 tuổi, vay vốn để buôn bán quần áo. Chị Trần Thị Vui, 26 tuổi, vay vốn để mua lợn. Chị Tô Thị Sinh vay vốn để đi chợ hoa quả. Chị Trần Thị Hương, 25 tuổi, vay để mua tre nứa đan lát. Chị Đào Thị Thành, 23 tuổi, vay để mua gạo làm mỳ.

loans.use: Invest in various businesses

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.en:
Amina A. has lived all her life in Multan, a mid-sized city in Pakistan. She is married and the mother of two boys and one girl. Her husband has run a school canteen for the last four years and Amina helps him in this business. They are able to earn almost $100 to $150 a month.

Amina now wants to start an additional canteen in one of the local colleges and hence she is in need of a loan. Amina would like to borrow this loan in a group whose other members are: Zubaida B., who , wants to start an internet cafe; Saira B., who will buy an ice-cream machine; Nasreen B., who will buy a sewing machine; and Mamen N., who will invest her share of the loan in her husband’s vegetable business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To fund a school canteen and various other businesses

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo Espinola Ortiz is married with three children: two daughters and one son. Adolfo gives them an excellent education, all three go to school and are very good students.

In 1996, Adolfo and his wife decided to move to Argentina in search of new opportunities. They stayed there for five years and when they returned to Paraguay in 2001, Adolfo decided to invest the money he’d saved in opening his own small business.

His shop is situated in the center of Ciudad del Este (East City), a heavily-trafficked area, full of people and shops. He sells quilts, backpacks, and cold drinks.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of additional quilts, handbags and backpacks.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

Adolfo E. Ortiz se encuentra casado y tiene tres hijos: dos niñas y un varón. Adolfo les brinda una educación excelente, los tres van al colegio y son muy buenos estudiantes.

En el ano 1996 Adolfo y su señora decidieron emigrar a la Argentina en busca de nuevos horizontes. Permanecieron ahí por cinco años y cuando volvieron al Paraguay en el año 2001 Adolfo deicidio invertir el dinero ahorrado y abrir su propia micro empresa.

El local esta situado en el micro centro de Ciudad del Este, una zona muy concurrida, llena de gente y locales. Se dedica a la venta de edredones, mochilas y bebidas heladas.

El dinero proveído por el crédito será invertido en la compra de edredones, bolsos y mochilas.

loans.use: Purchase of quilts, handbags and backpacks

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị H., 54 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. She grows rice and raises livestock. Her husband practices Eastern Medicine (a.k.a. "Chinese Medicine" or "Herbal Medicine"). As an experienced practitioner, he always whole-heartedly tends to patients therefore her husband is cherished and held in high esteem by people in their community.

They joined the fund to buy medicine for the treatment of illnesses. Chị H. also invested in the raising of pigs. She has four children; one has established their own family and is living on their own, while the other three are stilling living at home, and of these, two are attending school. After three years of applying borrowed funds to their businesses, the family's financial situation has clearly improved. They have been able to purchase more of life's comforts and put money towards their children's education.

For this round, they hope to raise 9,000,000 VND to put towards buying more medicine for the treatment of illnesses. Their average income is 6,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị H. 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, chị làm ruộng và chăn nuôi chồng chị làm nghề bốc thuốc đông y. Là người có nhiều năm trong nghề thầy thuốc, luôn tận tình chăm sóc bệnh nhân nên anh được bà con trong vùng quý mến và tôn trọng, tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn gia đình đã đầu tư vốn vào việc mua thuốc chữa bệnh, ngoài ra chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, chị có 4 người con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 3 con đang sống cùng gia đình trong đó 2 con đang đi học. Qua 3 năm sử dụng các vòng vốn của Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, gia đình chị đã mua sắm nhiều tiện nghi trong sinh hoạt, đầu tư cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua thuốc chữa bệnh. Thu nhập bình quân.6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for treatment of illnesses.

loans.name: Women Group

texts.en:
Lucy has owned a tailoring business in Arusha for eight years. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children ages 3 and 8. She works every day from 7:00am to 9:00pm and generates a monthly profit of approximately $250.

Lucy has taken out two previous loans through BRAC Tanzania. She paid back both successfully and on time. She is hoping to use this loan to buy a sewing machine and other items to help her run her business. She will be sharing this loan with her three other group members who also own retail shops. Their shops sell beer, vegetables, and clothing, respectively.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other items for her business.

loans.name: Sutriyani

texts.id: Usaha jual ayam goreng yang dijalani oleh Sutriyani cukup mengalami peningkatan. Dari hasil usahanya ini, dia sudah bisa melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya. Kali ini merupakan periode pinjaman kedua bagi Sutriyani, dan dia berharap mendapat jumlah pinjaman yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Pada pinjaman pertama dia mendapatkan bantuan modal usaha sebesar Rp.800.000. Modal tersebut telah dipergunakan untuk mendukung usahanya dengan membeli daging ayam, bumbu dan sayur-sayuran untuk lalapan. Usahanya ini saat ini bisa menambah penghasilannya dari Rp.60.000 menjadi Rp.100.000 setiap hari. Dengan kenaikan dari segi pendapatan dia berharap nantinya bisa mengembalikan pinjaman kedua ini tepat waktu seperti pinjaman pertama. Selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari, keuntungan yang diperoleh juga dipakai untuk menabung bagi pendidikan dan kesehatan bagi bayinya yang berusia 14 bulan.
texts.en:
Sutriyani’s Fried Chicken business is developing. From the business, she is able to repay her previous loan. This time is her second round of loan, and she expects to receive bigger amount of it. From her first loan, she received IDR 800.000 (USD 87.9). The loan was used to buy chicken meat, seasoning, and fresh vegetables that goes with the meal she is selling. From the loan and the business, she gains from IDR 60.000 (USD 6.6) to IDR 100.000 (USD 10.98) a day. With the income raise, she hopes to repay her second loan on time like she did for the first loan. The profit from her business will be used to support her daily needs and to save for education and health care of her 14-months old baby.

Translated from Indonesian by Iman Madaze, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add business capital

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married. She has run her own general store since 2005. Currently she earns a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Khadija is now requesting a loan to expand her stock.

loans.use: To buy more items for her general store.

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es:
Don Félix Ángel  Fúnez L. con edad de 45 años su estado civil es de casado, el tiene  6 hijos  las edades de sus hijos son de 25,23 y 20 años de edad respectivamente los varones, los cuales no dependen de el directamente ya que trabajan por cuenta propia las mujeres tienen edades  de 16, 6 y 3 años la niña de16 años cursa la secundaria y la niña de 6 años cursa la primaria y la de 3 años todavía no asiste a clases, su esposa es la que se dedica a la comercialización de la venta de carne de res y ganado en pie, por lo que el señor se encarga de buscar en las diferentes comunidades los animales para su debida comercialización  y para el destace de forma semanal, la señora es su apoyo principal en  la administración del negocio, además de obtener estos ingresos como comerciante el señor también se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte ya que  tiene la facilidad de un camión, lo que le facilita brindar este servicio, además de la comercialización de granos básicos, obteniendo otros ingresos que le ayuden a los diferentes gastos de su casa, uno de los propósitos que el tiene es poder comprar en un corto plazo otro camión el cual vendría a ampliar su segmento de mercado, y aprovechar la oportunidad y así poder brindar a sus clientes el servicio de transporte.

Don Félix solicita su crédito numero 6 aunque el cuenta con mas de 12 años de trabajar con la fundación león 2000, la actividad  económica de don Félix es la compra venta y destace de ganado en el domicilio de telica  y cuenta con mas de 12 años de experiencia en su negocio, el negocio surge de la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingreso para mantener a su familia ya que cada día que pasaba su familia  crecía y debía mantenerla al pasar del tiempo logro comparar un camión que ayudara a trasladar y facilitara el movimiento de su actividad económica para que con la ayuda de las organizaciones pueda poder realizar su sueños
texts.en:
Félix Ángel Fúnez L. is 45 years old and he is married. He has 6 children aged 25, 23, and 20 years old respectively and they are the boys. They no longer depend on him because they are all working. The girls are aged 16, 6 and 3 years old. The 16 year old girl is going to high school. The 6 year old is going to primary school and the three year old doesn’t go to school yet. His wife sells beef meats and meat pies. And his job is to search out different communities where to purchase the livestock to sell and butcher on a weekly basis. His wife is his main support in the administration of the business. Aside from this source of income he also spends his time offering public transport with the help of his bus. He also sells grains, all of this to obtain the necessary income to cover the household expenses. One of his goals is to purchase another truck which will be able to expand his market, also taking the opportunity to provide his clients with transportation.

Felix is requesting his sixth loan, having been with Fundacion Leon 2000 for the past 12 years. Felix’s business is the buying, selling and butchering of beef cattle in the region of Telica. He is backed by 12 years’ experience in the business. He sees the need to have a source of income to support his family especially because every day his family keeps on growing. With time he managed to purchase a truck that helped him with his business. With this and the help of the organization he will be able to make his dreams a reality.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy T. is a 40-year-old married woman, and she has three children. She owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood, where she sells items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, and powdered milk.

She is now seeking a loan because she wants to increase her shop's inventory by purchasing additional bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, and boxes of body and hair creams. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children in school.

Mercy belongs to the community group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory by purchasing additional rice, sugar, vegetable oil, creams, etc.

loans.name: Ngveng

texts.en:
Ngveng T., 39, lives with her husband and four children in the Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Three of their children are students and one is too young to attend school. She typically makes $4 each day, selling various kinds of dessert. Her husband is a mechanic, fixing motorbikes and bicycles. On average, he makes $5 a day. 

Ngveng T. would like to take out a loan of $750 to purchase tools for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Patricio De Jesus

texts.es: Patricio de Jesús Sarniento R. quiere ampliar su casa  el cual ya tiene parte de la construcción pero le falta algunos detalles y quiere terminar para poder cambiarse a la nueva habitación. Lo quiere para comprar material y pagar mano de obra el cual solicita $6,000 pesos.
texts.en:
Patricio de Jesús S. R. would like to make home improvements. Part of his house is already built, so he needs to make the final touches to be able to move to his new room. He would like to buy construction material and hire workers to help him. He is requesting for $6,000 Mexican pesos ($450).

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. is a widowed 60 year old trader and mother of eight children. All of her children are now adults. She resides in the Abofour community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Her husband died after a short battle with an illness.

Grace is a very resourceful single mother whose hard effort brings income to the family. For the past three years, Grace has supported her kids through the sale of used clothing. Selling used clothing is big business in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Grace travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her save for her children's future and rent a store to trade.

Grace belongs to a village bank called ‘Asedaben’ which means Thanksgiving.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en: Mrs. Yan L. lives in Cheak village in Kandal province. She earns income breeding pigs, while her husband, Mr. Houl Lim, is a farmer who cultivates rice on a plot of land that he owns. The farming business is facing difficulties, because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and hire laborers to work on the field. Therefore, Mrs. Yan L. has decided to take out a loan for these purposes.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers, pesticides, fuel, and hire of farm laborers

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Phượng  năm nay 36 tuổi . Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đang tuổi đến trường tại xã Hưng Trung huyện Hưng Nguyên - Nghệ An. Năm 2002 chị Phượng tham gia Quỹ tìnhthương và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.  Hiện tại chị Phượng vẫn đang sử dụng vốn để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và nấu rượu bán tại nhà. Anh  Thanh chồng chị ngoài thời gian giúp đỡ vợ chăn nuôi còn đi làm thêm nghề thợ xây cho thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm lợn và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phượng, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two school-age children in Hưng Trung commune, Hưng Nguyên district, Nghệ An province. In 2002, Mrs. Phượng joined the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising pigs. Currently, she is still using loans from the Fund to raise pigs, and in addition she now brews wine for sale at home. Her husband Thanh, besides helping Mrs. Phượng with the animals, also works as a construction worker, earning 2,000,000 VND (114 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Phượng hopes to borrow 18,000,000 VND (1025 USD) to buy more pigs and animal feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising pigs

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Married with three children, Paul makes his living by farming and selling household products.  This loan of $100 will be his first from GHAPE, one of Kiva's field partners, and will be used to purchase kerosene, oil, Maggi (a popular seasoning in Cameroon), plantain stems for planting and labor to assist in clearing his farmland.  

Because there is a constant demand for the household products Paul sells, as well as the convenient location of his store, he believes his business will succeed.  In addition, Paul is helping the community by purchasing the plantain stems from fellow neighbors.  

All three of his children are under the age of fifteen, so the profits of his business will go toward his children's school fees and to expand his farming business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Farm labor, plaintain stems, kerosene, oil and Maggi

loans.name: Godfrey's Group

texts.en:
G. Godfrey is the leader of Luwayo sub group in Lugazi. He has a retail shop business that has been able to expand as a result of injecting money from loans every now and then. He has five children that he has been able to pay school fees for, as he gets profits from his shop sales. He has also bought three cows out of his profits and hard work and these are now giving him milk for sale. Godfrey has also benefited from joining his lending group by being able to save and increase his savings time and again.

Godfrey needs another loan to be able to buy more shop products, so as to have more sales.

loans.use: To buy more more stock for his shop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
S. Nguyen Thi is fifty-five years old and lives in the town of Hng Nguyen.  She is married and has four grown children.  To make a living, S. owns and operates a manufacturing business.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community.  S. has been engaged in this business for over ten years.

In 2002, S. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding the business.  S. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase machinery for the business.  It will be her eighth loan from TYM Fund.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia C. owns a small sari-sari (store). She is 57 years old and has three children. She wants to make her business grow. Her wish is that her business will be sustainable. Alicia uses the income from her store to take care of her family's needs.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her sari-sari. "With my loan I could start expanding my business to a larger scale," she said.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. CEVI provides financial service to the poor. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her sari-sari (store)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. sells cooked food like rice, eba (a fried cassava dish), moi-moi (a steamed-beans cake) and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She is married with four children and she is 53 years old.

Esther hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and a deep-freezer to enable her to sell cold drinks. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and a deep-freezer

loans.name: Malai

texts.en:
Ms. Malai M., 27, is single and lives with her parents along National Road 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has one brother and three sisters.

Malai has been selling clothes for over two years. She buys them from a market located in Phnom Penh and resells them in front of a garment factory. She hopes to continue expanding her business so she can support her family more effectively. Thus, she is requesting a loan of $700 in order to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To continue expanding her selling clothes business.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en: Christian J. is 58 years old and married with 6 children. She sells sarongs and bags in the market. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags to sell

loans.name: Ndika C Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Ndiuka C borrower group,she is 45 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 5 children.Her children are aged 22,18,15,13 and 10 years.

Maria started her own grocery business selling soda,beer 4 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tsh.

This is Maria`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more soda and beer.
With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Maria hopes to save more money and expand her business.
Estelina is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan from BRAC 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business

loans.use: To buy more soda,beer

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel M. is 23 years old, married, and has one child who is five years old. She lives in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. For six years she has owned a small shop where she sells different kind of merchandise, as shown in the picture. Her shop is open everyday from 7:00AM to 6:00PM. Before starting the business Rachel was a full-time housewife and could not get enough money to meet the needs of her family.

With the new loan she has requested, Rachel will be able to purchase more merchandise for her shop which will help her to earn more profit and to expand her business. She also hopes that once this business grows, people in her community will be able to buy groceries. With the expansion of her business, she hopes to employ neighbors in the community so that they can send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Tulda

texts.en:
Tulda is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 22 year old woman, she is married and a mother 2 children. Her children are 4 and 2 years old.

Tulda has owned a clothing business selling clothes for 4 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 80,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Tulda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Tulda hopes to save more money, pay school fess, get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for  sale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia C. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business woman. She runs a tailoring mart sewing different types of clothes for both women and men. She also does school uniforms and other clothes for children.

The business area is at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business materials from both retail and wholesale shops at Kigamboni and Kariakoo city shopping center.

The business income helps her run her daily life and business capitalization. She needs a loan of TZS 600,000 to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business materials

loans.name: Frema

texts.en:
Frema is a very religious woman who always puts God first in whatever she does. Frema is 26 years old and resides in the village of San Vicente, Quirino, Isabela together with her husband and two children aged four years old and two months old. As a mother, she is hoping to provide the best future for her children. For that reason, she is striving hard to maintain her business and hopes that someday she could extend it to a more stable business.

Frema has been engaged in a hog raising business for two years. She needs additional capital to purchase more hogs to raise and their supply of feed and medicines.  For her second loan, she is requesting to avail herself of a loan of PHP 5,000 for the maintenance and growth of her hog raising business. She is hoping that her loan will be approved because it will contribute a lot to the progress of her business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs, feed and medicines for her livestock

loans.name: C8670 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Y. Uwamahoro is 30 years old and married with three children aged 4 through 10. She and her family live in Rubavu District in Gisenyi Province, about 3 hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Y. really knows her business very well - she has thirteen years of experience in the banana industry. She employs several people from her community and is known for quality products and good service. Her business yields a monthly profit of 50,000 RWF (approximately US$90) and she hopes this loan will help her to increase this amount.

Y. is requesting this loan from Vision Finance Company to provide needed working capital, to purchase inventory and to manage the cash flow of her seasonal business. She has had two previous loans from Vision Finance Company which she repaid on time and in full. Y. thanks VFC and Kiva for supporting her enterprise.

In the photo we do not see seven people because F. Mukarwego was not available.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeurn Pok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of twelve people, is located in Prey Kokir village in Takeo province. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Thoeurn P. is a farmer who owns 0.7-hectare (1.75-acre) field on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this plantation, she also raises pigs.

Since her pig business is doing well, Mrs. Thoeurn P. wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig feed. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens to raise, too. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Thoeurn P. is the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are studying in the local school. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Rom, is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more piglets, pig feed and chickens to raise

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora. Zamboanga del Sur. She is 49 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Monina owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling clothing products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-one years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Monina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Monina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is also known as Mama Linda in her community in Benin City in the State of Edo in Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, onions, melons and cooking oil. She loves this business because of the profits. She is 38 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a police officer and he also supports their household. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa.  She needs a loan amount of NGN 40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Toilat

texts.en:
Toilat is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Both his sons attend a local secondary school. 

Toilat has operated a taxi service in his town since 2005. He drives people around his town and throughout Bayan-Uulgii province. Before he started a taxi service, Toilat ran a grocery store with his wife.  With the income from the grocery store he bought a car. Now his wife runs the grocery store while he provides a taxi service for the residents of his province.  

Toilat is very hardworking and is known for his good character. He has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. He works hard to maintain his success and is hopeful about the future. He is requesting a 200,000 tugrug loan to purchase new tires for his car.

loans.use: To purchase 4 tires

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es:
“Quiere al Niño”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  12 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 4 años.
Dionisia Victoria asume el cargo de presidenta, tiene 50 años, conviviente, y tiene 5 hijos todos ellos independientes.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica al tejido a crochet (tejido manual), se inicio en este negocio porque inicialmente trabajó en una empresa, en el cual logró aprender y  decidió independizarse, actualmente trabaja con un cliente el cual exporta sus productos, además participa en un comedor popular de Horacio Zevallos y apoya a un sacerdote como asistenta social de ayuda comunitaria en diversas zonas del cono este de Lima.
Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado la educación de sus hijos en una universidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra de materiales para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
“Quiere al Niño” is a community bank made up of 12 enthusiastic and enterprising members, who pursue different activities, including production, trade and services. They have worked with EDAPROSPO Prosperidad for four years. Dionisia Victoria, who is the president of the group, is 50 years old, lives with her partner and has five children, all of whom are independent. For 8 years, she has been crocheting textiles by hand. She started this business because she had worked in a factory, where she learned this skill, and decided to pursue it independently. At present, she works with a client, who exports her products. She is also involved in Horacio Zevallos’ popular restaurant, and she helps a priest as a social assistant and works to help members of the community in different areas in the eastern part of Lima. Because of her hard work, she has succeeded in sending her children to a university and in improving the quality of her life. This loan will be used to buy materials for her business. All of our members agree to help each other and commit to pay the loan installments.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su madre y sus 3 hijos: Zarai (9), David (6) y Jordi (5).
Desde hace un año, esta laboriosa mujer se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos comestibles en una pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa; para ello habilitó un espacio y en ese lugar atiende todos los días desde muy temprano.
Lo que más le agrada de esta actividad es que puede interactuar con sus vecinos y amigos y de esta manera no se le hace tan tedioso trabajar, además le genera buenas ganancias económicas que hasta el momento le han permitido sacar adelante a su familia.
Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca y gana muy bien por las ventas.
Para el futuro tiene planeado implementar una tienda más grande de comestibles donde tenga todo tipo de productos, una especie de minimarket donde pueda atender y administrar el negocio.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, como en las anteriores oportunidades lo ha hecho. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mercadería para su tienda y también productos de belleza para tenerlos almacenados y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Noemí, 36 years of age, lives in her own house in the company of her mother and three children: Zarai (9), David (6) and Jordi (5). For a year now, this hard-working woman sells an assortment of groceries in a small store setup in her house; she set aside an area where helps her customers every day since early in the morning. What she enjoys the most from this business is that she can interact with her neighbors and friends, and she does not feel the work is boring; additionally, it generates good profits that have allowed her get ahead in life with her family. In parallel, she sells beauty products from a well-known brand and the profits from her sales are very good. In the future, she plans to setup a bigger grocery store with a big assortment of products, like mini super market where she can help the customers and manage the business. This is her sixth loan with MFP and promises to make her payments on time, as she did with the other loans. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise for her store, and beauty products which she will keep in stock and will sell them at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin N. is a villager from Kouk Doung village, Takeo province. She is 40 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is a monk and the two others are students in the local school.

Mrs. Sarin N. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to grow crops. Aside from a farmer she is a duck breeder who can earn a small income from selling eggs to support her family living.

Mrs. Sarin N. wants to take a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from AMK to buy more ducklings and duck food to enlarge her business.

loans.use: To buy more duckling and duck food

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 26-year-old man. He has been running a unisex beauty salon and shop for four years. He has employed two people in his business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to relate and socialize with his group members.  

Ronald hopes to grow his business to a wholesale shop and also hopes to supply cosmetic products countrywide.  He has requested a loan of Kes. 80,000 to buy hair accessories and add to his stock of beauty products. He describes himself as an aggressive man.

loans.use: Add to his stock of beauty products and personal care products

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana Haine  T. is 35 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Juliana Haine  has 1 year of experience in this business.  Juliana Haine  needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.  Juliana is joining the program to request a fund for developing her business for the sake of her family financially.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2010, Juliana Haine  joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Juliana Haine 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Juliana Haine  T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Viviana Monserrate

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal camino al progreso situado en la  ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí  conversamos con la socia Viviana, esta casada desde hace 12 años en cuyo matrimonio han procreado dos hijos, tiene 27 años de edad.

La señora Viviana lleva dos años con el negocio de venta de ropa y útiles escolares, en la casa tiene un espacio destinado con una vitrina para su negocio, ya es el cuarto  ciclo que lleva en la Fundación y ha podido hacer que sus ventas crezcan y sus ganancias sean mas altas.

Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia Viviana invertirá en comprar más útiles escolares y ropa que tiene por  pedidos, en esta ocasión venderá más pantalones para damas y caballeros.
texts.en:
We are talking to Viviana, a member of the Camino al Progreso Communal Bank. The bank is located in the city of Montecristi in the Manabí province. Viviana is 27, has been married for 12 years, and has two children. Viviana has been selling clothes and school supplies for two years. She has a space in her house with a display case for her business. This is her fourth cycle with the Foundation. She has been able to make her sales grow and receive higher earnings. Viviana will use the new loan to buy more school supplies and clothes. She has received orders for these items. At this time she will sell more pants for women and men.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, pants for women and men

loans.name: Leocadia Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria tiene 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus hijos. Ella se 
dedica a la venta en su bodega la cual inicio aproximadamente hace 12 años, con 
capital propio producto de ahorros. Valeria ya posee experiencia en el negocio con el 
cual apoya a los gastos de su casa. Ella posee una gran cantidad de clientes a los 
cuales los atiende de manera muy amable y calida, por esto y por sus buenos precios es 
que los clientes regresan a su negocio, el sueños de Valeria es incrementar su 
negocio, ya que esto hará que sus ingresos incrementen y así poder darle buena 
educación a sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
Valeria, 56, lives in her own home with her children. She has had a general store for about 12 years that she set up originally with her own savings. Valeria has a lot of experience in this line of work; it provides for her household’s expenses. She has quite a few regular customers that she cares for with kindness and warmth. Added to her fair prices, this keeps them coming back to her store. Valeria’s dream is to enlarge her business so that income will increase and she will be able to provide a good education for her children. She is asking for funds to buy stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Imelda owns and operates a business growing and selling a variety of vegetables. Imelda has been involved in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Imelda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Imelda is requesting a new loan, her 3rd, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Imelda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia M. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. Sofia has a store selling daily use products such as food for snack, candies, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Sofia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Sofia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sofia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
