Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Nguyet V. T. (7) is a 52-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan.

Nguyet is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling rice products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009, Nguyet joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,626,900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Nguyet is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 2nd from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. V. T. Hien (8) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her food stall.

2. D. T. Huong (9) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her general store.

3. P. T. Lan (10) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business.



About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


*****************************************************
Nguyet V. T. (7) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Nguyet là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.11.1.2 Nam Ngan).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nguyet thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nguyet kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2009, Nguyet đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nguyet đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,626,900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. V. T. Hien (8) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2. D. T. Huong (9) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

3. P. T. Lan (10) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Albertine

texts.fr: Née en 1972, S. Albertine est mariée et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Albertine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Abokicodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Albertine habite ce quartier depuis douze ans environs. Le couple se partage les différentes charges familiales. Albertine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis douze ans, Albertine prépare et vend de l’«akassa » (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) à son domicile. Albertine s’approvisionne en maïs à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Albertine a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Face à la demande un peu plus élevé de sa clientèle, Albertine désire augmenter sa quantité d’approvisionnement et produire suffisamment d’akassa, ce qui lui permettra de couvrir toute la demande de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C’est pour atteindre cet objectif que Albertine sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1972, Albertine S. is married and the mother of three children, all in school. Albertine lives with her husband and children in the Abokicodji neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in this neighborhood for about twelve years. The couple shares the different family responsibilities. Albertine did not go to school. For the last twelve years, she has been preparing and selling “akassa” (a local food made of cornstarch) at her home. Albertine buys corn in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has already received two loans through ALIDé, loans which were paid back in full. Facing higher demand from her customers, Albertine would like to increase her supplies and produce enough akassa to meet all the customer demand and earn more income. This is her goal in requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed is the wife of A. R. and they live in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Khursheed has given birth to three children: one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is married and her sons are still studying. The family lives in a small house.

Khursheed earns income by making bicycle seat covers to order. She is a very vigorous lady who always wanted to work to share the financial burden with her husband and to stand with him. She makes seat covers by using leather and soft foam to make the seat comfortable for sitting.

Khursheed is very happy to mention that, with her income, she has been able to marry her daughter. Her husband feels proud on her in this regard, too.

Khursheed’s husband operates a clothes-selling business and has been doing this work for over six years. Khursheed is applying for her second loan from Asasah to expand her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more clothes to increase his sales.

In this photo, the two members, Naheed and Musarat, are showing the handmade fans that they make.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Jelnah

texts.en:
Mrs. Jelnah P. is from the barangay of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years of age and married to Rafael, who is presently working in Saudi Arabia.  She is blessed with three children: two are now at their school age and the other one is an infant. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store and sells dried fish. She also is receiving support from her husband and earns income from renting their motorcycle for hire. She has engaged in these businesses for two years and earns approximately PHP5,000 a month from these business activities. 

In the year 2008, Jelnah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelnah as an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program and has successfully repaid a loan amount of PHP7,000. She is now requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP as her fifth loan to be used for additional capital for her sari-sari store and dried fish vending activity. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use and her children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansions. 

About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store and dried fish vending business

loans.name: Ma. Amy

texts.en:
Ma. Amy B. is a woman with big dreams and the bravery to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 40 years old and married to Roderick, 46, who is a fisherman. She is a caring mother to six children who are all minors. She lives in the town of Laua-an, Antique Province, in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, for the opportunity of having start-up capital for generating income. With her previous loan from ASHI, she carefully invested in her hog-raising business, and it gave her a reasonable income. Now on her second loan, she requests 10,000 PHP to continue raising hogs and to support her second venture—a fishing business. Specifically, the loan will be used to purchase additional piglets and feed, and the remaining money will be used to pay for a fishing boat for her fishing business. This loan will help expand her businesses.

As a mother, Ma. Amy dreams of sending her children to school and on to complete college degrees so they can find jobs for a better living. She hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use. She also enjoys seeing that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of Kiva partner ASHI, she will, step-by-step, realize her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feed, and to pay for a fishing boat for her fishing business

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Mrs. Belen T. is from the Barangay of Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 50, married to Sofriano T. and they have an adult child. To make a living, she has a sari-sari (variety) store and also receives regular support from her husband. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 30 years and earns approximately Php3,000.00 a month.

In 2010, Belen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, Belen is requesting her first loan of Php5,000.00 to be used as additional capital for her store. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of their family, savings, loan repayments, insurance, and possible business expansion. 
	
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additiional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rocks to make crushed stone

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio O. P., tiene la edad de 52 años habita en el populoso barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, comida nicaragüense que se oferta mayormente los fines de semana por su compleja preparación, ellos tienen 2 hijos adolecentes y uno mayor de edad que trabaja en la chanchera negocio de su papa, es para la reinversión a su negocio que el Señor O. solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y destazarlos para su posterior venta y así mismo la utilización de la carne en las ventas de nacatamales del negocio de su esposa, ellos comenzaron a dedicarse en esta actividad, gracias a la enseñanzas de su padre, y es la actividad que representa el sustento diario de la familia y los proyectos a futuro para el bienestar de sus hijos, es por esto lo vital del préstamo para el continuo mejoramiento económico de todos los miembros de su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Octavio O. P. is 52 years old and lives in the bustling neighborhood of South Laureles. He is married and his wife sells nacatamales, a typical Nicaraguan food that she mostly offers on the weekends because they are complicated to prepare. They have two adolescent children and one older son who works in his parents' pig business. Mr. O. is requesting this loan in order to reinvest in his business, which is buying pigs and later butchering them to sell. They also use the meat in the nacatamales that his wife sells. They got their start in this business thanks to the teachings of his father. This business provides daily sustenance for their family and will provide for their children's well-being into the future, so this loan is vital to the entire family's continued economic progress.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M., from the city of Gango Ozamiz City, is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a service-based business providing sewing services in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 16000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her seventh loan for 16000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. Imelda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene K. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala South region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child who currently is in school.  Irene has a retail shop, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase soap and sugar.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Irene hopes to become an international business woman. Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her enough time to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To buy sugar and soap

loans.name: Inna

texts.en:
Inna is married and has 4 children. She runs a small business growing tomatoes, cucumbers and other vegetables in green houses. Inna has three green houses that provide enough space to grow the vegetables. The yearly profit is 40,000 Grivnas.

Inna is a hard working and disciplined person. She would like to develop her business further. She is requesting 10,000 Grivnas to fix the green houses and to purchase fertilizers. She needs to purchase new film to cover the green houses. She hopes to use future income to improve her family living conditions.

loans.use: To fix the green house and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Olimkhon

texts.en:
Olimkhon K. is a 44 year old married man who lives with his 4 children and wife and owns a cattle breeding business. Olimkhon has 7 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Olimkhon has become a very successful businessman. Olimkhon has a friendly family who are always trying to help each other. He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning them, feeding and pasturing. Now, Olimkhon wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. So that Olimkhon applied for a loan of $3,000 USD. He promises to repay the loan without any violation and thanks all lenders for their support. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 50 years old, married, and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lydia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve her business. This will be Lydia’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve her business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 24 years old, married and has two children who are between three and six years old. Currently, one of her children attends school.  Jacqueline owns a restaurant, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a precious metals dealer. Jacqueline will use the loan to purchase food and drinks for the betterment of her restaurant growth. With the new profits from her expanded business, Jacqueline plans to establish another restaurant. In the future, she would like a larger loan.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and set up a new restaurant.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdoulaye Koné est un homme marié de 27 ans, monogame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse à Flacoda, un hameau de Socourani, l’un des villages de la sous-préfecture de Fakola  dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie, Préfecture de Kolondièba  dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la République du  Mali. 
Monsieur Koné, qui  n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, s’est très vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat ventes des produits agricoles.
Pour alléger sa pauvreté Monsieur Koné adhère au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 3 tonnes  de riz pour les revendre à Bamako et à Guèya, un village de la  République sœur de la  Côte-d’Ivoire. 
Quand Monsieur Koné vend son riz  à Guèya en Côte-d’Ivoire,  de retour il achète des ignames, des bananes, des pâtes de maniocs moins chers pour les revendre au Mali. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  100. 000  F CFA qui sera investi dans l’entreprise, les frais de santé, scolaire, nourriture et achat d’animaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Koné is 27 years old, married (in a monogamous marriage) and the father of 2 children. He lives with his wife in a  traditional extended family in Flacoda, a hamlet near Socourani, one of the villages in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondièba in the Third Region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. 

Mr Koné, who did not have the opportunity to go to school, soon became interested in activities that produce revenue, in particular, buying and selling agricultural products. To ease his poverty, Mr. Koné belongs to the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso, and he is in his first cycle. With this loan, he plans to buy 3 tons of rice to re-sell in Bamako and in Guèya, a village in Mali's sister republic, Côte-d’Ivoire. When he goes to Guèya in Côte-d’Ivoire, on his way back he buys yams, bananas, and cassava paste cheaply, to re-sell in Mali. 

He obtains his supplies in the surrounding villages and hopes to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs which will be invested in his business, and also used for healthcare, school fees, food, and to buy animals.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael T. has six children, ranging from the ages of 13 to 25 years old. 

He has been working as a farmer for six years and produces goods such as coffee and bananas for sale. The main challenge he faces in running his business is fluctuations in weather, such as drought.

He has requested this loan of 60,000 KES in order to construct a bore-hole to drill for water, which may then be used to irrigate his farm. 

With the potential increase in income from this loan, he hopes to modernize his farming methods as well as improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To drill for irrigation water

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma lives in a single-room brick house in the city of Lahore with her husband and 4 children. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and famous for its history and culture. 
Najma is a 32 year-old house wife who spends most of her time at home taking care of her family. 
Her husband’s name is L. M., and he is a very hardworking person. He is involved in two types of work. In the morning, he does a government job on a monthly wage, and in the afternoon he sells iron to customers.  
Najma’s children are enrolled in a local school and are getting an education. It is a great level of satisfaction of her that she is able to provide education to her children. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy iron in a larger quantity to fulfill customer needs and to increase his sales and profits. 
Najma is hopeful that her husband will be able to earn better profits by utilizing the loan and her family will be able to live a better standard of life. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy iron for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use as capital

loans.name: Djawa

texts.en:
Djawa is 34 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 9 and 17. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. 

Djawa has been selling used clothing for twelve years, and recently her business has allowed her to buy a motorcycle for herself. She plans to use the profits gained from this loan to expand her business.

loans.use: buying additional inventory of used clothing

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana J. es una vendedora por excelencia, ella vende desde ropa hasta artículos para el hogar y bisutería.
Ella realiza su trabajo a domicilio, es decir  casa por casa va todos los días ofreciendo sus productos. Hoy ella quiere mejorar su pequeño negocio, y para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones)   para la compra de mas productos que están siendo demandados en la comunidad, entre ellas ropa para mujer. Ella quiere crear un capital para poder construir su propia tienda y así mejorar sus ingresos
Viviana es  socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal La amistad, una de las 110 Empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Viviana J. is a saleswoman par excellence.  She sells everything from clothes to household goods and costume jewelry.  She sells her products door to door and goes out every day to do this.  Right now, she would like to improve her small business and, for this, she needs a loan for 500,000 colones so that she can buy more products which are in demand in her community, including women's clothes.

Viviana would like to build up capital so that she can build her own store and thereby improve her income.  She is a member of the La Amistad community credit company which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and accessories

loans.name: Dot

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Dot N., is a 32-year-old farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She feeds some pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer, and does so in four-month cycles. Besides this work, she has also been planting a rice crop, and that is her annual business. Her husband is a firewood seller as well as helping her in raising piglets. 

Mrs. Dot N. is looking for a loan to buy additional feed and piglets for feeding. She has three single children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets for feeding.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Encarnacion; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y tiene 9 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos, lechugas entre otras verduras, la socia vende las verduras en el mercado de Zurite desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the "San Martin de Zurite" community bank which is located in Zurite district, in Anta province, in Cusco department.

Encarnación is 51 years old, married and has nine children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, onions, carrots, cucumbers, lettuce and other vegetables.  She sells her products in Zurite market, from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.

Encarnación would like to expand her vegetable business.  She is requesting this loan to buy vegetables wholesale.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 35 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in school. Ibrahim has a poultry business, which he has run for five years.         
To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Ibrahim hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 59-year-old farmer from the village of Variani in the Gori district. He lives with wife Matiko and his mother. Simon's mother is 88 years old and retired. 

Simon and Matiko earn a living with agricultural activities. They have three milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold to dairy product retailers. 

Also the family owns three hectares of land, where cabbage, tomato and wheat are grown. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold to local wholesalers. Simon has a mini-tractor which is used in his farm. The total average monthly income of the family, including Simon's mother's pension, amounts to 1000 Laris. 

With the credit received from Credo Simon will purchase fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. He will also pay the workers who will help him till and fertilize the land. Simon and Matiko hope that after fertilizing they will get a larger and better quality harvest, which will be sold to the wholesalers for a higher price. 

With the profits received this season Simon plans to purchase a better tractor for his farm. With this tractor he will also work in neighborhood farms and earn extra income. It will positively influence the income of the family. In the future Simon and Matiko plan to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Amaide

texts.es: Amaide  es una mujer casada de 32 años, que ofrece en su negocio los servicios de internet y comunicaciones, además de la venta de mercancías, aprovechando la clientela que diariamente la visita para acceder a sus servicios especialmente de soporte de tareas escolares a través de esta moderna herramienta. Ella vive en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno donde también está ubicado su negocio y como  le gusta el trabajo independiente, primero tuvo una tienda con la que  no continuó,  pues la vendió para comprar su propia casa e iniciar este último negocio, el cual quieren fortalecer y al que necesita  hacer adecuaciones para ponerlo a funcionar en un 100%. Esta es la razón por la cual  ha solicitado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo su segundo financiamiento y a través de  su credikiva adecuará los pisos y comprará un computador para ampliar su cobertura de clientes, debido a que se está preparando  para la jornada de vacaciones escolares que se acerca y sus principales clientes que son los estudiantes, contribuyen a incrementar sus ventas, porque hay mayor utilización de su infraestructura técnica. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios de licenciatura en castellano y organizar su local independiente de su casa.
texts.en:
Amaide is a married, 32-year old woman who has a business offering Internet and communications services.  She also sells merchandise, taking advantage of the customers who visit her enterprise on a daily basis to use her services.  They use her business particularly to support school homework by means of this modern tool.

She lives in the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality, which is where her business is also located.  Since she likes to work independently, she first had a store that she did not continue with.  Instead, she sold it to buy her own house and start the current business, which she wants to strengthen and needs to make some improvements to in order to function at 100% capacity.

This is the reason why she has requested her second loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Through her kiva credit she will improve her floors and buy a computer to expand her customer base.  She is preparing for the upcoming school vacations and it is the students, her primary customers, who contribute toward increasing her sales because there is more use of her technical infrastructure.  Her dreams are to finish her degree in Spanish and organize her business locale separately from her house.

loans.use: improve the floors of her business and buy a computer.

loans.name: Saman

texts.en:
Saman is a 43 year old farmer.  Her husband is a worker and their combined income is $5 per day.  They have 2 children, 17 and 13 years old, and they both are working in weave factory right now with $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, she has to spend $20 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses.  She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy equipments for repairing her house.  She wants to prepare her house and then rent it to a weave merchant so she could earn some money from that.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Walter Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Walter Rafael  vive en la cuidad de Managua es una persona responsable es padre de familia.
El señor visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito ya que necesita hacer unas mejoras en su vivienda el dinero lo va a invertir en la compra de zicn, perlines y el pago de mano de obra.
Don Walter  le agradece a ceprodel por que gracias a los prestamos obtenido anteriormente pudo mejoras su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Walter Rafael lives in the city of Managua.  He is a responsible person and father.  He visited our office to request a loan as he needs to make some improvements to his home.  He will invest the money in buying sheets of corrugated metal and beams, and paying labor costs.

Walter is grateful to Ceprodel because, thanks to the loans he has already received from us, he has been able to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for improving her business of selling animals. She sells buffalo, cows, and goats. With the loan, she will purchase young animals and will sell them to butchers and to other people after raising them. 

She is very experienced and has been doing her business for the past 20 years. She is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and she will be able to expand it successfully. 

Her husband is also an animal seller by profession. Both Bashiraan and her husband also get milk from their cattle to earn an additional income. 

Bashiraan has two sons: the eldest one is in college while youngest one is not yet reading. 

Bashiraan is confident that after the loan investment, her family business will grow further and her family will be able to enjoy better living facilities as a result. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy animals for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 25-year-old single lady living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda,with a dream of building her own house in the next five years. She has been a tailor for two years now and she is impressed with her customer's loyalty despite challenges in limited funds to buy the right quality of cloth materials. She has a passion to become an international fashion designer and she is determined to work towards her goal. Sarah needs the loan to buy cloth to sell.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Ngano Group

texts.en: Enock, who is in his late 40s, is married, and has five children who go to school, has been in the charcoal business for three years. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and makes a small monthly profit. This will be his third loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal, to pay school fees and for household expenses; he has paid back all of his loans successfully. Enock wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. His dream is to one day repair and renovate his house. He will share this loan with his loan group "Ngano", which has a total of 17 members who hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Salamat's Group

texts.en:
Salamat is the leader of this group. She is 74 and unfortunately a widow. She has raised two daughters, both of whom are married and live separately with their families. Salamat is engaged in cattle breeding and started this activity about 50 years ago. In the beginning she purchased a calf and then resold it at good price, thus starting to breed cattle. 

Salamat is a retiree. She receives a monthly pension in the amount of 3750 soms. She also cultivates agricultural products to make additional money for her livelihood. She applied for the loan because she needs financial funds to purchase a calf for breeding and a separator for processing milk. In the future Salamat wants to increase the number of cattle and soon she plans to start repairing a shed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and a separator for processing milk

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es: El señor Eleuterio oriundo de Aguaicastilla de la ciudad Chuquisaca, tiene tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando, su domicilio es propio  se encuentra ubicado, en la localidad de  Puerto Rico hace 5 años, el se dedica a la ganadería,  comercia el ganado en la feria asproa los fines de semana a parte tiene un ingreso  por la compra-venta de vehículo y motocicleta. El destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de  un cuarto en su casa para así brindar mas comodidad a su familia ya que poco a poco pudo construir su casita pero le falta algunos cuatros y el tiene el deseo de que en un futuro pueda tener su casita terminada Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Eleuterio, a native of Agua Castilla in Chuquisaca, has 3 daughters who are in school.  He has had his own home, located in the town of Puerto Rico, for 5 years.  He works with livestock.  He sells the livestock in the Asproa market on the weekends, and he also has another business buying and selling automobiles and motorcycles.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials to add a room to his house so that his family can live in greater comfort.  He has been gradually building his little house, but it still lacks some rooms, and in the future he wants to be able to completely finish the house.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support that is being provided to him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Gelinda

texts.en:
Gelinda is a 49-year-old married woman with two children, aged 24 and 22. Gelinda's husband works as a farmer.

Gelinda is also a farmer. She helps her husband grow rice on their land. Gelinda also runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells items like bread and canned goods. Gelinda plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and also more items to sell at the store.

In the future, Gelinda hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies, and more items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a married man and blessed with four children. For the last fifteen years, he has been selling clothing to earn a living. He has employed one person to help him manage the business. 

In the next five years, he wants to manage a wholesale business selling used clothing. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy men's trousers to sell. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: LA SEÑORA  LORENZA, es una persona de 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive actualmente con su esposo y ya no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. La actividad económica de la cliente y su esposo es la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva  son la papa, haba, arveja y papa lisa en sus propios terrenos que se hallan ubicadas en la comunidad de Villa Mojón del municipio de Pocona que esta distante a 101 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. La señora O. guanto a su esposo manifiestan ser personas responsables y trabajadores que quieren incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar el presente capital de inversión para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y  abono de gallinaza que son los principales insumos que promueven un mejor rendimiento de los cultivos agrícolas.
texts.en: 49 year old Lorenza is married, achieved a primary school education, and currently lives with her husband and does not have any economic dependents in her charge. She and her husband have an agricultural business and the main crops they cultivate are potatoes, beans, peas, and a root vegetable called papa lisa. They grow these on their own land in the community of Villa Mojón in the municipality of Pocona which is 101km from the city of Cochabamba. O. and her husband are responsible and hardworking people who want to increase their agricultural production and for this reason they are requesting the present loan to buy chemical fertilizer and chicken manure fertilizer which are the main inputs that promote a better agricultural yield.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and chicken manure fertilizer

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik is from the town of Artik in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She was born in Artik and has lived her whole life there.  Hasmik has a high school education and also has been trained as an accountant.  Due to the limited number of jobs in Artik, Hasmik began farming five years ago.  This has brought income for the family and allowed her to help her relatives living nearby.  Hasmik would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed.  She expects the family income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  Hasmik has four wonderful children – three daughters (twenty, twenty-five and twenty-eight years old) and a nineteen-year-old son.  She wants her business income to grow so that she can continue supporting her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Collique Unido Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Delsy Elia, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la zona de Collique en el distrito de Comas al igual que sus compañeras del grupo "Collique Unido".
La Sra. Delsy Elia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa a pedido, inició éste negocio hace unos años primero con la venta de productos de belleza, poco a poco y visitando a sus clientes ellos no sólo pedían cosméticos o perfumes, le empezaron a pedir ropa y es así que ella piensa en ampliar su negocio e invierte un poco de capital en ropa.
gracias a su negocio ha logrado obtener su independencia económica y brindar a su familia lo necesario para viri tranquilamente.
El pr+estamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de juguetes para aprovechar la venta en la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Delsy Elia, 29, lives in the Collique zone in Comas District as do the rest of her fellow members of the “Collique Unido” group.

Delsy Elia sells beauty products and clothes on order.  She started this business a few years ago first selling the beauty products.  Gradually her customers started asking her not only for cosmetics or perfume but also clothes and that’s why she intends to expand the business and invest some capital in clothes.

Thanks to her business she’s become independent economically and is able to provide her family everything necessary to live in peace.

She will use the requested loan to buy toys to take advantage of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy toys.

loans.name: Felipe Hector

texts.es:
Felipe vive y trabaja en famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD. As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism. But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

Felipe, es un hombre soltero de 69 años de edad, el se dedica a prestar el servicio de alquiler de habitaciones, eligio este tipo de trabajo por la edad que no puede ya trabajar en otra actividad.
Felipe es un hombre  luchador que sigue enfrentando a la vida con muchas fuerzas y ganas de salir adelante.
Felipe ,  empezó su negocio en el año 2009 , gana semanalmente S/.180 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA,  Felipe invertirá el crédito en el mantenimiento de su casa (Arreglo de baños y pisos).  Su sueño de Felipe es construir mas habitaciones para alquilar, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente .
texts.en:
Felipe lives and Works in famous Nazca, or Nasca, Perú. The city is well known for the legendary Nazca Lines- a series of ancient, immense and inexplicable geoglyphs etched into the desert surrounding the city, generally attributed to the Nazca culture, which inhabited in the region from 300-800 AD.  As such, the city attracts a considerable amount of tourism.  But Nazca is also known for its hardworking people, who have preserved despite frequent earthquakes, tsunamis, and a high level of poverty in the region.

Felipe is a single, 69 year old gentleman who rents out living accomodations.  He settled on this type of work because of his age, since he can’t do any other type of work.

Felipe is a hardworking man who continues to face life with great enthusiasm and force of will and a desire to get ahead.

Felipe began his business in 2009, when he only earned 180 PEN.  With a loan or 2,000 PEN ($750), that he got thanks to Kiva, Felipe will fix up the bathroom and floors in his home.  His dream is to build more homes to rent out.  The loan assessor thinks of him as a great customer.

loans.use: to fix up his home.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. Her husband is a fisherman who contributes to the family's basic needs. Fatuma owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Fatuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past two years; her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of rising prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of their quality financial services.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetable such as tomatoes, onions, cabbages and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes tiene 43 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Desde hace mas de 12 años que tiene este medio de vida, el precio de los productos que compra aumentan por lo que no puede comprar variedad en su mercadería. El motivo de la compra que solicita es para ofrecer calzado, cremas, perfumes, pulseras, aretes, cosméticos entre otros productos. Sueña con lograr incrementar su inventario y al mismo tiempo brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
María Mercedes is 43 years old and sells general merchandise. She has earned her living in this manner for more than 12 years. The prices of the products that she buys have increased, so she is not able to maintain a variety of merchandise.

The reason for this loan is so that she can offer shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products. María dreams of increasing her inventory so that she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy shoes, crèmes, perfumes, bracelets, earrings, cosmetics, and other products.

loans.name: Severino

texts.es: El señor Severino es soltero no tiene hijos, el vive en casa de su tía en la localidad de Sacaba, el señor Severino se dedica al servicio de transporte, cuenta con movilidad propia,  pero no es afiliado al sindicato de transportistas, es decir que trabaja con la afiliación de un conocido.  El sale todos los días a las 6 de la mañana para trabajar y descansa a las 6 de la tarde, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz con la institución ya que el préstamo es para la compra de un motor nuevo para su herramienta de trabajo, ya que esta es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Severino is single and does not have children. He lives in his aunt’s house in the town of Sacaba. 

Severino works in the transport service, and has his own transport, but he is not affiliated with the union, that is to say he works in association with a friend. He leaves every morning at 6:00AM for work, relaxing at 6:00PM in the afternoon. 

He is a hard working person who feels happy with the institution for providing the loan so he can buy a new engine for his mode of working because this is his only source of work.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his transport service

loans.name: Aarón

texts.es:
El joven Aarón desea reparar el techo de la cocina de su casa ya que están en malas condiciones y cuando llueve se le mojan todos sus muebles. También le preocupa la salud de el y  de su abuelita quien vive con el.
Aarón es empleado de una compañía de limpieza desde hace ya más de dos años y su abuelita le ayuda con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su negocio de ropa usada y nueva en diferentes partes de la ciudad. 
Solicita el préstamo para comprar la madera y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de reparar el techo. Desea mejorar su vivienda y el patrimonio que tiene.
texts.en:
Aarón wants to repair the kitchen ceiling in his home, since it is in very bad condition and whenever it rains his furniture gets wet.  He is also concerned about his health and that of his grandmother, who lives with him.

Aarón has worked for a cleaning company for more than two years.  His grandmother helps him with her earnings from her business selling new and second-hand clothing in different parts of the city.

Aarón is asking for a loan so he can purchase wood and pay someone who will take care of repairing the ceiling.  He wants to improve his home and the assets he has.

loans.use: to repair his ceiling.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: In Guayaquil not many people can afford to buy their own video game consoles like the Playstation or Xbox, yet the kids love to play the games just as they do in the rest of the world. Businesses like Barbara’s have emerged where they rent out playing time on video game consoles from their home. Barbara has three TVs and three Playstations with a variety of games that the kids can choose to play. She saved up $500 from her part time job in a travel agency to buy the used the consoles and the televisions. Barbara also sells ice cream and soft drinks to the video game players and kids from a nearby school. She is seeking a loan in order to buy another console and make improvements to her home/business.

loans.use: Continue investing in clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Kimpo Elwa

texts.en: K., married with six children, has been in business since 1994. He started his business with the capital of $100. He increased his business capital to $600 by 1995. Attacked by armed thieves one day, they stole all of his merchandise and capital and his business closed. In 2001, K. resumed his general business with the capital of $150. He is planning with a loan of $700 to purchase children’s items such as clothing, shoes, school supplies, and baby clothing as there is a high demand for those goods.

loans.use: He wants to diversify his business by adding children’s items to his merchandise

loans.name: Sedri

texts.en: Sedri H. Aslan ogli is from the Saatli region of Azerbaijan. He is 52 years old and has seven children. To improve his living conditions, he started his animal breeding business in 1998. He wishes to expand his business and raise his standard of living. For this purpose he needs a loan of $600 from Agroinvest to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario lives with her parents in their home located on May 4th street in the Buenos Aires zone, La Paz. She is 22 years old and she is in the food service business. At first, she would sell her meals door-to-door, but now she has modified one of the rooms in her home to hold a small, account based restaurant. She does not have any children: she works to make a living and pay her expenses. She wants to invest the loan amount to redecorate the restaurant in order to give it a more pleasant ambiance and attract more patrons. An account based restaurant allows its customers to pay for their meals on a monthly basis, in return customers are guaranteed one meal per day for a whole month. Her credit history with Impro indicates that she has had access to a 6-month-term credit line in January of this year. Her balance has been totally paid off on time. Her good payment history places her in a position to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario vive en casa de sus padres en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona Buenos Aires de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene 22 años de edad y su actividad es la venta de comida; anteriormente vendía en la puerta de su casa, pero actualmente tiene una pensión modesta dentro de la casa en una habitación que fue habilitada para este fin. No tiene hijos, trabaja para poder subsistir y cubrir sus necesidades. El crédito que solicita es para implementar mejor su pensión y tener un ambiente acogedor y poder captar más clientes. Vale la pena aclarar que una pensión es un pequeño restaurante donde los clientes tienen un contrato mensual para tener un almuerzo seguro cada día del mes y pagan por todo el mes. El antecedente histórico de Rosario con Impro indica que ella ya tuvo acceso a un primer crédito en Enero del presente año por 6 meses y a la fecha el crédito esta pagado en su totalidad. Su calificación como buen cliente le permite acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Capital de trabajo

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena, like many Bolivian women, was left by her husband to be both father and mother to her four small children that depend on her. She works making cow's milk and sells potatoes and potato starch. She uses her income to support her children.

She lives in the Villandrani community (one hour the city of La Paz).

She will invest her loan in the purchase of a cow of average breed to increase her milk production.

This is her first loan with Impro; her socio-economic evaluation shows her ability to repay the loan and also cover her family's monthly expenses and qualifies her to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Filomena, como mucha mujeres de bolivianas fue abandonada por su esposo, quedando ella como padre y madre de sus cuatro pequeños hijos que dependen de ella. Filomena se dedica a la producción de leche de vaca y comercializa papa y chuño, ingresos con lo que cubre la manutención de sus hijos.

Vive en la Comunidad de Villandrani (A una hora de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito le invertirá en la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el primer crédito con Impro; la evaluación socio-económica realizada muestra la capacidad de repago del crédito como también ingresos suficientes para cubrir los gastos mensuales de su familia y la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, shortly after Ukraine gained it’s independence from the Soviet Union, Oksana started her own small business, taking advantage of new, free market opportunities. Over the years, she has gained much valuable experience as an entrepreneur and has been able to help provide necessary income for herself, her husband and daughter.

Oksana presently sells an assortment of women’s outerwear. She is evaluating the competition and would like to bring in products that other vendors don’t have. Oksana operates from a little kiosk at an outdoor market, but soon hopes to obtain a self-standing store facility that will be a big improvement to her business.

As it gets closer to the winter season, demand for Oksana’s products will grow. She has requested a short term loan of $500 to help purchase new clothing inventory and be better prepared for this busy time of year.

loans.use: To purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn I. (age 52) has been widowed since 1997. She lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She shares her one-room house wI. three of her children, one son-in-law and one grandson. Though Thorn learned to weave from her mother many years ago, she’s been working at it commercially for only about seven or eight years. She has also taught her daughter, now age twenty-one, (see photo) who joined on a second loom. They both laughed that the daughter is now the better weaver because her eyes are better than her mother’s.

Thorn is requesting this, her third loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $300. She will use the funds from the loan to buy materials for weaving. Prior to taking out a loan, Thorn worked on a barter basis wI. a local middleperson. The middleperson would advance her an amount of weaving thread. Out of that thread, Thorn would give back two finished pieces and get the profit only from one. She now makes more profit as the cost of the thread is less and the price she gets for the finished cloth is more – as long as she conducts all the transactions in cash.

In addition to weaving, Thorn also farms rice wI. her son-in-law. Her farm plot is five kilometers from her house so weaving productivity declines during planting and harvest seasons due to the demands of farm work and commuting. In addition to paying for family living costs and the fees for her one child who remains in school, she is saving money to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase silk and nylon thread and other materials for weaving

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi:
Mr. Thi, 48 years old, is an active person. Besides his main activity of making tofu, he also raises a few pigs and offers a service of rice processing for farmers in the area. Incomes from many occupations keep the family’s economy stable. His wife sells tofu and helps him tend those pigs and process rice. He would like to take out a loan to buy bean and feed for his pigs. He prefers loan with weekly repayments because it make him conscious about spending and saving.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


AnhThi 48 tuổi, là người rất năng động trong việc làm. Anh chủ yếu kiếm sống bằng nghề làm đậu phụ để bán. Ngoài ra, anh còn nuôi lợn và xay xát gạo thuê. Nhờ có nhiều nghề nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định. Vợ anh hàng ngày đi bán đậu và thời gian còn lại thì cùng chồng nhận xay xát gạo và nuôi lợn. Anh dự định vay vốn để mua thêm đỗ về làm đậu và mua cám cho lợn. Anh rất thích hình thức vay vốn hoàn trả theo tuần vì nó giúp anh có ý thức hơn trong chi tiêu và tiết kiệm.

loans.use: To purchase bean for making bean curd and feed for pigs

loans.name: Mauricia's Group

texts.en:
This group of women work everyday selling goods door-to-door. They live and run their businesses in an area of Paraguay where there is a great amount of poverty. People from neighboring cities migrate to their city to sell goods and work in various businesses. These women want to increase their profits and eventually own shops of their own. It is their aspiration to continue to live outside of poverty.

With the loan, they will purchase canned goods, non-perishable foods, animals, and home products.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and other non-perishable products.  Other goods to be purchased include animals and various home goods.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel is a young man filled with hopes and dreams. He studied Agronomy at the university and has since learned his craft closely with much practice and effort. He offers livestock and agricultural manor services to people that request it and breeds bees in an area of his home. Every week, he extracts honey from the space where he houses the bees to sell in his older brothers’ stores. His wish is to contribute to the tranquility of his elderly mother and has decided to increase the artificial honeycombs he has at home and set up an area to counsel the people in his town.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel, es un joven lleno de sueños y esperanzas, estudió Agronomía en la universidad y desde ese entonces con mucho esfuerzo y práctica ha conocido su profesión de cerca, presta servicios de señoría ganadera y agrícola a las personas que lo solicitan y está criando abejas en un espacio de su casa, semanalmente del lugar que les ha otorgado como morada de reposo extrae miel para comercializarla en las tiendas de sus hermanos mayores.Su deseo es contribuir con la tranquilidad de su anciana madre y ha decidido incrementar lo panales artificiales que posee en casa e implementar el espacio para asesorar desde este lugar a los pobladores de su ciudad.

loans.use: Inject capital to increase the quantity of artificial honeycombs and expand a section of his house to use as a counseling area.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 31 years old and is married with 4 children, ages 3-13. Amina owns a small cafe, which she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is 40 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 20 and 16. Saada has been a charcoal seller since 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Gulissa Guisselle

texts.es:
The business of owning a grocery story is an activity that requires constant investment in products in order to sell to clients and keep them satisfied. In the sector of Somotillo, Gulissa M. devotes herself to attending her grocery store, which she has owned for the past year and which is the only way she can support her home and her children.

Today, the problem she has been facing is lack of funds to purchase merchandise needed by her customers. Nevertheless, she has searched for support in Ceprodel to obtain credit that would allow her to purchase products to sell in her area and thus continue to support her humble abode.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de pulpería es una actividad que requiere de mucha inversión constante de productos para lograr comercializarlos a los clientes y acapararlos para que siempre puedan estar satisfechos con la atención. En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Gulissa M. se dedica a atender su pulpería que desde hace un año la posee siendo este el unico sustento para mantener su hogar y sus hijos.

Hoy en día, la problemática que ella atraviesa es que debido a que no posee el recurso económico, no ha logrado adquirir su mercadería para ofrecer, no obstante, ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de los productos para comercializarlos en su sector de habitación y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Grace Anjei

texts.en:
Grace was born on 15/8/1959, and is married with seven children with one below 15 years. Faced with some challenges in life like ill health, the death of her father and younger brother, and being a school dropout, life was very difficult and complicated for her until she came to GHAPE in 2006. Thus far, she has obtained two loans of $40 and $300 respectively and the repayment was satisfactory.  The loans accomplished many things, such as paying school fees for her children and grandchildren, supporting the health of her family and feeding the family.

Given this loan, Grace plans to construct a new pig pen, electrify the pig pen to give light to the pigs when they are about to deliver at night. She also plans to buy 10 piglets to add to the ones she already has, to prepare a packing space for her firewood, and to continue buying and splitting of wood. She promises to start repayment at the fourth month from the date of disbursement.  

With the profit from the loan, she plans to expand her business, continue to pay school fees for her children and grandchildren, and take care of the health and feeding in the family.

Grace prefers a loan from GHAPE because the means  of repayment is easier, the loan scheme is encouraging, the interest paid on GHAPE loans is relatively low as compared to other financial institution, and lastly, GHAPE does proper follow up with their clients to ensure the loan is manage judiciously.

loans.use: To buy materials for new pig pen, and piglets and firewood

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok V., 39, is as widow and has started business selling various kinds of grocery products since 2000 to the people in her community and typically makes around $4 per day in revenue. She has two children aged 15 and 10 who are enrolled in a primary school. Each month she spends around $30 on food, $10 on utilities and $50 for her children’s education.

A diligent mother, Mrs. Sok V. has to work very hard and to make sure that she can afford her family’s expenses. In the past she was a businesswoman who worked near the Thai border but because her son got seriously ill she decided to give up her business and came back home to look after her son and other kids. When she was back home she opened a grocery store.

Now she is asking for a loan to purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory. Her customers' demands are growing so she has to increase her products to meet their needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Khoeng

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeng S. lives in Ampil Village in Kandal Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phai Rorn, is a farmer. In order to meet the family expenses, he tries to work hard on the rice field where he cultivates twice a year. In his farming, Mr. Phai Rorn faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds for cultivating. Therefore his wife decided to ask for a loan for her husband, and she would use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects. Mrs. Khoeng S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Khoeng S. had obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to hire a laborer to plow the rice field, and to buy rice seeds and pesticides. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds for cultivating and buy more pesticides to protect the crops from insects.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza S. is 28 years old, and she comes from a large and humble family. She is married and is the loving mother of 3 children. Her father's hard-working and demanding nature showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, which has served her well because she has been successful in various activities throughout her life.

Now, she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates from this business, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and her best friends. Consequently, she is seeking a 12-month loan in the amount of 3,500 Somoni ($1,050) in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment, she will be able to substantially grow her earnings and improve her quality of life. Please support this dedicated mother's proposal.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Mali

texts.en: Mrs. Mali S. M. was born in 1975 and lives in Kampong Svay Village in Kandal Province.She is a 33-year-old widow without any children. She has a plot of land on which she plans to cultivate rice to earn a living. However, she currently does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds, so she is requesting a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase her rice revenue and improve living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Arche De Noe Group

texts.en: Leontine started her business in 1981 and has been a faithful client with Hope DRC (a microfinance program) since February 2008. Over the years, Leontine has acquired solid experience in business. She first began selling sacs of corn, peanuts and beans, until 2005 when she had an accident on a boat and was hospitalized for three months. After the recovery, Leontine decided to change the business because of a broken finger that she got from the accident.  She opened a general boutique in late 2005 and has been operating this business to the present day. She sells soaps, sugar, salt, milk, toilet papers, oil, cans, and other household goods. Her business strategies are based on the high quality of goods, strategic pricing, caring for clients and never running out of inventory. With her next loan she is planning to rent a place to move her business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains. Her dream is to purchase a boat in order to serve rural people as river transport. Leontine is married and a mother of four children.

loans.use: To rent a place to move the business indoors in order to avoid the heavy rains

loans.name: Fatimata-Touré

texts.fr:
Madame T. est âgée de 47 ans et elle a pour l’activité la vente des bijoux et des sacs de sortie.  Elle achète quelques produits à Cotonou, la capitale du Benin, et les autres articles au grand marché de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé ou elle habite.  Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2004.  Elle a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES, et elle a bien remboursé.  Avec ce deuxième crédit, elle peut acheter 40 complets de bijoux et 2 douzaines de sacs de sortie.  Avec ce nouveau stock, elle peut servir ses clients pendant les fêtes de fin d’année, parce que les choses qu’elle vend peuvent servir de très bons cadeaux pour les femmes.
Madame T. est née à Sokode, une ville située 175 km de Lomé.  Elle est mariée avec un revendeur et ils ont 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. is 47 years old and sells jewelry and handbags. She buys several products in Cotonou, the capital of Benin, and she buys other products at the large market in Lomé, which is the capital of Togo. She sells these products in Agoè, an area in the northern part of Lomé where she lives. She has been involved in this since 2004. She has taken out one previous loan with WAGES, and she repaid the loan in full. With this second loan she is requesting, she can purchase 40 sets of jewelry and two dozen handbags. With this new stock she will be able to serve her customers during the year-end festivals, since the goods that she sells make very good gifts for women. Mrs. T. was born in Sokode, a city situated about 175 km from Lomé. She is married to a retailer and they have four children.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry and handbags

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en:
Marizel G. is a 37-year-old mother of two children. She married so early; that is why she never finished her college education when she was younger. She has two children and happily nurtures all of them to fulfill whatever dreams she failed to achieve. She calls her business “G. Coco Lumber and Charcoal." With her husband’s support, together they are able surpass all the challenges in their family.

Because she is into retail, Marizel developed a character that knows how to sell. She knows her products and clients well, and this helps her achieve her target sales. Now, she is requesting a loan from CEVI to purchase additional materials and capital for the business. Marizel desires to increase the size of her store, which she believes in doing so, will reap larger earnings. She is also considering looking into some other possible ways to contribute to the family income.

Like other CEVI clients, Marizel also enjoys the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage as the benefits.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Angelique M. in Gatsata Sector, Gasabo District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Angelique is 31 years old and the mother of 2 kids. She has no orphans to raise.

She started her business two years ago. She has a spare parts store with capital of 1,100,000 RWF at Gatsata Sector where she has many customers. She wants to increase her working capital.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf which will be repaid in eight months on a monthly basis

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um S. is a villager in Preaek Ta Noup village in Kandal province. She is a hard-working woman. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. Since her child’s workplace is far from her house, she usually pays a lot of money for a motorbike taxi to transport her child to work. Thus, Mrs. Um S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child and to reduce her expense.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị D. 35 tuổi hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại huyện Mê Linh - Hà Nội. Chị D. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002 với nghề chính là chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi chị D. còn đầu tư vốn để buôn bán rau. Với mức thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng gia đình chị D. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để cải thiện cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị D. mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua lợn về nuôi và đầu tư thêm vốn để buôn bán rau.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. is 35 years old, and is living with her husband and three children at Me Linh District, Hanoi. She joined TYM Fund in 2002 to invest in her livestock raising business. Besides raising, Mrs. D. also invest her loans in selling vegetables. At an income of 5,000,000 VND per month, Mrs. D. and her family has more opportunity to improve their living standard. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in more pigs to raise and to invest in her vegetables business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 40 year old woman who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Souad has been working as a seamstress for four years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors.
