This is Souad’s third loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her to improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Souad decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

Souad has requested a loan of 500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase an electrical sewing tool.

loans.use: To purchase an electrical sewing tool

loans.name: Mr. Sambath Ban Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people living in Chher Teal village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Sambath B. is the 40 year old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because his field is infertile and this is badly affecting his crop. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and he will use the rest of the loan to purchase fuel to pump water to support the field and make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Keo Phanith, is a housewife who is a good cooker and a good mother. Mr. Sambath B. has seven children, one of whom is a construction worker, while another two are waiters in the restaurant, three others are enrolled in the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study.    

Five members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and purchase fuel to pump water.

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
T. Trần Thị (627981323) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Hưng Nguyên. She is married and has an infant child.

T. owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

T. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her 5th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
"My husband and I started having a business in 2004. We have a small piggery. We grow and sell pigs to our neighbors for income and to support our daily needs", says Rosita A., 63 years old, from Baclayon, Bohol.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 21,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feedstock for the pigs. She is interested also to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.

CEVI helps small businesses grow. It offers credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina T. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns and operates her business in the retail sector running a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Rina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rina joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rina is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. Rina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her store and to support her family's needs.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita E. is from the village of Malibangcao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting coconut and banana for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E., a 42-year-old farmer and mother of six children, is married to Armin E. Sr. who is also a farmer. She learned from her husband, starting to help on the farm in 1986, and now knows very well the whole process of growing rice from planting to harvest. She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fertilizers and chemicals. Haydee actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings held monthly in their barrio.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra R. is from the town of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52, widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Isidra owns & operates a business making & selling food snacks to the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a oan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make food snacks. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase raw ingredients to make food snacks

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel A. Narváez  tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, la mayoría de los cuales ya son mayores de edad. La señora Maria  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida.  La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida d una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de sus comidas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas y carnes. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante, que brinden mayores ingresos a su familia en general.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen T. D. was born in 1969.  She lives in Xom Cho – Uy No – Dong Anh – Ha Noi with her husband and 2 children. Her husband is a driver. Her son is a university student and her daughter attends secondary school. Yen T. D. sells betrothal gifts for rent. Her monthly income is about 6.000.000 VND.  She has been involved with SEDA for four years. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND (or $375 USD) to buy more betrothal gifts for rent.

loans.use: to buy more betrothal gifts for rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Approvisionner son magasin

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene I. is a farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. During harvest, he earns 30,000 to 50,000 PHP from his 3.4-hectare rice field. He obtains finance at a high interest rate from a rice trader. That is why he joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), which only charges 2 per cent interest per month.

Rene is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to financially support his farm and buy the required necessities. Such a loan is very helpful for farmers like Rene, who only have limited business capital.

loans.use: To finance his farm

loans.name: Bassarou

texts.fr: Cet homme a appris la menuiserie ; en 2003, il a ouvert son atelier de menuiserie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Il est marié et a à sa charge un enfant. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins financiers de sa famille. Il dispose de nombreux clients fidèles qui apprécient énormément la qualité de ses travaux. Il fabrique des lits et armoires à la mode en ce moment. Il a besoin de s’approvisionner en planches et aussi certains outils neufs ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 01 défonseur, 10 planches double, un appareil de menuiserie dénommé Moelle 6 circulaire ainsi que d’autres outils nécessaires.
texts.en:
This is a man who learned the trade of furniture-making. In 2003, he opened his own workshop in the Agoè district in Lomé. He is married and has a child to support. This business of his enables him to provide financially for his family. He has a number of loyal customers who greatly appreciate the quality of his work. He makes beds and armoires that are in style at the moment. He needs to stock up on lumber and also on some brand-new tools; this is why he’s requesting a WAGES loan for purchasing a router, ten double boards, and a piece of carpentry equipment called Moelle 6 circulaire, as well as some other necessary tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry tools

loans.name: Mrs. Toeurn Loch Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who are all living in Ta Soeng village in TaK. province make up the village bank loan. Mrs. Toeurn L. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members, and they all will use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Toeurn L. is a farmer who own a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from this farming, she is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khat Sarith, is a construction worker who can make a small income to support the family.  Mrs. Toeurn L. is 26 years old and the mother of three children who are all too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is 35 years old. He runs a small retail business selling spare auto parts and paint. He's been in business for five years and has one employee. He successfully repaid a previous loan from Faulu for Kes. 20,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 40,000 to add stock and expand his business premises.

He describes himself as social and very hardworking and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has diversified his business and his income has increased. In the future, he hopes to invest in the stock market and real estate.

loans.use: Add to his stock of paints

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica D. is currently in the business of selling bread at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bread and cakes to sell.  Monica is 29 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 2 school age children.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bread and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Mrs. Virgincita B., 44 years of age, is married and is a resident of Sumirap, Tangub City. They are blessed with nine children of whom four are still studying and the rest are now working. Her husband is doing manual labor jobs and at the same time is engaged in farming. With this situation, it has been so hard for her to raise their big family. She decided to engage in fish selling and was able to sustain this business for three years, even in times of hardships. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) a year ago because she is very much interested in PMPC's various products and services. Having successfully repaid two previous loans, she was able to borrow an amount of 7,000 Philippine pesos for her third loan to obtain needed capital for her business. Her dream in life is to be able to send all her children to college so that they will have a better future and be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị's Group

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh, Hà nội. H. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Vạn lộc (2). H. is married and has two school-aged children. She operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month. In 2006, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,450,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. H. is now requesting a new loan of 6,322,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 5th from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her general store. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** H. Nguyễn Thị (10107030006) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh -Hà nội. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vạn lộc (2). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND. Vào 2006, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,450,000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,322,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (10107030009) là 38 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 2. Ngô Thị T. (10107030008) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông ngH.. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh NgH. Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia S. is a single woman who supports her family by running a general store, providing an electronic reloading service and buying and selling rice. She lives in Sto. Mapait, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 13,000.

Delia S. is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she can continue to sustain the growth of her general store, electronic reloading and rice retailing businesses. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Delia S. hopes to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio M. is from the village of Baculud, Iguig, Cagayan. He is forty-nine years old. Antonio is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Antonio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP every harvest (every four months).

In 2007, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonio  successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Antonio is requesting a new loan of 33,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be Andres's sixth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-five branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Amigos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES”, actualmente se encuentra en el IX ciclo y esta conformado por 15 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia de Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Sur del país.

Las actividades económicas de los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta de prendas de vestir,  venta de comestibles, venta de comida, venta de ropa y venta de útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios de guía de turismo. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos de funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto de valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad de capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Lorenza es socia del banco comunal Amigos Emprendedores, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Maria, Lisbeth y Patricia). La socia se dedica a la venta de ropa en el centro comercial “San José” en la calle Trinitarias de la ciudad Cusco. Lorenza nos cuenta que ella trae ropa de la ciudad de desaguadero como por ejemplo casacas. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone su trabajo. La socia requiere el crédito de los 800 soles para comprar útiles escolares. La socia también nos cuenta que cuando empieza la campaña escolar guarda su mercadería de ropa y arreglar su tienda para vender útiles escolares. 
        
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The “AMIGOS EMPRENDEDORES” (ENTERPRISING FRIENDS) communal bank is in its 9th loan cycle; it is composed of 15 hard-working persons who are always seeking opportunities to get ahead in life and to provide, through their daily efforts, a better future for their children. They reside in Cusco province, Cusco department. Cusco is a city that is renowned for its historical city center, its scenery and its history; it is an enchanting city in the south of the country. The members are involved in a variety of commercial activities. Some sell clothing, others sell food. Others sell clothing or school supplies and some are tourist guides. The communal bank has had several loan cycles and the members state that they are happy and satisfied with the credit services, the savings and the training they receive. They are particularly happy with the savings they can accrue by leaving their funds in a common account over time. Lorenza is a member of the Amigos Emprendedores communal bank. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children (Maria, Lisbeth and Patricia). She sells clothing in the “San José” shopping center on Cusco’s Trinitarias street. Lorenza tells us that she brings the clothes, like coats, from the city of Desaguadero. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She need and 800 sol loan to buy school supplies. She tells us that when the new school year is about to start, she puts away all her clothing and concentrates on selling school supplies. The members as a whole are grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledge to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia  S. is 45 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  Asia  has many years of experience in this business.  Asia  needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Asia  joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asia 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Haydee Mercedes

texts.es: Haydee tiene un negocio que ella misma administra hace 5 años, empezó trabajando para otras personas, como vendedora y ayudante así pudo aprender  y decidió aperturar un negocio de confecciones de ropa para  niños, además juntamente con su esposo cantan música vernacular algo que hacen desde jóvenes. Estos trabajos les ayudan a solventar los gastos familiares  así como también la educación de sus hijos, sus objetivos son poder cancelar el terreno que obtuvieron con mucho esfuerzo y emprender una  pequeña empresa de confecciones. El préstamo obtenido lo invertirán en comprar telas e hilos para su nueva temporada de confecciones. La Sra. Haydee esta agradecida con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Haydee has a business that she has been managing herself for five years. She started working for other people as a salesperson and an assistant. That way she was able to learn. She decided to open a business making children’s clothes. Also, she and her husband sing vernacular music. They have done this since they were young. These jobs help them pay the family expenses. They also pay for their children’s education. Her objective is to be able to finish paying for a piece of land that they got through much effort. She wants to undertake a small clothes making company. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread for the new season of making clothes. Haydee is grateful for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim Y., 58, is an older woman who lives with her husband and seven of her children in Takeo province. She grows rice, but her plantation is just enough to support her family members. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches and sells fish at the local market. On average, he is able to make about US$ 2.50 in profit a day. Three of the children are in school, while two are construction workers. 

Every month, Kim Y. spends about US$ 30 on food, US$ 5 on utilities, US$ 15 on her children's education, US$ 5 on family transportation and another US$ 15 on miscellaneous. So to reduce their transportation costs, Kim Y. needs to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert L. is from Annafunan West, Tuguegarao City. He is 39 years old, married and has 1 school-aged child. Robert owns and operates a business providing transportation services in the local community. Robert has been involved in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert is requesting his first loan, of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lezeil

texts.en: Lezeil A. is from the village of Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Lezeil owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Lezeil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lezeil is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun L. (pictured above), aged 55, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a driver and the other one stays at home. The family lives aL. National Road Number six, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Lun has been selling chickens and ducks for 15 years. She hopes to expand her business to be able to get extra income to support her family. Therefore, she is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and ducks for resale.

loans.name: Abil

texts.ru:
Adil rodilsya v 1989 qodu.On ne jenat. On jivet v Absherone regione so svoyey semyoy. Adil uje 2 qoda v etom businesse. Adil molodoy i eto u neqo noviy bizness. On sam soderjit mamu i svoyu sestru kotoroy 16 let. Eta mashina ostalas emu ot otca .

Seychas Adil nujdayetsya v sude 2000 AZN chto bi kupit zapchasti dlya eqo mashini, Chtobi koqda on yexal v Derevni eqo mashina ne portilas po doroge potomu chto koqda mashina portitsya po doroge kliyende bolshe ne yezdat na etoy mashine peresajivayutsya na druquyu a on ne xochet teryat svoix kliyentov. On shitayet chto eta ssuda emu ochen pomojet. 

Tak on smojet uderjivat svoix kliyentov, posle cheqo u eqo budet rasti pribil, i on xochet v budushem vidat zamuj sestru i samomu jenitsya.
texts.en:
Adil was born in 1989. He's unmarried and lives with his family in the Absherone region. He's been in business for two years; he's young and it's a new business for him. He's the sole means of support for his mother and sixteen-year-old sister. The taxi was left by his father. Adil needs 2000 AZN to buy spare parts for his taxi, so that when he takes it out of town it doesn't break down on the road. If if does, his customers won't come back, but will go elsewhere, and he doesn't want to lose his clients. He imagines the loan will help him quite a bit. If Adil can support his clients, business will grow. He hopes that in the future his sister will get married, and he'll marry, too.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the spare parts to repair his taxi

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina B. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. She is 56 years old. Adelina is married and has eight adult children. Adelina owns and operates a business providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Adelina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2005, Adelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Adelina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Adelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Mrs. Celerina C. is from the barangay of Catadman in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the 62-year-old wife of Epefanio. They are blessed with 2 children, one who is married with a family and the other who is an office worker. Celerina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, earning about PHP 1,000 a month while her husband earns about PHP 6,000 as a construction worker. Their children also help out with finances in times of need. 

Celerina joined PMPC in 2005 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and from her previous business. Celerina has successfully repaid a PHP 3000 loan and is now requesting her fourth loan, for 4000 PHP, to purchase housing materials needed for renovation and repairs.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy housing materials for renovation and repairs.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata B. I. is married to a driver and has 2 dependents.  She sells materials for different types of sport in the central market of Makeni city. Fatmata has 25 years of experience in her sporting goods business, which was initially financed by her husband. Fatmata has a good loan repayment history.  She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more items for her shop and hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to educate her children and to buy a  piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Thuan T. N. is 49 years old with two children. She runs a small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch to residents of the neighborhood. She is a professional cook so her restaurant is always crowded with customers. She earns 130.000 VND profit per day.  She is always very good about repaying her loans from the Seda credit program. Now, she is requesting a loan of 8,066,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. sells panties, dresses and body creams at Elmina. Araba has been through junior high school. She is married and has two children. She is responsible for feeding the family. Her loan will be used to buy various body creams for sale. She hopes to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: buy various body creams for sale

loans.name: José Nolberto

texts.es: El Sr. José Nolberto R. es originario del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, se desempeña como director del colegio Monseñor Bosco de dicho municipio donde tiene 12 años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda con el que compraría cerámica.
texts.en: Mr. José Nolberto R. is from the Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality.  He works as the principal of the Monseñor Bosco School of the same municipality, where he has been employed for 12 years.  This is the first loan he requests with Ceprodel, which he intends to use to make improvements to his home such as buying ceramics/tiles.

loans.use: To purchase ceramics/tiles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. R. is from the village of Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Emily is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling variety of different products in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Emily joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emily is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Emily from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a married woman with five children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated her retail shop, rental house and water vendor businesses; neighbours and passersby being her potential customers. Hanna faces a major challenge of delayed payments from creditors who take goods on credit. She hopes to purchase a matatu (fourteen passenger van) in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to get education on business management and to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase 4 sacks of rice for her retail shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is 24 years old and is married with 2 children who are 2 and 4 years old. She lives in Kanazi district, where she owns a shop selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Her business is open from 5 am to 8 pm every day.

Seraphine's current profit is too low to expand meaningfully, but she believes that a small amount of additional capital would positively change her life. For that reason, Seraphine is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a variety of goods to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida L. is from Mantic Tangub City. She is 51 years old. Nida is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years, and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Nida is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Nida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Peris Osoro

texts.en:
For five years, Peris M. has practiced farming (both dairy and horticultural) in Kahawa Wendani, just a few kilometers from Nairobi city centre. Besides farming, she also runs a posho mill and rental houses.

She is 59 years old and widowed, with one son. Peris supports her son and his wife, two grandchildren, and also a sister who is physically challenged. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to buy more animal feed and complete a rental house.

The expected income from the business after this loan she will use to pay back the loan and complete her house by doing some finishing upstairs. Peris hopes to succeed and ensure that her grandchildren have a good education in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, and complete rental houses.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín, de 32 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Noria (29) y sus tres pequeños  hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando muy duro Efraín ha logrado que sus chacras se vuelvan muy fértiles y productivas. Todos los días labora con dedicación en sus tierras, haciendo que sus cultivos sean cada vez mejores. Lo cosechado lo lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde generalmente recibe muy buena paga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, ya  lleva seis años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos a zonas alejadas. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones y aumentar sus ganancias.Es  el segundo préstamo de Efraín con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo.Efraín tiene planeado invertir  los dos mil soles solicitados, en la compra de  abono e insecticidas, para sus tierras, y espera mejorar su producción.
texts.en: Efraín, age 32, is a very simple and hard-working man. He lives in his own house, together with his wife Noria (29) and his three small children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. By working very hard, Efraín has been able to make his fields very fertile and productive. Every day, he works in his fields with dedication, constantly improving his crops. He takes his harvest to sell at the wholesale market of the city of Pichanaki, where he generally receives very good earnings. What he likes most about his work is cultivating his crops. He has done this work for six years already, and he thinks the hardest part is transporting his products to distant areas. Over time, he hopes to buy new land to expand his plantings and increase his earnings. This is Efraín's second loan with MFP; he has been very punctual with his previous payments and he plans to continue in the same way. In his communal bank, he is a very responsible member who always keeps up to date with the agreements made by the group. Efraín plans to invest the two thousand Peruvian soles he is requesting in buying fertilizer and insecticides for his fields, and he hopes to improve his production.

loans.use: Buying fertilizer and insecticides to improve his crops

loans.name: Soltonbek

texts.en:
Soltonbek S. is 55 and married. He and his wife have six children. Their youngest son lives with them and helps in the household.   

He and his wife earn their living through livestock breeding, which they started in 1995. They began this activity with the sum of 20,000 KGS and managed to maintain the farm with sheep, horses and milk cows. Using the revenue from reselling fattened livestock,  Soltonbek was able to pay for the education of his elder daughters.
 
Soltonbek works hard to make this business successful and now plans to develop it with the help of a loan of 50,000 KGS. With the revenue from this investment, Soltonbek wants to pay for the education of his younger sons. In the future, his family plans to enlarge their number of cattle. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors. Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 28-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 businesses: meat vending and livestock trading She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.

Analyn now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 in order to help fund business operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Analyn hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to theNWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida S. is from the village of Maslog, Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married and has 1 adult-aged child. Aida owns and operates a food stall, making and selling a variety of Filipino dishes such as pancit bihon, sampayna, humba and nilagang baka in the local community. She also operates a retail store selling assorted products. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional ingredients for her dishes and to increase working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and to increase working capital

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 28 years old, and he has two children who are 2 and 6 years old. He is a moto-taxi driver, and he is requesting a loan in order to buy another motorcycle for using in his business. With the profits he plans to feed his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Jorge es una persona joven emprendedora, quien vive en casa de sus papas,  antes trabajaba como chofer asalariado  y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y un financiamiento  indica que  logro comprar su propia movilidad, actualmente esta afiliado a un sindicato de transportistas en taxi de la ciudad de el alto. El tiene su propia familia que por razones de salud  su esposa radica temporalmente en el departamento del Beni con sus dos pequeños. La meta que el se trazo es ahorrar y darles una vivienda propia aquí en el alto para que su familia nuevamente este reunida, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en el arreglo de su movilidad ya que esta presentando algunas fallas y esto le ocasiona problemas con los clientes ya que no les puede llevar a su destino así que con el dinero del crédito pondrá a su movilidad en mejores condiciones, el Sr. Jorge Esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mr. Jorge is a young person with entrepreneur's spirit. He lives with his parents, used to work as a contracted driver but now has his own vehicle. He shared with us that thanks to his work he was able to buy it and is presently a member of the Drivers’ Union in the city of El Alto.

He has his own family, his wife and their two small children are temporarily living in the Department of Beni for health reasons. His goal is to save and give his family its own house in the city of El Alto so that they can all be together again.

The loan will be utilized to repair his vehicle, because it has some mechanical faults and they cause problems with his customers. The loan will make it possible for Mr. Jorge to get his vehicle in better condition. He is grateful with the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea was born in 1956 is a widow with three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factories one is a laborer. Mrs. Chea is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land which she uses to grows rice and corn for a living. She would like to grow rice in the dry season but does not have enough money. Mrs. Chea is therefore asking for a loan to hire laborers to plow her land and buy fertilizer and pesticides to grow rice and corn.

loans.use: to hire farm labor and buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA D. OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado D. Oropesa,  provincia D. Quispicanchis y  departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina; es  viuda; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales son ya independientes, la socia tiene un pequeño kiosco D. venta D. golosinas y pasteles en el colegio D. la comuna, la socia elabora tortas y sándwich, ella también hace gelatinas, pasteles, jugos y refrescos. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra D. productos para implementar el kiosco. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. golosinas y otros para el kiosco.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Estrella D. Oropesa” which is located in the village of Oropesa in Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, widowed, and has four children who are already independent. Guillermina has a small kiosk at the local school where she sells candy and pastries. She also makes cakes, sandwiches, gelatin, juices, and soft drinks. Guillermina needs a loan to invest in the purchase of products for her kiosk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy candy and other products to restock her kiosk.

Guillermina is extremely grateful for this loan and promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase candy and other food products.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La señora Lourdes tiene una tienda donde comercializa cosméticos para damas . El crédito lo requiere para comprar: rubores, lápices  labiales, cremas, así podrá  aumentar su capital, sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Vive en alquiler la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera y no tiene hijos. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Lourdes has a store where she sells women’s cosmetics.  She needs the loan to buy blush, lipstick, and creams.  That way she will be able to increase her capital and her sales in order to increase her earnings.

She rents where she lives in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the first time that she has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy blush, lipstick, and creams for her business of selling cosmetics.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame KHADY qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. elle est Mariée et mère de quatre enfants et de trois autres qui lui sont confiés par proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour avoir pratiquée depuis environs trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de légumes.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created July 10, 2002. It is composed of seven women who come from the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail.

Khady, on the left side of the picture with the raised hand, is the group's leader. She is 36 years old. She is married and a mother of four children, with three others who have been left in her care by relatives.

She retails vegetables. She has significant experience in this business, since she has been active in it it for about three years.

This loan will allow her to finance her vegetable retail activity.

Her objective is to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Pedro Alejandrino

texts.es:
Pedro Alejandrino tiene 54 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir trabanjo y dejar a los hijos de herencia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Alejandrino, 54, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank "SEÑOR DE LA SALUD" is located in the Soloma District in the Echeandia Canton.  The group is involved mainly in agrilcutural activities with short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Pedro grows corn and rice and makes his purchases in Ventanas.  He sells his products in the fairs held everyday, especially on Sundays.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and feritilizer, which will help him acquire the necessary supplies.  He is up against challenges such as insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as climate variation.  His dream is to buy more land so he can keep working and leave his children something to inherit.

He enjoys sports and getting together with family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Francisco has a shop that sells mainly coconuts for copra. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconut for copra.

Francisco has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Francisco hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 42 años reside en la localidad de Palcamayo. Como madre soltera se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y muy dedicada que cuida de sus 2 hijos: Rocío y Anderson, a los que quiere mucho. Como mujer trabajadora y luchadora, todas las mañanas se dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos de arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, productos que cuida con mucha dedicación y esmero. En todo este tiempo pudo adquirir sus propios terrenos agrícolas, más la demanda que genera las verduras en el mercado de la ciudad; le obligan a alquilar otros terrenos para sembrar en mayor cantidad. Paralelo a esta actividad, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de verduras a la capital del país donde viaja desde hace 12 años. Su trabajo consiste en la compra de diferentes variedades de verduras y hortalizas, los cuales en unión con su propia cosecha. Lo comercializa al mercado “La parada”, de la capital donde según sus propias palabras “termina de vender en 2 horas”, menciona. Ahora ha sembrado espinaca que cosechará dentro de una semana. Le va muy bien en su negocio y sus aspiraciones son mayores, pues quiere abrir una tienda de fertilizantes y abono en su localidad, donde la mayoría de sus pobladores son agricultores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen María” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece su colaboración, ya que le ayuda a seguir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juana de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en completar sus ahorros para la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja de la variedad letrilla, que cuesta un promedio de S/. 850 cada una.
texts.en: Juana is 42 years old and lives in the town of Palcamayo. As a single mother, she is characterized by being a responsible and very dedicated person who takes good care of her 2 children, Rocío and Anderson, whom she loves very much. As a hard-working and persistent woman, every morning she works in her fields growing peas, spinach and carrots, which she cares for with great dedication and effort. Over the course of time she was able to acquire her own agricultural lands. With the current demand for vegetables in the city's market, she also needed to rent other lands to plant in greater quantities. Parallel to this activity, she works buying and selling vegetables in the country's capital, where she has been traveling for the past 12 years. Her work consists of buying various kinds of vegetables and produce, which she combines with her own harvest. She sells them at the market in the capital called "La Parada," where, as she mentions in her own words, she "is finished selling in 2 hours." Now she has planted spinach, which she will harvest within a week. Her business is going very well for her, and her aspirations are great: she would like to open a store selling compost and fertilizers in her town, where most of the inhabitants are farmers. She belongs to the “Virgen María” communal bank. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for this support, since it helps her keep advancing toward her goals. At the same time, she is once again committed to fulfilling her payment schedule, as with the previous loans she had. She also appreciates being part of her communal bank, because all of its members are responsible people with a great sense of solidarity. When she receives this support, Juana will invest the funds she is requesting to add to her savings to buy 5 bags of pea seeds of the Letrilla variety, which cost an average of 850 Peruvian soles each.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent, 32, has operated his food kiosk in Naivasha town for the last six years. He is married to Mary and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of their field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to restock his food kiosk with cooking oil, flour and sugar, items which he buys in bulk.

In the future, he hopes to expand his food kiosk and open a bigger kiosk where he can serve many people at the same time.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, sugar and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.en: Fausto lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, where he makes a living by selling construction supplies. He has run this business for the last 11 years and owns a dump truck for delivering sand and gravel. Faustino is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to purchase inventory.

loans.use: to purchase gravel, sand, bricks, and cinder blocks.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celsa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados, ella vende en el mercado de Urubamba desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia también tiene sus tierras de cultiva donde siembra hortalizas, repollo y culantro y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pollos y pescados y también para mejorar las tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y pescados y también para comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This loan applicant belongs to the “SAYHUA 3” Community Bank. This bank is located in the Urubamaba district in the Urubamba province in the department of Cusco. This member is named Mrs. Celsa. She is 47 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. This member varies her daily activities between businesses. One of the businesses is selling chickens and fish. She sells these in the Urubamba market from 6:00am until 6:00pm. She also has cultivated farmland where she grows plants like cabbage and cilantro. She sells these items in various markets. She would like to increase her fish and poultry sales business and also improve her farmland. She is asking for this loan in order to buy chickens and fish and also buy seeds for her farmland.
This member is happy to have the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chicken and fish and also seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en: Pablita is 51 years old. She's married with only two children. She lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her children are already working. Pablita has been in a buy and sell business for 13 years. She a dealer of Avon and other beauty products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month just for this business alone. She's been a member in the cooperative for almost four years. Eight times she was able to take a loan from PMPC. She's a good paying member. She wants these loans to be able to purchase more products and to be able to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela D. 39 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero D. vida en zona cercana a la ciudad. Ella se dedica al comercio. Gracias a sus habilidades ha logrado establecer una tienda en su hogar D. residencia la cual ha mantenido durante  mucho tiempo y es la que le ha permitido tener acceso a mejores ingresos los cuales le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad D. vida. Se destaca entre la competencia por poseer artículos que en ninguna otra tienda se hayan, ya que ellos, los va a comprar ella personalmente al proveedor. Blanca es una mujer ejemplar, trabajadora y emprendedora la cual no se cansa D. trabajar. Ella sueña con ver su negocio florecer y poder satisfacer a una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles D. venta. Para esto ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin D. comprar variedad D. productos: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, detergente, golosinas, etc. que le permitan atraer a mas clientes y por consecuencia lograr su sueño.
texts.en: 39 year old Blanca Estela lives in her own home along with her partner. Their home is close to the city. Thanks to her abilities, she has been able to establish a store in her home and has been running this for a long time and this is what has enabled her to make a good income which in turn has enabled her to improve her quality of life. She stands out among the competition for having items for sale that the other stores don't have and she buys these personally from the supplier. Blanca is an exemplorary woman, hardworking, and enterprising who never tires of her work. She dreams of seeing her business flourish and having the satisfaction of greater demand that will enable her to increase her sales. For this reason, she has taken the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the goal of buying a variety of products: oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, sodas, etc, that will let her attract more clients and so achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products: oil, rice, sugar, beans, detergent, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Meralyn

texts.en: Meralyn is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is only three. Meralyn and her husband are both farmers. They grow rice to sell to their community. Meralyn's husband mainly manages their farm, while Meralyn focuses on selling fresh fish at her town's market. Meralyn does her best to augment their income and sustain their family. She plans to use her loan to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and more fish to sell

loans.name: Odo Trust Bank Group

texts.en: Esther is 44 years old. She is divorced and has three children. She has been selling roasted plantains and yams at Nyamebekyere, a suburb of Berekum, for the past two years. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more yams and plantains to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales so she can save more for her children’s education and also add another business. Esther belongs to the community group called “ODO” which means Love Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase plantains and yams in bulk

loans.name: Víctor Guadalupe

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor, es un empleado de una tienda de auto partes, él y su apreciable esposa acudieron a la institución para solicitar un préstamo para comprar un portón para su vivienda ya que su casa actualmente  no  cuenta  con  uno  y nos  comenta  que  desea  brindarle  más  seguridad para su niño pequeño de cinco años, posteriormente quieren pintar el exterior de  su  domicilio, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en:
Victor is an employee in a repair shop. 

He and his sensible wife came to the institution for a loan to buy a gate for their house as they currently do not have one. He tell us that he wants to give his little five year old son more security. 

At a later time he wants to paint the outside of his house. 

He is grateful for the support that helps him with this project.

loans.use: to buy and to pay for installation of a security gate for his house.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
This is Bonifacia, 67, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is a widow, and mother of five children.  All of them are already working and have their own families.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Bonifacia operates a dried fish stall. What she basically does is buy dried fish from a wholesaler and then repack them and sell them per piece/pack at a profit. Products can range from dried fish to dried anchovies and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bonifacia dreams of expanding her store and helping her children through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of dried fish needed in her business

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su familia, conformada por su esposo y un hijo, ella administra una tienda en la que ofrece D. toda clase D. productos necesarios en un hogar, la idea fue D. ella, para ayudar a su familia, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 8:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la inversión en el negocio, comprara mercadería como jabón, detergentes para lavar ropa, trastos, papel higiénico, la inversión le ayudara para crecer y poder atender la demanda D. los clientes.
Su objetivo es llegar a tener el negocio fuerte, que atienD. a todos los clientes D. la zona, convirtiéndolo en un minisúper.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her family composed of her husband and son.  She runs a store that stocks all sorts of items needed in the home.  The idea was hers to help her family and she’s open from 6am until 8pm.

She’s asking for a loan to invest in the store.  She will buy merchandise like soap, laundry detergent, kitchenware and toilet paper.  The investment will help her grow and meet customer demand.  Her goal is to have a strong business that meets the needs of all the zone’s residents turning it into a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to buy soap, laundry detergent, kitchenware and toilet paper.

loans.name: Wilmer Jhony

texts.es: El joven wilmer tiene 22 años es conviviente tienes un hijo de 2 años de edad, actualmente trabaja Chef es decir cocinero en un prestigioso restaurante, por las noches estudia gastronomia, Wilmer nos cuenta que no es facil estudiar y trabajar a su vez, pero su motivacion para salir adelante son su hijo y esposa, Wilmer solita el prestamo para seguir pagando sus estudios. Sabemos que Wilmer cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Wilmer is a young man who is 22 years of age. He is in a common-law relationship and has a two-year-old son. Wilmer currently works as a chef at a prestigious restaurant. In the evenings, he takes cooking classes. Wilmer says that studying and working is not easy, but he is motivated to succeed on behalf of his wife and child.

He is requesting a loan so that he can continue paying for his studies. The staff of EDAPROSPO knows that Wilmer will accomplish his goals through hard work and great effort, and the loans will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay for his cooking courses.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. Ivy has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks such as halo-halo (flavored-ice salad). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks. Ivy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Martha Liliana

texts.es: Martha  de 21 años vive con su hijo de 2,  en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar ubicado a orillas del mar donde tradicionalmente habitan extranjeros poetas, artistas que se inspiran en este lugar. Marta es la propietaria  de una miscelánea donde vende regalos, tarjetas piñatería perfumes y variedades femeninas y para el hogar que son una necesidad de los habitantes de esta población. Su negocio se divide en dos locales en una está su miscelánea y en el otro un café internet donde ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, fax, telefonía celular y llamadas locales e internacionales.  Su negocio funciona desde hace 4 años y sus ventas siempre se han mantenido con una tendencia creciente, porque además es un punto de recaudo un banco, donde puede pagar su cuota de préstamo y de servicios públicos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el comprara ropa, juguetería porque son las mercancías de mayor salida en el fin de año lleno de fiestas y alegría familiar, donde usualmente se incrementan sus venta y lograría él éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
