Marta is 21 years old and lives with her two year old son in Puerto Colombia, located along the sea, where foreign poets and artists live and are inspired.  Marta owns a boutique where she sells gifts, cards, piñatas, perfumes, feminine items, and things that people need around the house.

Her business is divided into two locations; one is the boutique and the other is an internet café, where she provides photocopy, fax, cell phone, and local and international calling services.  She’s been in business for four years and it’s been growing, because she also offers bill paying services and people can go there to pay on their bank loans or utilities.

This Kiva loan will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy clothing and toys because these are the things that sell best at the end of the year, which is full of parties and family glee.  Sales usually go up and this will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to buy clothing and toys.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen una niña de 4 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.

Ella es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que además se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadillas, panes de almidón, corviches, y jugos de frutas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 15h00, como su casa está muy cerca de una escuela de la localidad tiene bastantes ventas, lleva dos años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va utilizar para comprar aceite, plátano, maní, frutas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Proyecto 2003 Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo (Manta) canton, a place known for its pretty beaches that bathe the shores of this beautiful place.  The majority of the residents here are very hardworking and work in maritime jobs.

Here we met María.  She is 24 years old and married, and has a four-year-old daughter from this relationship.  Her husband is a fisherman.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank and she likes it because the loans are granted so quickly.

She is a very good mother and housewife who also works preparing and selling snacks and fast food such as turnovers, cornbread, "corviches" [a dish made from green bananas and fish], and fruit juices, among other things.  She works every day from 8:00 until 5:00.  Since her house is very close to a neighborhood school, she has many sales.  She has been in this business for two years and it is going very well for her.

She is going to use this loan to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies to prepare the food.
 
Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy oil, bananas, peanuts, fruit, and other supplies.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Mr. Byambasuren is a 46-year-old who lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He was employed as a welder before, but the salary wasn’t enough to meet his family's necessities, so he started driving a taxi four years ago. Beyond the taxi business, he services cars for more earnings. 

Byambasuren’s wife is pregnant and is going to give birth soon. He is very worried about his old house’s condition as the new baby is coming. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.use: To repair the roof and other parts of his house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 65 años de edad, vive en el barrio San Antonio con sus dos nietos y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes le visitan a su casa para comprar las tortillas, no sale a vender por su edad,  ya no puede andar caminando bajo el sol, pero muchos clientes la prefieren porque sus tortillas son grandes y sabrosas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua.
Su meta es poder tener una pulperia fuerte en su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen is 65 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio with her two grandchildren.  She makes and sells tortillas for a living, which she has been doing for more than three years.  Her customers come to her house to buy her tortillas; she doesn't go out to sell them because of her age.  She can't go walking around in the sun anymore, but many of her customers prefer her because her tortillas are big and tasty.

She will use her loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water.

Her goal is to have a solid grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, water, and firewood

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is married with two children. He is 59 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela. Eduardo is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 20 years. Eduardo has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops. He has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Eduardo hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for planting crops

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Born and raised in El Paso, Texas, Jorge and Felix operate Beta Group, an electrical company. With zero working capital, Jorge opened the hometown business three months ago, offering electrical services, and after only one month was able to hire his business partner, Felix. 

In their business, Jorge and Felix offer security accessory installations and general electrical work. They plan to hire additional team members to provide better service coverage for the city, but currently work together on all projects. 

With more than 20 years of experience in commercial, industrial and federal government projects, Jorge describes the business as a “perfect balance of high-quality project management, installation, maintenance, and analysis.” However, to further their business, they needed a loan to cover start-up costs. After a referral from Chase Bank, they ventured to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan to fund insurance, workers’ compensation bonds, and licensing to better secure contracts. 

With Jorge as the primary borrower and Felix as the coborrower, the team were approved for $5,475.

They are beginning by offering services starting at $65 and allowing their company to be competitive in their industry. Through their experience, Jorge and Felix expect their business to profit $125,000 within their first year.

loans.use: to purchase workers' compensation bonds and insurance, and to cover start-up fees.

loans.name: Tojiddin

texts.en: Tojiddin is 25 years old. He is married but has not any child. He lives with her wife who is a housewife and parents. Tojiddin is a student of the Islamic University of Tajikistan. Tojiddin studies well. He is one of the best students. He is going to learn Islam well to teach other people. He must to pay for his tuition but he has not enough money for it. He is asking for a loan of 725 USD to pay for tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Iii Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND III est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Anne Mariannick, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24 ans a fréquenté l’école. Anne Mariannick est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Anne Mariannick vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par son mari. Anne Mariannick vend des mèches, des chaussures et des tissus depuis sept ans environ. De façon secondaire, Anne Mariannick vend également des produits vivriers ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins.  Anne Mariannick s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO et au NIGERIA. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne Mariannick sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND III, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches, des chaussures et des tissus.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es: 7 mujeres  responsables de distintas actividades comerciales  todas ellas las integrantes del grupo comunal “MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS DE MICAELA BASTIDAS”, una de ellas es la Sra. Reyna  de 51 años de edad casada  y con 1 hijo. La Sra. Reyna se dedica  hace 22  años al negocio de VENTA DE ROPA.  La Sra. Reyna  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual le generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa.  En el futuro le gustaría confeccionar ropa para poder vender sus productos  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más mercadería (ropa en general) para poder tener más ingresos. La Sra. Reyna es la primera de la izquierda que se encuentra sentada la cual lleva un polo blanco con mangas largas. A la vez se despide con un abrazo de Kiva y  Edaprospo  diciéndoles que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Seven responsible women with different commercial activities are members of the Mujeres Triunfadoras de Micaela Bastidas community bank. One member is Reyna, who is 51 years old, married, and has one child. For 22 years, Reyna has worked selling clothing. Reyna tells us that she has gained the loyalty of her customers, which generates income to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to sew clothing to sell her products and earn more income.

With the loan provided, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (clothing in general) so she can earn more income. Reyna is the first on the left, seated, in a white shirt with long sleeves. She takes her leave with a hug for Kiva and Edaprospo, telling them that she will meet all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rumen

texts.en:
Rumen H. has rich experience inn restaurant business. For over 17 years he had worked as a warehouse manager in the ex-state catering company. The company was closed and he decided to start a business.

He rents premises and makes it a restaurant. This restaurant works more then 10 years. It is situated on a trade center of the city.

Rumen H. is married and has two sons. They all work in the restaurant. His wife is a cook and the boys are waiters.

Now Rumen wants to make some repairs in his restaurant nad needs $ 1 600.

loans.use: For repairs and equipment of the restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate and expand her restaurant

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur has a small shop that sells mobile devices. He got married six months ago and feels he has a big responsibility to his family. Therefore he needs to develop his shop and increase his income through this business. This loan is his first experience with Microfinance.

In his own words, "I feel I will be able to get a loan, pay it back...and increase my income." He wants to be a competitor in the area and be the first mobile shop buying and bringing new and modern types of mobile devices.

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buying new kinds of mobile devices and developing the shop

loans.name: George William

texts.en:
George William is 59 years old. He is married with three children, a boy in University, a girl in primary school grade seven and the last boy in primary school grade four. He is an electrician by profession. He opened a shop which deals in electrical materials especially those used in wiring houses. He has 19 years experience.

He requests a loan of US $1200 to purchase more stock; i.e., electric wires, earth load, extension cables and many more items. When he increases the stock, he will attract more customers, increase the sales and the profit margin will go up.

He plans in future to open a spare parts shop for bicycles, which are in high demand in the area. He plans to pay back the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: To increase  stock of electrical supplies

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Maria is an artisan who weaves wraps, bedspreads, comforters and handkerchiefs. She is 23 years old, married and has three children. She goes to the nearest city to sell her items to wholesalers. Maria is part of a collective with two other artisans, María Gómez Vásquez and María Hernández Jiménez. With the loan, they plan to purchase thread and fabrics at wholesale and in this way save on expenses and improve their earning margins.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA PETRONA , es artesana , teje chales , colchas, cubrecamas y servilletas , tiene 23 años , casada , tres hijos , para vender su mercadería viaja a la ciudad más cercana y las ofrece a los mayoristas . Forma parte del grupo Clavel 1 junto con doña María Gómez Vásquez (artesana) y doña María Hernández Jiménez (artesana). Con el préstamo invertirán en la compra de hilo y géneros al por mayor y de esta forma ahorrarán en los gastos y obtendrán mas ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabrics

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina O. is 40 years old, married with five children, and lives in Asaba Delta State. Her business is selling provisions and foodstuffs. She would like a loan of $800 to increase her store's inventory. She has been in LAPO for 3 years and started her business in the year 1996.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en:
Mrs.Lorn C., 47, and her husband have been married since 1998. They have seven children, ages 4-30. Two are still in school, but the others are grown and working. Lorn is a farmer and weaver, two skills she utilizes seasonally. She learned to weave from her mother when she was a girl and has now passed on that skill to her own daughter. Her husband also farms.

Lorn is presently requesting her fourth loan through MAXIMA in the amount of $1,000. She will use this loan in part to pay for the plowing and preparation of their fields. Lorn has already sprouted her tomato, watermelon and potatoes, and the transplants are growing quickly in the shaded area she's prepared in front of her home. She will also purchase papaya for planting. Everything is almost ready to plant and she estimates it will take nearly a month to get everything in the ground. It will then be 3 months before she can begin picking the vegetables and a full year for the papaya to produce fruit.

In the meantime, they will support the family with money from the loan, and to provide an added source of income, a portion of this loan will also be used to purchase silk materials and pay for the preparation of the loom for her daughter to weave.

loans.use: Buy raw silk and prepare fields for planting

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio is 50 years old. He works hard in his small farm of fruits, which for a long time has become the main source of income to provide for his beloved children. The responsibility to fulfill the rolls of father and mother in his home was very difficult . When he was told that he was going to have his first baby he was very happy and he has been since then.

His children are his motivation to keep working hard in obtaining every time better fruits in his harvest. Amancio’s new goal to start in the coffee production, since he did a business research and found out that the investment of the other families members of his community has been very profitable. He ask for your support to reach his desire to continue working for the well-being of his four beloved children. He ask for $525 that will pay off in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Amancio a sus 50 años, trabaja fervientemente en su chacra de frutas, la cual desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal fuente ingresos económicos para sus queridos hijos, la responsabilidad de cumplir los roles de padre y madre en su hogar era muy dificultoso pero no imposible ya que desde que le informaron que iba a tener su primer bebé estuvo muy feliz por la buena.La retribución diaria de sus hijos a través del inmenso cariño que le manifiesta impulsa a Amancio a seguir trabajando como hasta ahora para obtener cada vez mejores frutos en su cosecha y además para plantearse el nuevo reto de su incursión en la producción de café ya que durante meses realizo un estudio y se dio cuenta que la inversión de las otras familias miembros de su comunidad ha sido muy rentable..Requiere de vuestro apoyo para alcanzar su deseo con el deseo de seguir trabajando para bienestar de sus cuatro queridos hijos.

loans.use: Expand and capitalize his business

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Jessica M. sells food that she has prepared herself. She makes it in her own home and then transfers it to a local market, called Santa Ana de Chinandega, in order to sell it.

Jessica has had her business for three years. She began the business with a small amount of personal savings that she had been collecting since she was very young. She started selling food on the outskirts of the market on benches in which she offered outdoor meals or picnics. Before starting this business Jessica worked as a housewife, but her difficult economic situation led her to begin a food-sales business.

Nowadays Jessica has obtained a more comfortable space so that she can spread out her things with sufficient room to be able to sell her foods. Jessica has three children and she has been struggling hard for many years to educate them. They are studying in elementary school, and their only means of support is Jessica’s business.

The institution Ceprodel has given Jessica a hand by helping her grow the business. She has received a total of 18 loans over three years which have had a direct impact on her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad de la sra. Jessica es la venta de comida preparada por ella misma el cual la elabora en su hogar de habitación y luego la traslada al mercado Santa Ana de Chinandega para comercializarla.

Tiene 3 años de tener su negocio y se inicio con un bajo monto producto de ahorros personales que almacenaba desde muy joven. Ella inició vendiendo comidas en las afueras del mercado en unas bancas en las cuales ofrecía alimentos al aire libre. Antes de tener este negocio trabajó como ama de casa pero la difícil situación la impulso a implementar este negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Jessica ha conseguido un lugar bastante cómodo ya que puede extender sus enseres con suficiente espacio para poder vender los alimentos. Ella es madre de tres hijos que por mucho tiempo atrás ha venido luchando fuertemente para educarlos ya que están estudiando la primaria y su único medio de sustento es su negocio.

La institución Ceprodel le ha brindado una mano apoyándola en el crecimiento financiero de su negocio desde hace 3 años con un total de 18 créditos los que han tenido impacto directo en su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase food

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Dany runs a food stand in the neighborhood of Parta Alta in the city of Tarapoto, San Martin. She sells “Juane” (rice and chicken wrapped in a palm leaf), fried rice, french fries, and hot dogs. She prepares food daily to sell in the evening on the corner of a busy intersection near her house.

Dany is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Her children are young, so she is happy that she can work from home during the day and spend time with them. She started the business 5 years ago to help earn money for her family and gain some independence. She now has many loyal customers and an active social life. She says she gets to meet people from all over the region, which she really enjoys. One day she would like to save enough money to send her children to university.

A member of the community bank Las Orquidias, Dany is requesting a loan of $425 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy new tables, plates, and cups so she can serve more customers.

loans.use: She would like to buy new tables, plates and cups

loans.name: Anthonia's Utulivu 2 Group

texts.en:
Anthonia is 27 years old and is a single woman with 1 child, 3 years old. Anthonia is business and trading woman; she started in 2008. Everyday, she works from 9am to 10pm at her business.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Joyce and Asha, who have salons.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Nusreta

texts.en: Nusreta is a housewife from the town of Derventa. She is married and she has 3 children. Her husband works and he is earning  around  600 KM (about US$ 480) monthly. Nusreta will use this loan in the amount of US$ 975 to renovate the space in which she is growing mushrooms. Her wish is to start up a business selling the mushrooms in order to earn additional money for her family.

loans.use: To renovate a space to grow mushrooms

loans.name: Halil

texts.en: H. Halil is 32 years old. He is married and has three adorable children. He works hard to give them a good education and to make them happy. Halil is a market vendor. He sells houseware like dish and plates, tea sets, tea towels, and thermoses. He has been in this business for five years. His eldest son helps him with the business. His store is located in the central local market “Panjshanbe”. The business is successful and generates stable income, allowing Halil to support his family. Now Halil wants to increase the range of goods sold and he requests 1000 $ US Dollars for the term of 6 months. Halil would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of the house ware like dish and plates, thermoses, tea towels, tea sets in order to increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Ramota

texts.en:
Ramota B., 33, sells kitchen utensils, a business that she has had for the past eight years. She lives in shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria with her husband and four children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. She is requesting a loan to buy more kitchen utensils for her business. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy O. is 29 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City. She sells shoes and bags. She travels to Lagos State to buy shoes and bags and sells them to customers in Benin City. Mercy needs the loan amount of US$ 525 to buy more shoes and bags for sale. Mercy expresses her gratitude to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and bags for sale

loans.name: Than

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Than S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She owns a small grocery store in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. Her husband, Mr. Tun Vuthy, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Than S.’s family has little money and they cannot afford to build a new house. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Than S. has four children one of whom works in a garment factory while the other three are enrolled in school. Previously, Mrs. Than S. had obtained a loan to start her current business and she has now paid it back.

loans.use: to buy timbersto build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El Señor Dario de 28 años de edad vive desde hace 4 años con la señora Sandra, el matrimonio tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad.

Don Dario, desde pequeño trabajaba en la carpintería con su padre. En el 2004, fue cuando decidió emprender su propia carpintería con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba y un poco de ayuda que recibió de sus padres. Actualmente esta fabricando roperos de 4 y 5 puertas ya que estos artículos tienen mayor circulación y le deja mayor porcentaje de ganancia.

Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su carpintería para poder poner a la vista los refinados muebles que fabrica y de este modo dar a sus cliente una mejor atención.

El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de madera, terciadas y clavos.
texts.en:
Dario is 28 years old and is married to Sandra. They've lived together for 4 years and have a 2 year old boy.

Ever since he was a little boy, Dario worked at the carpenter's workshop with his father. In 2004, he decided to open his own carpenter's workshop with a little savings and some help from his parents. He's currently making 4- and 5-door wardrobes as they are in demand and he is able to make more money.

As a personal goal, Dario would like to expand his workshop in order to display the refined furniture he makes, and that way, serve his customers better.

Dario is soliciting a loan to buy lumber, plywood and nails.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, plywood and nails.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin Y. was born in 1962 and lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Hoy Loem, is a cow vendor who buys cows for breeding and re-sells them later at better price. This business is going well and they want to expand it so she would like a loan of $250 to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Chin Y. hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions by selling the cows. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora María P. es originaria de la bella ciudad de León donde actualmente se dedica a laborar en la venta de frutas y verduras.
Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana ella abre sus puertas para iniciar con la comercialización de los perecederos y desde el momento que abre su establecimiento, es visitada por los clientes que demandan de las frutas y verduras.

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, el negocio de la señora P. requiere de inversión y para ello ha solicitado un crédito en CEPRODEL para la compra de los perecederos y de esta manera continuar con el negocio que es su único sustento.
texts.en:
María P. is originally from the beautiful city of León where she works selling fruit and vegetables. During the early hours of the morning she opens her doors to start marketing her perishables and from the moment that she opens her establishment, she is visited by clients that demand the fruit and vegetables. Like all developing businesses, Mrs P.'s business requires investment and for this she is requesting a credit with CEPRODEL to buy perishables and in this way continue with her business, which is her only support.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de las frutas y verduras

loans.name: Mohammad Nasim

texts.en:
M. Nasim lives in district 1 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his own nuclear family. He is the only one to support his family. He has a retail shop and he has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. During this time he has attracted some good numbers of customers. He would like to make his business stronger, and therefore he needs some money.

He has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and start working hard to be more successful in his business. Nasim said, "I am sure that after a period of time I will be a good retailer."

He is happy.He wants to thank AFSG for this process of loans in Afghanistan that helps the poor people in this country to become successful and help their families to educate their children. In future, he wants to thank lenders around the world.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sam-Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-un M., 58, is a widow with one daughter who is a silk weaver. Her daughter was married and lives with her. The family lives on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sam-un has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Now, she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Florencia Teofila

texts.es:
Florencia empezó con su tienda de abarrotes y gaseosas desde hace un año y medio año. El local que alquila es parte de la casa de su madre en Comas; tuvo que organizarse así por que donde vive ella su negocio no es rentable. A parte de la tienda, Florencia también vende cosméticos.

Empezó sacando préstamos de otro banco, pero hace un mes se animó a juntarse a las alcancías comunales de EDAPROSPO gracias a su hermana que le contó de las posibilidades de ahorros que vienen con los préstamos. 
Mientras que su esposo, maestro de construcción con contrato de trabajo, se encarga de pagar por la luz, la electricidad y la comida, a sus treinta y nueve años Florencia es responsable de cubrir los demás gastos, el gas, útiles que falten de la casa, y los consumos de sus dos hijos de quince y diez años.

En el futuro le gustaría agrandar su tienda, amoblarla, y ponerle algo de seguridad, puesto que ha sufrido un robo hace poco y quiere evitar estar en riesgo.
texts.en:
Florencia began her soft drink and general store a-year-and-a-half ago. The business space that she is renting is a part of her mother’s house in Comas. She had to set up her store this way because the business is not lucrative where she lives. Aside from running the store, she also sells cosmetics.

She started out with loans from the bank, but one month ago, she made up her mind to join the community bank of EDAPROSPO thanks to her sister, who told her about the chances of savings that come with the loans. While her husband, a construction worker with a contract, pays for the electricity and the food bills, 33-year-old Florencia is responsible for covering the rest of the expenses, such as the gas bill, other utilities, and anything that their children, ages 15 and 10, may need.

In the future, she would like to expand her general store, furnish it, and install security equipment because she was recently robbed and would like to avoid being at risk.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other beverages

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia D. is 45 years old from Malalinta, San Manuel, Isabela.  Her husband Rogelio Sr. is a farmer in their village.  Their marriage was gifted with four children: Grace - 23 years old, high school graduate and working as a domestic helper in Dubai; Glenda - 18 years old, college student; Gretchen - 17 years old, high school student and Rogelio - 15 years old also a high school student.  She is thankful that \her eldest daughter assists them with their financial needs.  

Rice farming has been their main source of income.  But aside from it, she also ventured in the hog raising business as an alternative source of income.  She believes that the business could be of great help for them especially in providing the educational needs of her children.  Cecilia is requesting a loan of PHP 4, 000.00 to sustain her hog raising for she do not want to depend too much from the remittances of her daughter abroad.  She intends to use the loan to buy feeds for the hogs.  

Cecilia said that one could earn income on her own as long as she works hard.

loans.use: To sustain her hog raising business

loans.name: Fahari Yetu Group

texts.en:
Saidi J., age 40, is married with five children ages 16, 13, 9, 7 and 4.  He has a garage which he started in 2000.  He works from 8am to 7pm, daily. Saidi is able to earn a monthly profit of around $336. 

This will be Said’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the five loans to increase stock by buying spare parts, compressors and paint and has paid the loans back successfully.  He now hopes for a new loan to increase capital  and to buy more spare parts.

Said will share this loan with subgroup C of the Fahari Yetu group.  The subgroup has six members who run cafes and general stores.  These members hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.  In the picture, Said is the only man.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy more spare parts.

loans.name: Souhayla

texts.en:
Souhayla is a 54-year-old divorced woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her two children. Souhayla has owned an Internet shop since 2004. She requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise and change her shop décor. This is her second cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loan helped her improve her shop. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have the startup capital. Souhayla decided on doing her business because she had experience in computers. In the future, she plans expanding her shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and change her shop décor.

loans.name: Saroen

texts.en: Mr. Saroen S. is 29 years old and he now lives in Krasang village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. He is also a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sorn Thary, is a tailor in her house. Although this couple tries to work hard, they still can't earn enough income to build a suitable house for their family. Thus, Mr. Saroen S. decided to ask for a loan to add to his savings in order to buy timber to build the house. He has two children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy timber to build a house.

loans.name: Reyhan

texts.en:
Reyhan Z. is a 38-year-old woman who is married and has two sons.

Reyhan sells furnishings and women’s perfumes. These items are very popular among young ladies who are going to marry.

Reyhan started her business more that ten years ago when her husband passed away and she stood alone without any source of income. Now she is the owner of her own store and brings up her two sons who are high school students.

Reyhan applied for a $1500 loan to increase the number of the items she sells. Your generosity could help this brave and hardworking woman!

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Shafqat Parveen Fazal Karim Group

texts.en:
Maqbool akhtar baji and Irshad baji each want a loan to repair their auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles).

Shafqat parveen baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. These ladies belong to a city named Borewala, Pakistan. Shafqat baji is a very good human being and her members respect her a lot.

Shafqat baji runs a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. Her husband runs a grocery shop in the community, with three years experience. She is applying for a loan to diversify her husband’s grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To diversify her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Abdul Qudis

texts.en:
Abdul Qudis is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul Afghanistan. He is 50, married, and has 6 children. He has 10 years experience in the field of farming and he works hard on his land to earn money for the completion of his family member’s requirements because all of them benefit from the income he generates. 
He would like to take an individual loan of 30000 Afghani to expand his business in order to support his family members in a better way and to purchase seeds and the other required tools for his land.
Finally, he would like to mention that Kiva is such an effective process that can support the entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and required tools for farming

loans.name: Khanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Khanthy A., 48, and her husband, Mr. Hok Vorn, 58, live on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1979 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Their daughter is married and lives in the family home. One of their sons is an air-conditioner repairman, and the youngest son attends university.

Khanthy has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her parents. Her husband is a farmer. In addition, the couple also raises pigs. Khanthy asked for a previous loan to purchase piglets and silk materials for her weaving business. She is now requesting another loan of $500 to purchase feed for her pig raising business.

loans.use: To use for raising pigs.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Домуллоджонова Шахноза занимается пошивом женской и мужской одежды на дому. Своё изделия она оптом сдаёт продавцам на рынке на продажу. После первого займа она расширила свой ассортимент товара и получила хорошую прибыль.У Шахнозы сейчас много заказов на летную одежду, поэтому она хочет досрочно погасить займ и планирует закупить летную ткань на пошив женских платьев и мужских сорочек. Она благодарна кредитором за поддержку её деятельности.
texts.en:
Shahnoza D. is involved in sewing women's and men's clothing at home. She sells finished products wholesale to retailers who then sell them at a market. After her first loan, Shahnoza expanded her goods selection and received a good profit. She now has many orders for summer clothing and, thus, wants to repay her loan early and plans to purchase summer fabric in order to sew women's dresses and men's shirts. She is grateful to our creditors for supporting her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing peanuts

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa B. is 54 years old and has thirteen children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store and a rice farm. She has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client for quite a long time now.

Ninfa has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to support her sari-sari store. Basically, she will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to attract more customers in order to increase her sales.

She said she likes CEVI because, aside from charging less interest on their loans, they also bring education to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy W. is 57 years old and married. She has three children. She lives in Muguga where she has a dairy farm. She supplies milk to vendors in and around her town and to a dairy plant in the area. She has been in the business for about nine years. 

Nancy has never borrowed from another MFI. This will be her fifth loan with KADET. She intends to use the loan to buy a water pump for her her dairy farm. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to have eight cows in the next three years producing over 80 liters of milk per day. 

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying a water pump
